loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase new clothes to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Abdul

texts.en:
Abdul is a carver from Ghana who specializes in African masks. He would like to invest in a purchase of raw materials, including wood, sand paper, stain, polish and brass.

Abdul has been selling through NOVICA since 2012. This is his story:

"My father, who is also a carver, introduced me to crafts. I started with sandpapering at the age of ten after school. After I mastered that skill, I moved on to learn how to cut the brass and aluminum used to adorn the mask. I also was trained in painting masks and applying beads to them. The fixing of the beads happens to be a difficult part, but the final outcome of the artwork and their attractive, beautiful nature are what make me want to affix the beads over and over again. When I completed high school, I decided to continue in this field. I worked together with my father for a while before he agreed to let me be on my own. I work in his workshop but can sell my designs myself. I therefore have to come up with my own styles. What attracts me most about my art is creating beaded designs, because it is believed that beads are very attractive and drive attention to the work. My hope and dream is to become a renowned artist of my time."

"I am grateful to those who help to finance this microcredit."

Use the link below to view Abdul's carved African masks on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/8512

loans.use: to purchase raw materials, including wood, sand paper, stain, polish and brass.

loans.name: Aida

texts.ru: Аида, 33 года, замужем, мать 2 детей. У Аиды - среднее образование, с 2011 года она занимается животноводством. Благодаря упорному труду Аиды, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется 2 коровы, 5 овец. Ежемесячный доход составляет около 25,000 сом (KGS). На ежедневной основе Аида продает молоко местным жителям, в среднем по 20 литров. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 3 дойных коров, для увеличения объемов реализации экологически чистого, вкусного, домашнего молока. Доходы от кредита помогут Аиде в дальнейшем увеличивать поголовье скота.
texts.en: Aida is 33 years old, married, and has two children. She has an intermediate education, and has been raising livestock since 2011. Thanks to her tireless work Aida now owns two cows and five sheep. Her monthly income is around 25,000 som (KGS), and she sells on average 20 liters of milk each day to locals. In order to further develop her business she contacted Bai-Tushum Bank for a 150,000 som (KGS) loan to buy three milk cows, which will increase the volume of environmentally clean, delicious, home-produced milk she has to sell. Income from use of the loan will help expand her livestock herd.

loans.use: to buy three dairy cows so that she can sell more eco-friendly milk

loans.name: Phoebe

texts.en:
Phoebe is a married woman. She has two children. She describes herself to be visionary. She operates a grocery business where she sells groceries. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her primary customers are regular. 

Phoebe describes her biggest business challenge to be perishability of goods. She will use the Kes 40,000 loan to buy stock of tomatoes. Her business goal is to be the best within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will improve living standards of her family. This is her fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy stock of tomatoes

loans.name: Vanderlei

texts.en:
During a difficult time, Vanderlei’s friends and family pitched in and gave him a small hot dog stand. He had always enjoyed working in this industry and with this generous gift, he was able to start his own business. He has operated his hot dog stand for almost two years. Originally from Brazil, Vanderlei  runs his hot dog stand (with tent-covered seating area!) near Revere Beach in Massachusetts. It has taken a lot of hard work and Vanderlei counts a local newspaper’s interview with him as one of the highlights along this journey. 

As with many small businesses, Vanderlei says access to finance is one of the major business difficulties. He needs a loan to purchase a heating system for this winter. This will keep his customers comfortable in the biting winter wind, while enjoying a quality hot dog. When he thinks about the future, Vanderlei says, “I would like to expand for different areas and to go to college.”

loans.use: to purchase a heating system for outdoor seating area.

loans.name: Gildardo

texts.en:
Gildardo lives and works in Everett, MA. He owns a furniture store.  Gildardo is originally from Colombia and worked with Accion to develop a credit history when he opened his business four years ago.  Similar to many small business owners, Gildardo is proud to see his business grow and acquire new clients. And, like many small business owners, Gildardo knows what it is like to ask for a loan from the bank and be rejected. So, he is continuing his work with Accion.

Gildardo hopes to open another store front next year, but first, he wants to increase sales in his current spot. To do this, he needs a loan to purchase a display window to showcase sofas, bedding, beds, dining tables, and other furniture.

loans.use: to purchase a display window to showcase furniture available for sale.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 37 years old, and she is married with 2 children. Both of her children are in school, and Helen works very hard to provide for them.

Helen runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a 7,000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to buy items to sell such as shampoo, groceries, etc.

Helen has been in this business for 1 year. She sells a variety of items like soap, biscuits, canned goods, sugar, salt, etc.

In the future, Helen would like to save enough money to be able to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Merle

texts.en: Merle is a single woman. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Merle is 40 years old now. She has a fish vending business in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell. Merle has been in this business for one year. In the future, Merle would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.

loans.name: Abdul

texts.en:
Abdul is an artisan from Ghana who specializes in hand-carved African masks. He would like to invest in a purchase of raw materials, including wood, stain, sandpaper, polish and beads; and he would also like to hire more carvers to help out in his workshop.

Abdul has been selling through NOVICA since 2010. This is his story:

"I always knew I wanted to paint, but wasn't sure I could make a living out of it, so I looked into other fields too. I observed master carver Musa at his workshop for a period of time, then I picked up a log of wood and started carving out a mask as I had observed him doing. This surprised Musa and he was willing to help me perfect the skill. I developed a love for this new art, and that's how I eventually became a master carver too!"

"I really do not know how I could have grown to the stage that I have reached now without this support. I am very thankful to you all."

Use the link below to view Abdul's hand-carved African masks on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/7253

loans.use: to purchase raw materials including wood, stain, sandpaper, polish and beads; and also  to hire more carvers to help out in his workshop.

loans.name: Bernard

texts.en:
Bernard is a second year student at the Ghana Institute of Management and Public Administration. The loan is to help pay for his school fees so as to further his education. His family inspires him to achieve his dream of becoming an accountant, so that he can support them financially and put smiles on their faces for the faith they have in him.

His chosen profession interests him because he has always been good with numbers and the program he is pursuing would help develop his skills and be better at them. It would also enable him to help the people in his community and his family as well. He sees himself heading a big company in the near future and giving support to the needy in the society. Without the help of this loan he would have to stay home until help comes from either family members or people from church.

“Ghana is so peaceful and our economy is a vibrant one, so I would entreat investors to take advantage of that and help with job creation for the youth of the country.”

loans.use: to pay tuition fees.

loans.name: Godfred

texts.en:
Godfred is an artisan from Ghana who specializes in hand-carved wood masks. He would like to invest in the purchase of raw materials and equipment and tools for his workshop, including a gas lamp, a sander, and a drill. Godfred has been selling through NOVICA since 2010. This is his story: "Due to financial constraints, my parents could not further my education, and so I had to drop out of school and join my uncle, who was a wood carver. Thanks to the woodcarving, I've been able to educate my four children, and I know that with constant sales, I'll be able to give them a brighter future than I had. This motivates me to wake up each day to carve!" "I say thank you to everyone who will help fund this loan for me." Use the link below to view Godfred's hand-carved wood masks on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/7252

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of raw materials and equipment and tools for his workshop, including a gas lamp, a sander, and a drill.

loans.name: Massan Victorine

texts.fr: MASSAN est âgée de 54 ans, célibataire avec deux enfants en sa charge ; elle vit au quartier d’Adidogomé et fait le commerce de l’huile de palme communément appelé huile rouge, s’approvisionne une seule fois par mois vers Kpalimé. Elle a un niveau d’étude primaire, et vit dans une maison dont le toit est en tuile. MASSAN sollicite un microcrédit pour plus acheter, prendre en charge la scolarité de ses enfants et mieux épargner et si possible vivre un jour dans sa propre maison.
texts.en: MASSAN, aged 54, is unmarried and has two children to support; she lives in the Adidogomé district and does commerce in palm oil, commonly called red oil. She gets her supplies only once a month near Kpalimé. She has an elementary school education and lives in a house with a tile roof. MASSAN is requesting a micro-loan to purchase more merchandise, to cover her children’s schooling costs, to save more money, and if possible one day, to live in her own house.

loans.use: to purchase 21 containers of palm oil

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Gemma is 48 years old and three of her children are in school.

Gemma has a coconut wine and firewood vending business in the Philippines.  She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional stock of firewood and coconut wine to sell.  She has been in this business for three years. In the future, Gemma would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase an additional stock of firewood and coconut wine to sell.

loans.name: Lucena

texts.en:
Lucena is 56 years old and married with six children. She works very hard to provide for them.  She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like eggs, beverages, canned goods, etc.

Lucena has been in this business for two years now. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like eggs, beverages, canned goods, etc.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is a married woman with 12 children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Maria is 62 years old now.

Maria operates a food vending business in the Philippines. Maria has requested a 10,000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Maria has been in this business for 12 years. In the future, Maria would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Grâce

texts.fr: Revendeuse des céréales et de l’huile de palme, GRACE est mariée et mère de cinq enfants et est âgée de 39ans. Elle vit au quartier d’Adidogomé dans une maison qu’elle a loué et dont le toit est en tuile, puis utilise des produits mosquito pour éviter qu’elle ne soit piquée par les moustiques et ne connait pas le planning familial. GRACE s’approvisionne deux fois  par mois à Notsé et à Kati. Pour cela, GRACE souhaiterait un appui financier pour plus s’approvisionner afin d’augmenter sa marge bénéficiaire et faire un peu d’économie qui servira à soutenir son mari dans les dépenses du foyer.
texts.en: A retailer of grains and palm oil, GRACE is a married mother of five children, and she is 39 years old. She lives in the Adidogomé district in a house with a tile roof that she has rented. She uses mosquito products to avoid being bitten by mosquitos and did not know about family planning. GRACE gets her supplies twice a month in Notsé and in Kati. So, she would like financial support to stock up more in order to increase her profit margin and to save a bit of money, which will be used used to help out her husband in covering household expenses.

loans.use: to purchase 44 bowls of corn and 2 containers of palm oil

loans.name: Jorge

texts.en:
Originally from Honduras, Jorge has extensive experience in the janitorial services business. In 2011, he opened Gordo Janitorial Service in Coral Gables, FL. Jorge’s business specializes in professional cleaning of airplanes and offices. He takes great pride in owning his own business, but acknowledges “competition in the labor market and for winning contracts” can be a major challenge.

Jorge’s business has been expanding and he would like to buy office equipment and furniture for his home office. This will allow him to present himself and Gordo Janitorial Service as professional and trust-worthy.

loans.use: to purchase office equipment and furniture to upgrade his home office space, making it presentable to clients.

loans.name: Naeem

texts.en:
Naeem was born and raised in Portland, Oregon and grew up around the local music scene. He has owned Thorn City Syndicate for almost a year. Naeem says he started this business “because I found myself in a unique position where I was willing and able to help out two very talented individuals whose talents deserve to be heard.” Naeem invested his own time and money to get Thorn City Syndicate off the ground and provide the support and guidance local artists need to distribute their music.

Production quality is critical to the music experience. Naeem needs to work with a high quality production company in order to showcase his clients’ talents. This production company’s work will include listening sessions with major labels, brands, and executives. Naeem says “The business would definitely be greatly impacted immediately, giving us venues to perform at and paid placement opportunities to start generating revenue.” Naeem can see the positive outcome of this investment, but as many small business owners find out, convincing traditional banks of this potential is very difficult. Naeem needs a loan to secure a work contract with this music production company and bring Thorn City Syndicate to the next level

loans.use: to pay for a professional music production team to help record artists

loans.name: Ivy

texts.en:
Ivy opened her business, Logwood Company,  six years ago. “My company offers a fully integrated honey product that begins with the process of farming with its own bees in its own hives on the island of Jamaica,” she says. Ivy has two sons; one of them helps with the business. Originally from Jamaica, Ivy supports her mother. Ivy is most proud to see her product at over thirty Whole Foods Markets, but like many small business owners, says that access to capital is her biggest challenge. 

Ivy needs a loan to purchase inventory: like jars, caps, and labels. This inventory will help her fulfill existing orders as well as prepare for some upcoming festivals where she can showcase her products.

Check out her website: http://logwoodcompany.com/

loans.use: to pay for jars, caps, and labels to fulfill existing orders

loans.name: Paulita

texts.en:
Paulita is 63 years old and widowed with five children. She works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, beverages, groceries, etc.

Paulita has been in this business for 22 years.  In the future, Paulita would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, beverages, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Jose Martin

texts.es:
José en su búsqueda por un futuro prometedor y unas buenas oportunidades para salir adelante, decidió iniciar un negocio que según él le dará todo eso que siempre ha soñado.

Montara un negocio de tienda de abarrotes en su casa en el municipio de Montería, con el cual planea pagar sus estudios y colaborar con los gastos de su hogar en el que vive con sus padres.

Para esto necesita la ayuda de un préstamo para la compra de un enfriador, estanterías, vitrinas y surtido de productos básicos de la canasta familiar para abastecer e iniciar su negocio.

Apoya a los sueños emprendedores de un joven Colombiano con un préstamo hoy!
texts.en:
In his search for a promising future and good opportunities to get ahead, José decided to start a business. According to him, it will give him all that he has ever dreamed of.

He will put together a convenience store business at his house in the municipality of Montería. With this he plans to pay for his studies and contribute to the household expenses where he lives with his parents.

For this he needs the help of a loan to buy a cooler, shelving, display cases, and an assortment of basic consumer goods to stock up and start his business.

Support the entrepreneurial dreams of a young Colombian man with a loan today!

loans.use: to buy a cooler, shelving, display cabinets, and an assortment of basic consumer goods to stock up and start his business.

loans.name: Faamna

texts.fr: FAAMNA est commerçante d’ignames et d’huile de palme qu’elle revend dans son domicile. Agée de 43 ans, mariée et mère de quatre enfants, elle vit à Adidogomé et s’approvisionne deux fois par mois. FAAMNA loge dans une maison dont le toit est en tôle, aussi est analphabète et ne dispose pas de moyen de déplacement. Pour plus atteindre sa clientèle, FAAMNA désire un prêt en vue de réaliser ses ambitions et surtout suivre l’étude de ses enfants et mieux les soutenir dans leurs besoins y inclus leur santé.
texts.en: FAAMNA is a merchant of yams and palm oil which she sells at her home. She is 43 years old and a married mother of four living in Adidogomé. She gets her supplies twice a month. FAAMNA is staying in a house with a tile roof. Also, she is illiterate and lacks a means of transport. To earn more customers, FAAMNA would like a loan with the aim of realizing her ambitions, especially to let her children continue their education and to do better meeting their needs, including healthcare.

loans.use: to purchase a calabash of yams and a container of palm oil

loans.name: Ronet

texts.en:
Ronet is 41 years old and has seven children. She is a married woman and has four children who are in school. Ronet is in the agricultural business in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Ronet has been in the business for 15 years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. In the future, Ronet would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Adjo

texts.fr: ADJO est âgée de 35 ans, mariée et mère de six enfants, elle habite à Adidogomé et vend des tomates et gombo en s’approvisionnant une seule fois par mois au marché d’Adidogomé. ADJO vit dans une maison qu’elle a loué, dont le toit est en tôle avec une latrine traditionnelle ; elle a un niveau d’étude primaire et le foyer ne dispose pas de moyen de déplacement, aussi se soigne par automédication. ADJO sollicite  un crédit pour mieux vendre, augmenter sa marge de bénéfices et acheter les besoins de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Adjo is 35 years old, married and mother to six children.  She lives in Adidogomé and sells tomatoes and okra.  She buys her supplies once a month from the market in Adidogomé.  

Adjo lives in a rented house with a tin roof and a traditional latrine.  She attended primary school only and her household cannot afford any form of transportation.  She also treats her ailments herself as she cannot afford to visit a doctor.

Adjo has requested this loan in order to improve her sales, increase her profits and, therefore, be able to provide for the needs of her children.

loans.use: to buy 50 baskets of tomatoes and 15 baskets of okra for resale.

loans.name: Mary Galla

texts.en:
Mary Galla, 44 years old, lives in Tuburan, Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur, with her husband and four children. Her husband is a tricycle driver. Unable to sustain the needs of the family with only her husband’s income, she has found ways to attain income through snack and food vending. It began with selling a small amount of viand and snacks to their neighbors. 

She joined Paglaum Cooperative, which helped her in the capitalization of her sari-sari (small grocery) store in January of 2004. She became a MIGS member, which is why she has received loans several times already. Now, she applies for 40,000 PHP to buy merchandise for her sari-sari store. She hopes that her business will continue and someday become a mini-grocery.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her sari-sari store.

location.town: Pagadian - Tuburan, Pagadian City Zamboanga Del Su

loans.name: Melinda

texts.en:
Melinda is 45 years old, with one child. She works very hard to provide for their daily needs. Melinda runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like beverages, groceries, etc.

Melinda has been in this business for 10 years.  In the future, she would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like beverages, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Flocerpida

texts.en:
Flocerpida is 47-years-old and married with six children, four of whom are in school. Flocerpida works very hard to provide for them.

Flocerpida runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, beverages, groceries, etc.

Flocerpida has been in this business for 2 years and sells a variety of items such as rice, sugar, soap, etc.

In the future, Flocerpida would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, beverages, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Russamee

texts.en: Russamee is an artisan in Thailand who specializes in cotton handbags. She would like to make a bulk purchase of cotton fabric for her work. She has been selling through Novica since 2013. This is her story: "I started my first job as an umbrella frame maker, and I would give all my income to my parents towards the support of our family, especially for the education of the younger siblings. I started sewing when I was 12 years old and tall enough for my legs to reach the pedals. Where I come from, Sankamphaeng, is renowned for its silk and cotton, and girls are expected to know how to sew. Since people now buy their clothes at stores, I turned to making handbags, since there can be a variety of designs, uses, and beautiful styles. "It is not easy to always get the same fabric color and pattern. So, when it is available, I need to buy as much as I can and keep it on hand to be able to make more bags in the same style. This also allows me to obtain a much better price for the material. Thank you for your help with this microcredit!" Use the link below to view Russamee's cotton handbags on the Novica site: http://www.novica.com/kiva/8992

loans.use: to purchase cotton fabric in bulk

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a biodigester.

loans.name: Umwungere Group

texts.fr:
Alphonsine  fait partie du groupe  Umwungere et  habite à  Bujumbura. C’est une veuve de  39 ans, elle à 6 enfants âgés de 7 à 15 ans, tous étudient.
Elle a sous sa charge 4 enfants membres de sa famille élargie, qui étudient. 

Elle fait le commerce de  banane, huile de palme et pomme de terre depuis  17 ans. 

Elle est à  son deuxième   crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  une grande  quantité d'huile de palme à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, elle voudrait  pratiquer l’agriculture, en plus du commerce, et voir ses  enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Alphonsine is a member of the 'Umwungere' Group and lives in Bujumbura.  She is 39 years old, widowed and mother to six children between the ages of seven and fifteen.  All her children currently attend school.  Alphonsine is responsible for a further four children from her extended family, they also attend school.

Alphonsine has been selling bananas, palm oil and potatoes for seventeen years.  This is her second loan with the field partner, Turame.  She plans to use her loan to increase her working capital and buy a large quantity of palm oil for resale.

In the coming years, Alphonsine would like to start working in agriculture as well as commerce.  She would also like to see her children study.

loans.use: to increase her working capital and buy a large quantity of palm oil for resale.

loans.name: Shielamie

texts.en: Shielamie is 25 years old, and married with one child and living in Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She has a farm and grows assorted vegetables to make a living. She wants to fertilize the entire farm to restore farm nutrients. She took a new loan recently to buy organic fertilizer, to have a more productive harvest. Her future plans are to improve the entire farm, and to be able to renovate their house for a comfortable living for the entire family.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer to have a more productive harvest.

loans.name: Amanda

texts.en: Amanda is a 21-year-old, single woman with no children. She runs a small canteen in her community to earn a living. She has two years of experience with this business. Amanda needs a loan to buy sandwiches, pies, donuts, snacks, coffee, a large boiler and soft drinks. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. Amanda has been a member of SPBD since 2012.

loans.use: to buy sandwiches, pies, donuts, snacks, coffee, a large boiler and soft drinks.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is 55 years old, married, and has three children. She has been operating their own farm to make a living. 

She had successfully repaid her previous loan, used for plowing and fertilizing the farm. She had earned a more productive harvest from this investment and she still wants to fertilize the entire farm to have a more productive farm. 

Recently, Veronica took a new loan to purchase additional sacks of organic fertilizer to restore farm nutrients on the entire farm. She is planning to replant coconuts and bananas in the vacant lot, next cropping season.

loans.use: to  purchase additional sacks of organic fertilizer to restore farm nutrients on the entire farm.

loans.name: Jesusa

texts.en:
This is Jesusa. She sends you her thankfulness for your generosity because her previous loan greatly enhanced her business. She was able to buy spare parts and accessories for their vehicle. The loan also helped her provide for her family's daily needs and expenditures.

Jesusa is very positive that she can improve her business more if you will let her borrow 30,000 PHP. This new loan will go toward additional supplies of accessories and spare parts for their jeepney. Simultaneously, she can meet the needs of her family if the jeepney is regularly maintained and in good condition.

Jesusa dreams of success in her transportation business and she wants to operate a public utility bus for additional income. She meets every week with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from studying the Word of God.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for accessories, spare parts and maintenance for her jeepney.

loans.name: Dominga

texts.en:
Dominga is grateful for the previous 20,000 PHP loan, which she used to purchase quantities of raw materials needed in her business, like fabric and thread. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and for the family's personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another loan, for 40,000 PHP, to buy additional supplies of raw materials needed in her business. Her profits will definitely help her to meet her daily needs and pay for her children’s education. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Dominga wants her business to become more established and sustainable. She meets up weekly with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business and draw strength and inspiration from fellowship and studying the Word of God.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for fabric, thread, needles, and other materials

loans.name: Kaliman

texts.ru: Калиман, 57 лет, замужем, дети взрослые, живут отдельно. У Калиман среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи она занимается полеводством и животноводством, стартовав 39 лет назад благодаря упорству, целеустремленности и трудолюбию Калиман, на сегодняшний день у нее есть: 4 коровы, 6 бычков, 25 овец и 1 лошадь. Также есть земельный надел мерою 16,0 ГА, где она сеет ячмень, пшеницу, картофель, фасоль и эспарцет. Супруг Калиман занимается пасекой. Калиман обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 130,000 сом (KGS) для закупки 4 бычков и одной дойной коровы. Она намерена развивать свой бизнес, чтобы накопить средства и купить автомобиль для семьи и ведения бизнеса.
texts.en: Kaliman is 57 years old, married, and has grown children who live apart from her. Kaliman has an intermediate education. To earn her family's primary source of income she farms and raises livestock. She began the business 39 years ago, and thanks to her perseverance, determination and hard work today she owns four cows, six calves, 25 sheep, and a horse. She also has 16 hectares of land where she grows barley, wheat, potatoes, beans, and sainfoin. Her husband is a beekeeper. Kaliman approached Bai-Tushum Bank for a 130,000 som (KGS) loan to buy four calves and a dairy cow. She intends to expand her business so that she can save money and buy a vehicle for the family and business.

loans.use: to buy four bull-calves and a dairy cow in order to grow her business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to increase her working capital and buy a large quantity of tomatoes and clothing for resale.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.en: Pedro is an artisan from Guatemala who specializes in silver and gemstone jewelry. He would like to make a bulk purchase of jade and pure silver for his work. He has been selling through Novica since 2011. This is his story: "When I was 20, I began working in a silver workshop and my passion for making handcrafted jewelry was born. I specialized in engraving silver and have had my own workshop since 1980; it's a simple place, but I have all the tools and space I need to work. I am very grateful for this wonderful opportunity you are giving me and my artisan community in Guatemala. "I am very thankful for your support through this microcredit, as it will allow me to purchase the materials I need to continue crafting my jewelry. This is especially important this time of year, with the holiday rush about to take place. Gracias!" Use the link below to view Pedro's silver and gemstone jewelry on the Novica site: http://www.novica.com/kiva/8193

loans.use: to purchase jade and pure silver in bulk.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Maria is 45 years old and unmarried, with five children. She has a small plantation where she grows taro and bananas that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for two years. Maria needs a loan to buy fertilizer, chemicals, a crowbar, a spade and a wheelbarrow. She has been a member of SPBD since 2012. Maria will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, chemicals, a crowbar, a spade and a wheelbarrow

loans.name: Eseta

texts.en: Eseta is a 48-year-old, married woman with five children. She makes and sells ice-cakes in her community to earn a living. She has one year of experience with this business. Eseta needs a loan to buy cordials, sugar, a large cooler, a new chest freezer, chinese candy and foam cups. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. Eseta has been a member of SPBD since 2014.

loans.use: to buy cordials, sugar, a large cooler, a new chest freezer, chinese candy and foam cups.

loans.name: Iokapeta

texts.en:
Iokapeta is 42 years old and unmarried with one child. She has a small plantation where she grows taro and bananas that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for 3 years. 

Iokapeta needs a loan to buy chemicals, fertilizer, a new wheelbarrow, a tiller, a rake, new gum boots and a spade. She has been a member of SPBD since 2011. She will use the profits from her sales to pay for her families weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy equipment and supplies.

loans.name: Senerita

texts.en:
Senerita is 60 years old and married with 7 children. She makes and sells elei printed material to earn a living and has been doing this for 5 years. 

Senerita has requested a loan to buy material, fabric paint, stencils, brushes, rollers, wooden carved designs, and a new cutter. She plans to use her profits to pay for her families weekly expenses. She joined SPBD in 2009 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy equipment and supplies.

loans.name: Mate

texts.en:
Mate is a 24 year old single woman with no children. She runs a small coffee shop in her community to earn a living. She has one year of experience running this business. 

Mate needs a loan to buy coffee, sugar, milk, a boiler, foam cups, plastic bags, and noodles. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. Mate has been a member of SPBD since 2014.

loans.use: to buy more stock.

loans.name: Sitivi

texts.en: Sitivi is 40 years old and single with no children. She owns and operates a small store, selling a variety of items. She has been doing this for seven years. Sitivi needs a loan to buy a chest freezer, snacks, frozen goods, canned food, and sacks of onions and potatoes. She hopes to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. She became a member of SPBD in 2007 to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to buy a chest freezer, snacks, frozen goods, canned food, and sacks of onions and potatoes.

loans.name: Lole

texts.en: Lole is 44 years old and married with six children. She owns and operates a small store, selling a variety of items. She has been doing this for nine years. Lole needs a loan to buy a cash register machine, snacks, a scale, drinks, cigarettes, canned items, frozen goods and two new chest freezers. She hopes to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. She became a member of SPBD in 2005 to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to buy a cash register machine, snacks, a scale, drinks, cigarettes, canned items, frozen goods and two new chest freezers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to provide working capital to advertise her company on radio, TV and billboards

loans.name: Gulsara

texts.ru: Гульсара, 51 год, замужем, мать 2 детей. С 1991 года занимается торговлей женской одежды и обуви в одном из магазинов города. Образование у Гульсары высшее, она очень трудолюбивая и ответственная. Продукция пользуется большим спросом и приносит ежемесячную прибыль в среднем 35,000 сом (KGS). Гульсара обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом, в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на расширение ассортимента товаров в магазине, а именно зимней одежды и обуви, так как она спрогнозировала большой спрос на этот сезон. Увеличив товарооборот, Гульсара сможет расширить свой магазин, получать больше прибыли и накопить средства на свадьбу сына.
texts.en: Gulsara is 51 years old, married, and has two children. She has been selling women's clothing and shoes in one of the city's stores since 1991. Gulsara has a higher education, and she is very hard working and responsible. There is high demand for her products, which earns her on average 35,000 som (KGS) in monthly income. Gulsara contacted Bai-Tushum Bank for a 150,000 som (KGS) loan to widen the assortment of goods in her store, specifically winter clothes and shoes, since she expects high demand this season. Once her turnover has increased Gulsara can expand her store, earn more income, and save for her son's wedding.

loans.use: to buy women's clothes and shoes for resale in order to increase the inventory in her shop and be more competitive

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en: Joyce is a determined housewife and would make ends meet through her sari-sari (general) store. She joined PMPC because she needs capital. She has applied for a loan to restock her store with soft drinks, noodles, and canned goods. She hopes to double her profit by having enough inventory and not missing selling opportunities. She wishes to sustain her business so she can send all her children to school, and she would love to save some of her profits to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to restock her store with soft drinks, noodles, and canned goods

loans.name: Ndungiri Muthingi Women Group

texts.en:
The person raising her hand in the photograph is Hannah, a member of Ndungiri Muthingi Women Group. She is 28 years old, married, and blessed with three children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in 2013. 

After undergoing Hand in Hand Eastern Africa training on enterprise development and financial management, Hannah commercialized her vegetable farm, which now earns her income that caters for her family food, clothing and school fees for her daughter. She is borrowing from Kiva to buy dairy goats in order to diversify her sources of income. Hannah is grateful to Kiva and their lenders and promises to repay her loan promptly.

loans.use: to buy dairy goats.

loans.name: Maila

texts.en: Maila is a 26-year-old, single woman with seven children. She makes and sells pancakes in her community to earn a living. She has three years of experience with this business. Maila needs a loan to buy bags of flour and sugar, a large frying pan, a new oven, cooking oil, a strainer and yeast. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. Maila has been a member of SPBD since 2011.

loans.use: to buy bags of flour and sugar, a large frying pan, a new oven, cooking oil, a strainer and yeast.

loans.name: Douglas

texts.en:
Douglas is a married man and he has five children. He describes himself to be visionary. He operates a welding business where he makes metallic doors, chairs, gates and other items. His primary customers are regular. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insecurity. 

He will use the KES 100,000 loan to buy a welding machine. His business goal is to be the best in welding within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will raise the living standards of his family. His previous loan was repaid successfully. He will use the anticipated profits to put up a permanent house for his family.

loans.use: to buy a welding machine.

loans.name: Abed

texts.en:
Abed is a 28-year-old single Palestinian man who started two years ago working as a carpenter to cover the needs and expenses of his family.

Today, Abed is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to renovate his house and make it a better and healthier place for his family.

He hopes to open his own carpenter shop in the future to keep his family satisfied and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to renovate his house.

loans.name: Tusipo

texts.en: Tusipo is 36 years old and married, with four children. She has a small plantation where she grows taro and bananas that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for six years. Tusipo needs a loan to buy crops, overalls, gloves, chemicals, fertilizer, a new wheelbarrow and a crowbar. She has been a member of SPBD since 2008. Tusipo will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy crops, overalls, gloves, chemicals, fertilizer, a new wheelbarrow and a crowbar.

loans.name: Kabuswa Moricho Group

texts.en:
The person raising her hand in the photo is Mary, a member of Kabuswa Moricho group. She is 27 years old, married, and a mother of three. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa (HIH EA) in October 2013. She does maize and bean farming. Through HiH EA training, she has acquired skills in enterprise development, business record keeping and financial management. She has also been able to commercialize her farming business. 

Mary is borrowing a Kiva loan to purchase fertilizer and quality seeds for the coming season. This will greatly boost her crop yield, hence increasing income, which will enable her cater for the children’s education, clothing, food and other family needs. Mary is grateful to Kiva and their lenders and promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Manuela Isabel

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Nuevo Amanecer se reúne en el sitio Bajo de Montecristi en la provincia de Manabí, es un pequeño lugar rodeado de mucha vegetación, sus habitantes se dedican a diferentes ocupaciones, como comerciantes, y empelados de fabricas.
En este lugar vive la señora Manuela, tiene 45 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos, dos mayores de edad y una chica de 17 años la cual estudia en colegio dos de sus hijos aun viven con ella. Su esposo es agricultor.
Doña Manuela tiene una tienda de víveres en su casa en la cual vende todo tipo de productos, como arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes, entre otras cosas, trabaja todos los días desde las 7h00 hasta las 16h00, sus hijos le  ayudan en su trabajo cuando están desocupados, los productos los compra en Montecristi y algunos los  recibe en su local.  Lleva 20 años con su negocio y le ha ido muy bien, le gusta su negocio porque le ha permitido ganarse la vida y estar al tanto de todas las necesidades de sus hijos cuando la han necesitado.
Este crédito es para surtir mas su tienda, va a comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, detergentes, embutidos y otros productos de primera necesidad. Está en el Grupo De Crédito hace 7 años y le gusta porque los créditos le permiten mejorar su negocio. Sus sueños son ver que su hija termine sus estudios.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Nuevo Amanecer" (New Sunrise) meets in Bajo de Montecristi in the Manabi province. It is a small space surrounded by plush vegetation and Its inhabitants make a living in a variety of occupations such as merchants and factory workers. This is where Mrs. Manuela lives, she is 45 years old and married with tree children. Two of them are of age and her daughter is 17 years old and is a student. Two of her children still live with her. Her husband is a farmer. 
Mrs. Manuela has a little supplies store in her house out of which she sells all kinds of products such as rice, sugar, oil, and detergents among other things. She works every day from 7:00 a.m. to 4:00 p.m. and her children help her at work when they are free. She buys the products in Montecristi and some she has shipped to her store. She has been running this business for the past 20 years and has done quite well for herself. She enjoys this business because it has allowed her to make a living for herself and able to provide for all of her children's necessities when they have needed her.
She will be using this loan to stock the store, she will buy rice, sugar, oil, detergents, cold cuts and other basic necessities. She has been in the communal bank for the past 7 years and likes it because the loans help her improve her business. Her dream is to see her daughter finish her studies.

loans.use: purchase rice, sugar, oil, detergents, cold cuts and other basic necessities

loans.name: Kilwa Group

texts.en:
Janeth, who is in her mid 40s, is single with two kids, one of them is still in school and the other one is grown-up. She has been a food vendor for five years now. She works from 05am to 10pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Janeth's first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She will use this loan to improve the place where she sells her food, to increase the food stock and to start selling drinks. She dreams of opening a shop where she can serve her food properly because the place where she sells her food now is not convenient - for example if it rains, the place becomes wet and when it is dry it the place is just too hot.

Janeth will share this loan with her loan group "KILWA" which consist of six members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to improve the place where she serves food, to increase on the food stock and to start selling drinks.

loans.name: Vingunguti Group

texts.en:
Obedi, who is in his mid 20s is single. He has been running a general store for four years now. He works from 06am to 09pm daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be Obedi's 3rd loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans to restock the out of stock items in his store and has paid back all his loans successfully. He is happy with the loan. He used the profit to pay rent and covered household expenses. He will use this loan to increase the inventory in his general store. He dreams of buying a plot of land.

Obedi will share this loan with his loan group "Vingunguti" which consist of four members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to increase the inventory of his general store.

loans.name: Awurade Beye Group

texts.en:
These six members of the Awurade Beye group are on average aged 40 years old with two children. They all live in Teshie-Accra and became acquainted through neighborhood ties and their income-generating activities. Group members are retail traders of general goods, lining, ice kenkey, mother-care products and stationary. 

In order to increase their operating capital, the group decided to work with ID Ghana. They are on their seventh group loan cycle with ID Ghana, and first cycle with Kiva. 

Florence (the woman standing third from right in the photo) is a stationary seller. She intends to use her loan to buy assorted books, pen, erasers, mathematical sets, etc. in Accra, and sell to customers at the market. She is married with two dependent children, and hopes to attain with this loan a good profit, to be reinvested in the business and also support her husband to take care of their children.

loans.use: To buy assorted books, pen, erasers, mathematical sets to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock of maize.

loans.name: Motuli

texts.en:
Motuli is 44 years old and married with 7 children. She has a large plantation and a vegetable garden where she makes good profit after harvesting every month. She has been doing this for 6 years. 

Motuli needs a loan to buy seedlings, chemicals, new wheelbarrows, crops, pots, rolls of screen wire, a spade and overalls. She has been a member of SPBD since 2008. Motuli will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy seedlings, chemicals, new wheelbarrows, crops, pots, rolls of screen wire, a spade and overalls.

loans.name: Hana

texts.en: Hana is 44 years old and unmarried with four children. She has a large farm that raises cattle and prepares them for sale to local shops and large supermarkets. She has been doing this for 12 years. Hana needs a loan to buy barbed wire, timber, nails, iron poles, cattle food, a large wooden tub, a water tank and a secondhand pickup for transportation. She has been a member of SPBD since 2002. Hana will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy barbed wire, timber, nails, iron poles, cattle food, a large wooden tub, a water tank and a secondhand pickup for transportation.

loans.name: Faasaveve

texts.en:
Faasaveve is 46 years old and married with 6 children. She owns and operates a small store, selling a variety of items. She has been doing this for 10 years. 

Faasaveve needs a loan to buy a new chest freezer, a display fridge, frozen goods, washing powder, canned items and snacks. She hopes to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. She became a member of SPBD in 2004 to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to buy a new chest freezer, a display fridge, frozen goods, washing powder, canned items and snacks.

loans.name: Kibondo Group

texts.en:
Zainabu who is in her late 20s, is single with two daughters who are still at school. She has been running a beauty salon for one year now.  She works from 09am to 08pm daily and is able to make a very small monthly profit. This is because she has just started her business.

This will be Zainabu's first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She will use this loan buy  beauty salon products to meet her customers' requirements. She dreams of opening another salon in a different area. 

Zainabu will share this loan with her loan group "Kibondo" which consist of nine members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy beauty salon products to meet her customers' requirements.

loans.name: Semira Del Pilar

texts.es:
Semira es una joven muy entusiasta y con muchas ganas de salir adelante. Desde hace varios años trabaja como anfitriona en distintos eventos a los cuales es contratada y con los ingresos que obtiene ayuda a sus padres en los gastos del hogar. es una joven muy servicial, amable y alegre.
Semira quiere mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia por ello piensa utilizar el crédito otorgado para poder comprar un televisor para su casa. Ella está muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva por su generosidad ya que podrá disfrutar junto a su familia de sus momentos libres viendo sus programas preferidos. Más adelante espera empezar a estudiar la carrera de computación y convertirse en una profesional exitosa.
texts.en:
Semira is an enthusiastic young lady with a strong desire to get ahead. She has been working for the past several years as a hostess at different events for which she has been hired. With the income she earns she helps her parents with the household expenses. She is a very helpful, kind and happy young lady. 
Semira wants to improve her family's quality of life and this is the reason she wants to utilize this loan to purchase a television for her home. She is very thankful for the Kiva lenders for their generosity since she will be able to enjoy, along with her family, her free time watching their favorite shows. In the future she hopes to start studying a career in computer engineering and become a successful professional.

loans.use: purchase a television for her home.

loans.name: Jhambesworaya Shg Group

texts.en:
Mamina is a 23-year-old woman from Mayurbhanj district in Odisha, India. Mamina is married and has four children. Mamina is the individual pictured with her raised hand, first from right hand side. Her husband has been suffering from a serious desease for the last two years and she is the only one earning in her family.    

Mamina is a member of a self-help group that has been in vegetable cultivation and selling business for the last year. They also buy vegetables in bulk from other farmers to resell. The name of the group is ‘Jhambesworaya Shg’. Mamina earns a good profit from the business as the group has been trained by Peoples Forum on how to improve their vegetable cultivation and selling business. As such, they can always produce all types of vegetables for the local markets and non-local markets.

Mamina and her group have asked for a loan. Mamina’s share of the loan will help her to buy more vegetables in bulk to resell. Mamina aspires to earn more income, as well as to repay this loan and support her husband's health and children's educational needs.

Mamina thanks Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables in bulk to resell.

loans.name: Maa Hingula Shg Group

texts.en:
This is the little story about a lady living in the village of Mayurbhanj district, Odisha, India. The lady had a low financial status with a poor living standard. The lady was herself responsible for all the financial situation of her family. The family consist of 6 other people including her 4 kids, a mother-in-law, and husband respectively. She is facing lot of problems while trying to make them happy. Her name is Jayanti, she is aged 42 years.

Maa Hingula SHG is a group consisting of 13 members of whom all are women. However, Peoples Forum gave her a way to start to fullfill her dream of happy family proving an amount of 15,000 INR per member as a loan. She took the loan under the Peoples Forum scheme to invest in her current business of jute rope making and supplying to various traders and whole sellers. This will give her a new way of living by increasing her financial standard and by sending her kids to school.

She says the increased profit will help her to provide the daily medicine her mother-in-law needs. Both the couple are engaged with the same business and both are liable to pay the installments of the loan amount.

She will use her portion to buy jute and other raw materials.

loans.use: to buy jute and other raw materials for jute rope making.

loans.name: Vadim

texts.en:
Vadim is married. He has two adult daughters. Vadim has his own business.

Vadim has been growing vegetables in greenhouses for a long time. He is a great specialist and a kind person. Vadim wants to develop his business further. Additional revenue will help Vadim to take better care of his family needs.

Vadim is asking for a loan of 30,100 UAH to repair the old greenhouses and build new ones.

loans.use: to repair the old greenhouses and build new ones.

loans.name: Kilimanjaro Group

texts.en:
Idrisa who is in his early 30s, is single with one kid who is still small. He has been running a business transporting sand with his tipper (a big lorry) for five years now. He works from 05am to 08pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit. 

This will be Idrisa's second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loan to buy more sand to resell and has paid back his loan successfully.  He used the profit to take care of himself and covered house hold expenses. He will use this loan to buy and transport sand to the client's site. He dreams of buying a bigger lorry.

Idrisa will share this loan with his loan group "Kilimanjaro" which has three members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy and transport sand to the client's site.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John who is in his late 30s, is married with two children one of them is in school and the other one is still small. He has been selling fish since 1999. He works from 08am to 09pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit  

This will be John's third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans to buy a motorcycle and increased the fish stock. He has managed to pay back all his loans successfully. He used the profit to pay school fees, bought a plot of land and covered household expenses. He will use this loan to increase the fish stock and to add some money in order to buy a bajaji (rickshaw). He dreams of traveling upcountry and buy a good stock of fish to sell at wholesale price.

John will make sure he pays back his loan according to the loan schedule.

loans.use: to increase the fish stock and to add some money in order to buy a bajaji.

loans.name: Nelly Norma

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Nuevo Amanecer se reúne en el sitio Bajo de Montecristi en la provincia de Manabí, es un pequeño lugar rodeado de mucha vegetación, sus habitantes se dedican a diferentes ocupaciones, como comerciantes, y empleados de fabricas.
En este lugar vive la señora Nelly, tiene 59 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen seis hijos mayores de edad, cuatro de sus hijos aun viven con ella. Su esposo es artesano.
Doña Nelly es una muy buena esposa que realiza el crédito para ayudarle a su esposo en su negocio, el tiene una fábrica de ladrillos (material que sirven para la construcción de viviendas) trabaja de lunes a sábado junto a tres personas  a quienes les paga  un sueldo semanal, ellos se encargan de fabricar este producto para luego llevarlo en su carro a otras ciudades a entregar en las distintos lugares que requieren de este material de construcción tan necesario.
Este crédito es para comprar arcilla para la fabricación de los ladrillos. Esta desde el inicio en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por los beneficios que recibe en el grupo. Sus sueños son comprar otro carro para llevar sus productos a vender.
texts.en:
The Nuevo Amanecer (New Dawn) communal bank meets in Bajo de Montecristi in the Manabi province. It is a small place surrounded by plush vegetation. Its inhabitants make a living through various occupations such as merchants and factory workers. Here lives Mrs. Nelly, she is 59 years old, married and has six children, all of age. Four of her children still live with her. Her husband is an artisan. 
Mrs. Nelly is a very good wife who is requesting the loan to help her husband with his business. He has a brick building factory and works Monday through Saturday with three other people who he pays on a weekly basis. They are in charge of making the product and then they take it in his car to other cities and deliver it to the various places that require this essential material for construction. 
This loan will be used to purchase clay for the fabrication of the bricks. She has been with the bank since its beginning and she likes it because of the benefits she receives for being a part of it. Her dream is to purchase another car to deliver her products for sale.

loans.use: purchase clay.

loans.name: Ana Del Carmen

texts.es:
Ana ha sido ama de casa desde que se casó, siempre pendiente del cuidado de su familia pero, vive en unión libre con su esposo y con sus 2 hijos; desde siempre le ha gustado trabajar como comerciante independiente, comenzó a vender mercancía como ropa y cosméticos pues era responsable de llevar la carga económica del hogar con su esposo y necesitaba generar los recursos para hacerlo. 

Sus clientes son vecinos, familiares y amigos del sector, trabaja sola todos los días y encuentra en su labor la ventaja de poder estar pendiente de su familia, al mismo tiempo que logra ser productiva como comerciante.

Actualmente solicita el crédito para comprar surtido al por mayor (Ropa, perfumería, cosméticos, accesorios, entre otros), esto le permitirá abastecerse con más variedad para satisfacer la demanda que se incrementa en la temporada de navidad, dando como resultado la obtención de mejores ingresos para su familia.

Ana manifiesta que su mayor anhelo es poder seguir apoyando económicamente a su familia y dar educación a todos sus hijos, para verlos convertirse en profesionales, para que tengan un futuro próspero y exitoso.
texts.en:
Ana has been a housewife since she got married. She has always taken care of her family. She is in a common-law marriage and lives with her husband and two children. She has always enjoyed working as an independent merchant. She started selling merchandise, such as clothing and cosmetics, because she was responsible for her household finances, along with her husband, and needed to generate financial resources.

Her clients are neighbors, relatives, and friends from her area. She works alone every day and has the advantage of being able to take care of her family while also managing to be a productive merchant.

She is now applying for a loan to buy wholesale merchandise (clothing, perfume, cosmetics, accessories, and others). This will allow her to stock her business with a greater variety of products to satisfy her clients' demand, which increases during the Christmas season. As a result, she can earn the best income for her family.

Ana says that her greatest wish is to be able to continue supporting her family financially, to give an education to all of her children, and to see them become professionals so they can have a prosperous and successful future.

loans.use: to buy wholesale merchandise (clothing, perfume, cosmetics, accessories, and others) to stock her business.

loans.name: Kanlé Démanya

texts.fr: KANLE, mariée et mère d’un seul enfant et âgée de 46 ans, est vendeuse de boules d’akassa faite à base du maïs, vivant au quartier Adidogomé ; elle s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché d’Adidogomé assiyéyé et vit dans une maison dont le toit est en tuile, se soigne par automédication et n’a aucune notion de planning familial. KANLE demande un prêt pour soutenir son commerce, aller à l’intérieur du pays pour acheter du maïs un peu moins cher qu’Adidogomé afin qu’elle puisse réaliser beaucoup de bénéfice et faire face aux besoins du foyer qui sont multiples.
texts.en:
Kanlé, a 46-year-old married woman and the mother of one child, sells boules d'akassa [steamed balls of a thick cornmeal porridge] made from corn and lives in the Adidogomé neighborhood. Kanlé gets her supplies twice a month from the Adidogomé Assiyéyé market. She lives in a house with a tiled roof, takes care of her own medical needs and knows nothing about family planning.

Kanlé is requesting a loan to support her business and go inland to purchase corn a little less expensively than in Adidogomé, so that she can make as much profit as possible in order to meet the household expenses, which are numerous.

loans.use: To purchase seven bowls of corn.

loans.name: Magali Del Rocio

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Nuevo Amanecer se reúne en el sitio Bajo de Montecristi en la provincia de Manabí, es un pequeño lugar rodeado de mucha vegetación, sus habitantes se dedican a diferentes ocupaciones, como comerciantes, y empleados de fábricas.
En este lugar vive la señora Magali, tiene 40 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de 11 y 6  de edad, ambos estudian en escuela. Su esposo es chofer.
Doña Magali es una joven mujer que para obtener sus propios recursos y con esto poder salir adelante y ayudarles a sus padres que son de escasos recursos  se dedica a la venta de productos naturales y cosméticos de Avon (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja tres días a la semana fuera de casa y en su casa cuando sus clientes así lo deseen, ella deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada ocho días. Tiene 6 años que se dedica a esta actividad la cual le permite ganar algo por el bien de su familia.
Este crédito es para comprar productos naturales, perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y bisuterías. Lleva 4 años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque con los créditos financia su negocio. Sus sueños son darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The "Nuevo Amanecer" ("New Dawn") communal bank holds meetings in Bajo de Montecristi in the province of Manabí. It is a small place surrounded by plenty of vegetation. The local people work in various professions, such as trade and factory work. 

Magali, 40, lives in this area. She is married with two children, ages 6 and 11, both of whom are in school. Her husband is a driver.

Magali is a young woman who sells natural products and Avon cosmetics (beauty products, cosmetics, perfume, and women's accessories) to earn her own income, get ahead, and provide for her parents, who have limited financial resources. She works three days a week away from home, as well as at home whenever her clients wish. She sells products on credit and collects every eight days. She has had this business activity for six years, which allows her to earn some money for her family.

She will use this loan to buy natural products, perfume, creams, cosmetics, and jewelry. She has been with the communal bank for four years, and she likes it because she finances her business with the loans. Her dream is to give the best to her children.

loans.use: to buy natural products, perfume, creams, cosmetics, and jewelry.

loans.name: Tulipe

texts.en:
Tulipe is a 30-year-old married woman with 6 children. She sells a variety of sodas in her community to earn a living. She has one year of experience with this business. 

Tulipe needs a loan to buy dozens of sodas, a large cooler, a large chest freezer and plastic bags. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. Tulipe has been a member of SPBD since 2014.

loans.use: to buy dozens of sodas, a large cooler, a large chest freezer and plastic bags.

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en:
Theresa is 38 years old and unmarried with three children. She has a small plantation where she grows taro that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for 3 years. 

Theresa needs a loan to buy fertilizer, a spade, chemicals, a machete, sprayers, a wheelbarrow, a crowbar, and new boots. She has been a member of SPBD since 2011. Theresa will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy equipment and supplies.

loans.name: Selema

texts.en:
Selema is a 52 year old married woman with 6 children. She runs a small fishing business in her community to earn a living. She has 3 years of experience with this business. 

Selema needs a loan to buy a new fishing canoe, a large cooler, a chest freezer, hooks, baits, flippers and new goggles. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. 

Selema has been a member of SPBD since 2011.

loans.use: to buy a new fishing canoe, a large cooler, a chest freezer, hooks, baits, flippers and new goggles

loans.name: Saumaleula

texts.en:
Saumaleula is 49 years old and unmarried with 2 children. She has a large plantation where she grows taro and bananas that she can sell in her community or at the market.  She also runs a canteen to earn extra money.  She has been doing this for 11 years. 

Saumaleula needs a loan to buy chemicals, fertilizer, a new wheelbarrow, a tiller, a rake, new gum boots and a spade for her plantation, and for her canteen she needs to buy a boiler and loaves of bread. She has been a member of SPBD since 2003.  Saumaleula will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: buy farm and canteen supplies

loans.name: Paula

texts.en:
Paula is a 34-year-old married woman with 3 children. She has a small taxi business to earn an income. She has 2 years with this business. 

Paula needs a loan to buy a new taxi sign indicator, new seat covers, air-con re-fill, and petrol. She will use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. Paula joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: repair her taxi & buy gas

loans.name: Flo

texts.en:
Flo is 38 years old and married with 6 children. She makes and sells elei printed material to earn a living and has been doing this for 2 years. 

Flo has requested a loan to buy a cutter, stencils, material, wooden carved designs, fabric paint and brushes. She plans to use her profits to pay for her families weekly expenses. She joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: buy printed fabrics supplies

loans.name: Salome

texts.en:
Salome is 44 years old and married with 3 children. She owns and operates a shop, selling a variety of items. She has been doing this for 3 years. 

Salome needs a loan to buy 2 chest freezers, canned items, frozen goods, snacks, cigarettes and a new hanging scale. She hopes to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses and also to help with the expansion of her business. She became a member of SPBD in 2011 to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: buy freezers & restock her store

loans.name: Kerupi

texts.en:
Kerupi is 43 years old and married with 6 children. She has a small plantation where she grows taro and bananas that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for 2 years. 

Kerupi needs a loan to buy fertilizer, gloves, chemicals, a new wheelbarrow and crops. She has been a member of SPBD since 2012. Kerupi will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: buy fertilizer, gloves, chemicals, a new wheelbarrow and crops

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
Ana is a 50-year-old unmarried woman with 5 children. She makes and sells Samoan-made chips in her community to earn a living. She has 6 years of experience with this business. 

Ana needs a loan to buy bananas, taro, salt, seasonings, plastic bags and a plastic sealer. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. Ana has been a member of SPBD since 2008.

loans.use: buy supplies for her food business

loans.name: Telesia

texts.en:
Telesia is a 30-year-old unmarried woman with 5 children. She runs a small canteen in her community to earn a living. She has 2 years of experience with this business. 

Telesia needs a loan to buy pies, sandwiches, snacks, drinks, foam cups, plastic bags and tomato sauce. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. Telesia has been a member of SPBD since 2012.

loans.use: buy supplies for her food business

loans.name: Filomena

texts.en:
Filomena is 26 years old and unmarried with 3 children. She has a small vegetable garden where she grows cabbages and tomatoes that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for 1 year. 

Filomena needs a loan to buy fertilizer, chicken manure, chemicals, a pitch-fork, gloves and gum boots. She has been a member of SPBD since 2014. Filomena will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: buy farming inputs & supplies

loans.name: Salafai

texts.en:
Salafai is a 52-year-old married woman with 6 children. She runs a small canteen in her community to earn a living. She has 3 years of experience with this business. 

Salafai needs a loan to buy a new oven, pots, plates, drinking glasses, sets of spoons and forks. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. Salafai has been a member of SPBD since 2011.

loans.use: buy supplies for her food business

loans.name: Ismail

texts.en:
Ismail is a 55-year-old married man from Gaza city. He was living with his wife and two kids (a son and a daughter) in a small house, but this house was damaged directly during the last violence on Gaza. Ismail and his family are now living in a relative's home. Ismail works as an employee in the municipality where he gets a low income. 

Ismail took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to clean the debris and rebuild part of his home so he and his family can go back to their home. 

Ismail appears in the photo next to his damaged home.

loans.use: to clean the debris and rebuild part of his home so he and his family can go back to their home.

loans.name: Witness

texts.en:
Witness is a 26-year-old woman who is single with no children. She runs a small tailoring business in her community. She has one year of experience with this business.

Witness joined SPBD in 2014 to gain access to financial services. She has requested a loan to buy a new sewing machine, thread, needles, a measuring tape, a new pair of scissors, and material. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine, thread, needles, a measuring tape, a new pair of scissors and material

loans.name: Mele

texts.en:
Mele is 43 years old and married with 4 children. She has a small vegetable garden where she grows cabbages and tomatoes that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for 5 years.

Mele needs a loan to buy insect poison, fertilizer, a new wheelbarrow, a tiller, a rake, new gloves, and a watering hose. She has been a member of SPBD since 2009. Mele will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy insect poison, fertilizer, a new wheelbarrow, a tiller, a rake, new gloves, and a watering hose

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to install pipelines and buy building materials to renovate his home.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase raw materials such as textiles and yarns for her sewing workshop.

loans.name: Mohammed

texts.en:
Mohammed is a 42-year-old married man and father of 6 children, living with his family in an old and small house in Taiz city, Yemen. He is the sole breadwinner for the family but his income is not enough to cover the necessary needs of the house. 

The house where Mohammed and his family live is very old and it needs renovation. Mohammed doesn't have enough money to do it. He knows this  needs a lot of money. In order to renovate his old house, Mohammed applied for a loan of 150,000 YER from AMB  to purchase construction materials to renovate his house from the inside. 

Mohammed looks forward to providing his children with a better future.

loans.use: renovate his house

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase construction materials in order to attract a lot of customers to his store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine to enlarge his business.

loans.name: Leonia

texts.en:
Leonia is 59 years old and a widow with 7 children. She owns and operates a small flea market selling a variety of items. She has been doing this for 6 years.

Leonia became a member of SPBD in 2008 to gain access to capital for her business. She needs a loan to buy Samoan t-shirts, printed material, kava bowls, coconut carved earrings, bangles, and Samoan-designed caps. She hopes to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses and help with the expansion of her business.

loans.use: to buy Samoan t-shirts, printed material, kava bowls, coconut carved earrings, bangles, and Samoan-designed caps

loans.name: Isapela

texts.en:
Isapela is 36 years old and married with 5 children. She has a small vegetable garden where she grows cabbages and tomatoes that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for 3 years.

Isapela has been a member of SPBD since 2011. She needs a loan to buy chemicals, fertilizer, a wheelbarrow, gloves, overalls, a tiller, and seedlings. She will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, fertilizer, a wheelbarrow, gloves, overalls, a tiller, and seedlings

loans.name: Sonnita

texts.en:
Sonnita (in the photo) is 18 years old, single and lives with her family in Kean Svay District along the Mekng river. She is a student and work as waitress at a restaurant and coffee park in Phnom Penh City for three months.

Sonnita is studying for her Bachelor's degree. She is now in year one semester. She would likes to apply for a loan for pay for her school fee. She will graduate in 2017. In spite of this, she hopes that after graduating from the university, she will became an accountant at a company in the future.

loans.use: To pay for her school fees.

loans.name: Sokhon

texts.en: Sokhon (pictured), 53 years old, lives in the Angsnoul district, Phnom Penh, Cambodia. She has been married since 1979 and has three sons who attend school. Sokhon has been a farmer for 20 years and her husband is a retired public officer. Sokhon would like to apply for a loan to buy a motorbike for her sons to go to school every day.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for her sons to go to school.

loans.name: Xasa

texts.en: Xasa is married and she has two children. They are living in the Absheron region. Xasa works in the store where she has sold different daily useful things, for 10 years. This store was opened by Xasa and her husband. Today Xasa wants to support the family business and for that she needs a loan in the amount of 2300 AZN (Azerbaijan new manat). With this amount Xasa wants to buy more goods (wiper, sneakers, tablecloth and different daily usefull things) to sell so she can develop her business and increase the monthly income. Xasa wishes the best for her children and she works hard. She says “Thanks dear Kiva lenders for support. I’m greatly thankful to you.”

loans.use: to buy more goods

loans.name: Rasul

texts.en:
Rasul is married and has two children. His family lives in Abseron region but they are IDP (Internally Displaced Persons) from Zangilan city. His elder son is 26 years old and he helps his father in his work. His daughter is a student; she studies at a medical college. His wife, Nailya, is a housewife. 

Agil is a master installer of heating equipment. Recently, his apparatus broke, and for a time he can’t work. He applied for a loan in the amount of 1,300 AZN (Azerbaijani new manat). With this loan, he will repair his apparatus and will to continue work. 

He is thankful to Kiva and the Komak organization for the aid.

loans.use: to repair his apparatus

loans.name: ُeyad

texts.en:
Eyad is a 25-year-old single man from Nablus city. He is a freshly graduated student where he studied Engineering.   Eyad found a job in an engineering office recently.  He would like to work hard so he can gain a very good experience in this field and improve himself.

Eyad took a loan from FATEN to help him to buy a laptop to use it in his new job.  By taking this loan, Eyad will be able to do his job and also practice more at home.  Eyad appears in the photo.

loans.use: buy a laptop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: pay land rental & buy seeds

loans.name: Hussam

texts.en:
