Hussam is 25 years old.  He lives with his parents in Gaza. He has a carpentry workshop.   He has excellent experience in this field and started his business ten years ago. 

Hussam has requested a loan from Ryada because his house was partly destroyed.  He trying now to take the first step to get back to his normal life.  He  will repair his house again, especially the walls as a start, then install the doors and the windows. 

Hussam is very grateful to everyone who helps him. He hopes to be able to be back to his normal life again with his family.

loans.use: repair his damaged house

loans.name: Saif

texts.en:
Saif is 29 years old and he is a married man from Qabatiya, a village near Jenin city. He completed his studies recently as a lawyer and finished his training period. He would like to start work independently and open his own office. Saif dreams of building a good client base by virtue of his work quality and good will.

Saif took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to prepare his new office so he can start working as a lawyer. He would like to buy some furniture like a desk and chairs. By taking this loan, Saif will be able to start work.

Saif appears in the photo in his new office

loans.use: to buy some furniture, like a desk and chairs, for his new office so he can start working as a lawyer.

loans.name: Loan

texts.en:
Mrs. Loan is 31 years old, and she is married with three children. She lives with three dependents in Quang Xuong district, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

Mrs. Loan operates a food stall/restaurant selling fish. She has been involved in this business for six years.

This is her first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is not having a hygeinic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet.

With her business profit, Loan hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, to make enough money to provide for her kids, and to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet

loans.name: Romie

texts.en: Romie, a farmer from San Mariano, Isabela is married to an overseas filipino worker and blessed with three children.  Even though the two of them are earning, it is sometimes insufficient to meet all the needs of their children. That is why, to send his son to college, Romie wants to borrow a PHP 200,000 education loan from Kiva lenders, which he will use to pay for his son's tuition fees. His son Richard is working on a BS in Accountancy because he dreams of becoming a successful CPA.

loans.use: to pay for his son's tuition fees

loans.name: Abdullah

texts.en:
Abdullah is 23 years old.  He lives in Gaza with his family.  He opened a small blacksmith shop in 2010 and specializes in manufacturing doors and windows.  This business is the only source of income for his small family. 

Abdullah requested this loan to buy construction tools since these are important for him to mend the damages to his house and to be able pay the workers.  He wants to rebuild the damaged walls, install electricity, doors and windows.  Because he is one of the affected people from the last war in Gaza, one side of his house is fully destroyed, and other effects appear when we visited the house. 

Abdullah is very grateful to everyone who helps him.

loans.use: repair his damaged house

loans.name: Salem

texts.en:
Salem is 27 years old and lives in Gaza with his wife. His wife is unemployed, and he makes a living renting wedding equipment. 

Salem's house was damaged in the last war in Gaza. The goal of this loan will be to buy construction tools, since these are important for him to repair the damage, and to pay the workers. He wants to rebuild the ceiling and the windows. He hopes to be able to be back to his normal life again with his family.

loans.use: to buy construction tools and pay workers to repair his ceiling and windows.

loans.name: Radygunda

texts.en:
Radygunda is a microfinance member of Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative. She gets her financing needs from the Cooperative, especially for her business. She primarily supports her family through her farming activities, and is able to send her grandchildren to school. 

Recently, she bought rice land and wants to cultivate it for rice farming. She approached Paglaum for a loan to pay for seedlings and fertilizer. She deeply wishes that this will help give her farming income a big boost. Radygunda looks for better business opportunities, and would love to be in the position to help others.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and fertilizer.

loans.name: Jenalyn

texts.en:
Jenalyn works hard to support her family. Jenalyn is married and has a food-vending business in the Philippines.

Jenalyn has requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy more materials and ingredients like bamboo sticks, meat, chicken, etc. for her business. Jenalyn has been in this business for five years now. Jenalyn would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more materials and ingredients like bamboo sticks, meat, chicken, etc. for her business

loans.name: Cornelia

texts.en:
Cornelia is 40 years old and has five children. She is a married woman and three of her children are in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Cornelia has a business buying and selling charcoal in the Philippines and requested an 8,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional containers of coconut wine to sell.  Cornelia has been in business for 2 years now, and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Cornelia would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional containers of coconut wine to sell

loans.name: Ma. Luisa

texts.en:
Ma. Luisa is 47 years old and has three children. Ma. Luisa is married and has two children who are in school.

She is in the agricultural business, raising ducks in the Philippines. Ma. Luisa requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feed for her ducks.

Ma. Luisa has been raising ducks for one year now, and has borrowed 1 time in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Ma. Luisa would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase feed for her ducks.

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta is 55 years old, married, and has four children.

She is in the agricultural business, raising ducks in the Philippines. Violeta requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional ducks and feed.

Violeta has been raising ducks for one year now, and has borrowed 1 time in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Violeta would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional ducks and feed.

loans.name: Nhu

texts.en: Nhu is requesting a new loan to buy new chairs and tables for her food stall. This purchase will help her to better attract and satisfy her customers. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business. She hopes that her new loan will help her to increase the size of her food stall and to increase sales, thus improving her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy new chairs and tables for her food stall

loans.name: Imad

texts.en:
Imad is a 30-year-old single man living with his family in their own house in Hodeidah city, Yemen. He has a university education. 

Imad faces a problem in transportation and he wants to purchase a car to use it for transportation to go from one place to another with his family. He had saved an amount of money, unfortunately that amount is not enough to purchase his own car.  So Imad turned to Al- Amal Microfinance bank and applied for a loan of 200,000 YER to purchase a car to use it in the transportation.

Imad looks forward to providing his family with a better future.

loans.use: buy a car

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali, 37 years old, is a married man and a father of four children: the older one is 13 years old and the youngest is five years. He is the breadwinner of his family since his wife is a housewife.  Though Ali is an employee in the public sector, he hardly manages to cover the expenses of his family since three of his children are enrolled in school. 

Ali is very keen to provide his children with everything they need to guarantee a better future for them, so he decided to find an additional income source to meet their needs. He decided to purchase a taxi because he is sure that this is a suitable and profitable business. He will use the available time after the end of his working hours to work on the taxi and earn some money. 

Purchasing a taxi costs 1,200,000 YER and since Ali doesn’t have that amount of  money, he decided to apply for a 1,200,000 YER loan from Al-Amal Microfinance Bank. Ali is confident that this step will be very successful and will have an immediate impact on the living conditions of his family.

Ali is looking forward to accumulating a decent amount of money to purchase a small piece of land to build his own house since he is currently living with his parents.

loans.use: buy a taxi

loans.name: Salem

texts.en:
Salem is a 52-year-old married man and the father of four children. He lives with them in the city of Hodeidah, Yemen. He is an uneducated man, the sole breadwinner of the family, working in selling beds and blankets in the streets. This humble business is the sole source of income for his family.

Salem has run his business for many years with a small amount of capital. The profits from his business are not enough to cover the main needs of his family. As a result, Salem applied for a loan of 98,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase beds and blankets to resell for the customers, to make better profits for his family.

Salem hopes to open a store to sell all kinds of beds and blankets.

loans.use: to purchase beds and blankets to resell for the customers, to make better profits for his family.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy materials to make bricks

loans.name: Abid

texts.en:
Abid, 31, is married and has two children. He lives in Lahore with his family. He has a small dairy farm with his house. 

He wants to add more buffaloes to his current herd. He is seeking a loan to purchase additional dairy buffaloes. As his children grow older, the upkeep and educational expenses keep rising. In order to meet these needs, Abid needs to boost his milk production to earn more income. 

With your loan, he will be able to afford high-yielding dairy buffaloes. He will use the additional income from milk sales to pay the loan installments and, later on, the school fees of his children.

loans.use: to buy an additional buffalo for producing milk.

loans.name: Wa'al

texts.en:
This is Wa'al’s second loan cycle from Ryada. His previous loan helped him to develop his business and had a positive outcome, and he was able to buy an electronic generator and an air conditioner.  

Wa'al's  family was affected by the last war in Gaza and his house was partly destroyed, so he  applied for a loan to rebuild the bathroom, the kitchen, and paint the house again. He hopes to be able provide his children the best life conditions.  He is very grateful to everyone who helps him.

loans.use: rebuild his damaged house

loans.name: Wala'

texts.en:
This is Wala’’s second loan cycle from Ryada. Her previous loan helped her to develop her business and had a positive outcome, enabling her to increase her stock. She is very grateful to everyone who helped her.

Today, Wala’ is requesting this loan because she needs support after the Gaza war. Her house was destroyed, and she wants to rebuild it. She wants to buy building materials and pay for the workers to start work.

One of her biggest dreams is to see her children grow and to give them an education so that they can become professionals. This loan will help her to improve the conditions for her family. She is grateful to everyone who helps her to take this step.

loans.use: to buy building materials and pay the workers to rebuild her house

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for additional pet grooming supplies and expansion of the business

loans.name: Martha Alberta

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Nuevo Amanecer se reúne en el sitio Bajo de Montecristi en la provincia de Manabí, es un pequeño lugar rodeado de mucha vegetación, sus habitantes se dedican a diferentes ocupaciones, como comerciantes, y empleados de fábricas.
En este lugar vive la señora Martha, tiene 51 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos mayores  de edad, uno de ellos aun vive con ellos. Su esposo trabaja ocasionalmente.
Doña Martha es una mujer que le gusta ganar lo suyo para así sacar adelante a su familia, ella tiene una tienda de víveres en su casa, allí vende todo tipo de productos, granos, carnes, detergentes, sodas, entre otros víveres. Trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 19h00, solo lleva 8 meses con su negocio el cual lo surtió con uno de los créditos que recibió del grupo y con cada crédito lo está mejorando.
Este crédito es para comprar más víveres y surtir su tienda. Lleva 2 años en el Grupo de Crédito y le agrada porque con los créditos empezó su negocio. Sus sueños son mejorar su  tienda.
texts.en:
The loan group "Nuevo Amanecer" (New Dawn) meets in the Bajo de Montecristi sector in the province of Manabí. It is a small place surrounded by much vegetation. Its inhabitants work in various occupations, such as commerce and working in factories.

Señora Martha lives in this place. She is 51 years old. She is married, and from this relationship she has three adult children. One of them still lives with them. Her husband works only occasionally.

Doña Martha is a woman who likes to earn something for herself in order to thus help her family. She has a grocery store in her house. There she sells all types of products -- grains, meats, detergents, and sodas, among other groceries. She works every day from 6:00 am to 7:00 pm. She has only had her business for eight months, and she stocked it with one of the loans that she received from the group. With each loan, she is improving her business.

This loan is to buy more groceries and stock her store. She has been in the loan group for two years, and she likes it because she began her business with the loans. Her dreams are to improve her store.

loans.use: to buy groceries for her store

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is 61 years old and married with two children. Delia works very hard to provide for them.

Delia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like shampoo, beverages, canned goods, etc.

Delia has been in this business for 10 years. 

In the future, Delia would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like shampoo, beverages, canned goods, etc

loans.name: Lenie

texts.en:
Lenie is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Lenie is 26 years old and has two children who are in school.

Lenie has a food vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Lenie has been in this business for two years. In the future, Lenie would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 41 year old, married man and a father of four children, living with his family in Ibb city, Yemen. He has a diploma certificate and works as a teacher with a small salary. 

The house where Ali and his family live lacks a lot of furniture and home appliances. These hard conditions make all the members of the family feel inconvenienced, particularly if any visitors come to their house. 

Ali strives hard to provide his family with the necessary home appliances and furniture but he doesn't have enough money to do so. For this reason, he applied for a loan of 200,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase furniture for his house.

Ali looks forward to providing his family with a better future.

loans.use: to purchase furniture for his house.

loans.name: Messie

texts.en:
This is 47-year-old Messie. She is married, and has four children aged 25, 22, 10 and 15 years old. She has one additional dependent, who lives with her because she can help take care of her welfare and educate her.

In 2009, Messie established her provision/grocery shop where she sells mainly soft drinks, peak milk, sardines, and sugar. She began her business to improve her living standard and take care of the family. Working six days a week and ten hours a day, she earns about SLL 570,000 every month from this business.

Messie would like a loan in the amount of SLL 3,000,000. She has already received and successfully repaid one loan, and now requires a new loan in order to purchase more stock of sardines, sugar and milk. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately SLL 400,000. In the future, Messie plans to buy a piece of land and help her husband to educate their children. Messie is very hardworking.

She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to  purchase more stock of sardines, sugar and milk.

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en:
Hassan is a 38-year-old single man with  an 11 year old child.

In 2007, Hassan established his pharmacy business because he was living with a medical doctor and  decided to open a pharmacy and be self-employed. He works 7 days a week,15 hours a day to earn 1,000,000 SLL every month. 

He would like 6,000,000 SLL to buy more medicine for his business.  He  has  received and successfully repaid 2 loans. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profit. In the future, Hassan plans to expand his pharmacy and educate his child to university level.

 He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more medicine for his business.

loans.name: Arthur's Group

texts.en:
Arthur is the group leader of his group in Kakamega South District, and he represents 14 farmers. He is married and the proud father of 5 children. Arthur joined One Acre Fund for the first time this season, but he has been a farmer for more than 30 years.

Like many other farmers, Arthur decided to work with One Acre Fund in order to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods. He hopes that by joining One Acre Fund and using the seeds and fertilizer he will get with this loan, and join the ranks of One Acre Fund farmers that have doubled their harvest in their first year of the program. He plans to use the profits he earns from this year’s harvest to save more money for the future.

Arthur's Group will use the farming supplies received with this loan to cultivate a total of 5,25 acres of land. Additionally, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light so, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of 11 solar lights.

loans.use: to gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: La Alegria Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado La Alegria se encuentra en el primer ciclo del programa de comité de mujeres, están luchando para poder ayudar a sus familias por medio de su esfuerzo. Son 17 mujeres que quieren salir adelante para poder ayudar a sus familias.
Laura, una de las integrantes comenta que se dedica a la peluquería, es una mujer muy trabajadora, que con esfuerzo ha salido adelante y hoy ya tiene muy buena clientela. Su negocio es el sostén de la familia, es por ello que trata de poner todo de si.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de insumos para su peluquería, como ser shampoo, enjuagues, cremas, tintes y demás, de manera a poder seguir dando una buena atención a su familia.
texts.en:
The communal bank named "La Alegria" is starting its first loan cycle in the "Women's Committees" program of the Fundación Paraguaya.  They are striving to help their families through their efforts.  This group has 17 women who want to get ahead so that they can help their families.

Laura, one of the members, states that she has a beauty salon.  She is a very hardworking woman who, with her efforts, has managed to get ahead.  Today she has a very good customer base.  Her business provides her family's support, and this is why she puts everything into it.

Laura is requesting a loan to invest in supplies for her salon, such as shampoo, rinses, creams, dyes, and other supplies.  This way, she will be able to continue to take good care of her family.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her beauty salon

loans.name: Sulaiman

texts.en: This is 44-year-old Sulaiman. He is single and has three children aged 12, 8, and 3. In 2007, Sulaiman established his DVD player, mobile charging, mobile accessories business. He began his business because he was jobless. He decided to go into business to be able to care for the family. Working 7 days a week and 17 hours a day, he earns about SLL 800,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of SLL 3,000,000, in order to buy DVD players, mobile charging and mobile accessories. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately SLL 300,000. In the future, Sulaiman plan is to expand his business and educate his children well. He is  hardworking, and  thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy DVD players, mobile charging and mobile accessories.

loans.name: Josphine

texts.en:
This is 51 year-old Josephine.  She is married and has 3 children who are  8,14 and 20 years old. She has 1  dependent who lives with her.  

In 2001, Josephine established a shop to sell sardines, luncheon meat, sugar, water, and peak milk. She began her business, to improve her living standard  and care for her family. She works 6 days a week, 12 hours a day to earn  670,000 SLL every month. 

She would like 5,000,000 SLL to purchase  sardines, sugar, luncheon meat, and peak milk. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profit.

In the future, Josephina plans to buy two plots of land and build a dwelling house and outlet shops to generate more income. 

She works very hard and  thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase  sardines, sugar, luncheon meat, and peak milk.

loans.name: Phanice's Group

texts.en:
Phanice, a group leader, is representing her group of 14 farmers in Kakamega South District, Kenya. She is married and is a mother to 4 children.  She is known in her community as a very hardworking individual.

Initially, Phanice joined One Acre Fund in 2013 because she wanted to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods. Since she joined the program she says that her life has improved, especially because she has had a healthier life due to better nutrition. With the profits from the coming harvesting season, Phanice plans to send her children to school.

The 14 farmers in Phanice's Group will plant a total of 6,25 acres  using the maize seeds and fertilizer received with the loan. Additionally, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light so, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of 9 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds, fertilize,r and cultivate maize

loans.name: Jenipher's Group

texts.en:
Jenipher, a group leader,  represents 14 farmers in Kakamega South District, Kenya. She joined One Acre Fund for the first time in 2013 and decided to represent her group because she wanted to help more farmers. She is married and has 7 children.

With a portion of this loan, Jenipher will not only purchase maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season, but will also buy a solar light. The solar light will enable her to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. Jenipher plans to use the profits she gains this year to buy a cow.

 Jenipher’s Group will use the supplies received from this loan to plant a total of 7.25 acres of land. They will also receive a total of 10 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds, fertilizer, and a solar light.

loans.name: Felmar

texts.en: Felmar is a 43-year-old married woman with four children aged 10 to 19. She is from Carles, Iloilo. For 21 years now, Felmar has fished for a living to support the needs of her family. She would like to improve her business and she is asking for a loan to buy 15 pieces of plywood, 7 kilos of nails, 3 gallons of paint, adhesive and hardwood. Felmar hopes that she can expand her fishing business and improve the life of her family. Her income will be for food and the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to buy 15 pieces of plywood, 7 kilos of nails, 3 gallons of paint, adhesive and hardwood.

loans.name: Mujeres Exitosas Group

texts.es:
El grupo Mujeres Exitosas está en su 5° ciclo  del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde una de las integrantes es la Sra. Luisa quien en su última encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel uno, lo que quiere decir que debe esforzarse un poco más para poder ir mejorando sus condiciones de vida. Ella tiene una cantina donde vende todo tipo de productos, es por ello que tiene muy buena clientela, ya que tiene de todo, su sueño es poder tener una gran tienda con mayor variedad de productos.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar golosinas, comestibles, bebidas, galletitas y demás insumos para poder surtir su cantina y seguir con su trabajo.
texts.en:
The group Mujeres Exitosas [Successful Women] is its 5th semester of the women's committee program, in which they all work and help each other to get ahead. They are doing the poverty elimination survey, where one of the members is Luisa. In her last survey, she showed a poverty level within level one, which means that she must work a bit harder to be able to improve her quality of life.

She has a snack bar where she sells all types of products. That is why she has a good clientele. Her dream is to be able to have a large store with a greater variety of products. She is applying for this loan to be able to buy snacks, food, drinks, cookies, and other goods in order to stock her snack bar and continue with her work.

loans.use: to buy snacks, food, drinks, cookies, and other goods to sell.

loans.name: Angel

texts.en:
Angel works hard to support her child. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She requested a PHP 4600 loan through NWTF to buy a solar lamp. She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to extend her business hours after nightfall.

Angel is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to purchase a solar lamp.

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
Elisa is 63 years old and married with six children.

She earns a living by pig fattening in the Philippines. Elisa is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to buy additional feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Elisa has been pig fattening for 15 years and also earns additional income from buying and selling rice.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Erlinda works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. Erlinda is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase additional stock like rice, soap, shampoo, etc. to sell in her general store business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Erlinda has been sustaining her business activities through her past 23 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock like rice, soap, shampoo, etc. to sell.

loans.name: William's Group

texts.en:
William's Group is formed by 14 farmers in Kakamega South District and is being represented by William, who is the group leader pictured above. He is 62 years old, is married, and has 6 children. William has been a farmer for 8 years and is often referred to as a very reliable person.

William isn’t new to One Acre Fund. He actually joined the program in 2013 and has since noticed that his life has changed, especially in the sense that he has learnt a lot from farming training ever since. This year, William will not only get fertilizer and maize seeds as part of his loan, but he will also purchase a solar light. He is very excited about this addition since he will now be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money.

Using this loan, William's Group will purchase a total of 14 solar lights and use the farming inputs received to plant a total of 6.75 acres.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, as well as a solar light.

loans.name: Gilda

texts.en:
Gilda works hard to support her family. Gilda is a widow and has a fishing and cultured oyster business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 19,500 loan through NWTF to purchase fishing net and bamboo for her business.

Gilda has been in this business for 40 years now.

In the future, Gilda would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fishing net and bamboo for her business

loans.name: Agusta

texts.en: Agusta is 58 years old and blessed with eight children. They are currently living in a rural community and makes their living through farming. Due to the high cost of commodities, she engages herself in buying and reselling rice and hog feed in their community to generate additional income. She aims to make her business profitable in order to gain a higher income. Having inadequate capital, she would like to avail herself of an additional PHP 10,000 to buy more stock of the said rice and hog feed to resell in her community. Being a kind and diligent mother, Agusta believes that someday, she will further improve her business and increase her income.

loans.use: to buy more stock of feed and rice to resell.

loans.name: Magret's Group

texts.en:
Pictured above is Magret, who, as a group leader, is representing her group formed by 10 farmers in Kakamega South District, Kenya. She is married and is a mother to 3 children. She is known by her community as a very hardworking individual.

Initially, Magret joined One Acre Fund in 2013 because she wanted to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods. She says that since she joined the program, her life has improved, especially because she has had a healthier life due to better nutrition. With the profits from the coming harvesting season, Magret plans to invest in a business.

Between the 10 farmers in Magret's Group, a total of 5.75 acres of land will be planted using the maize seeds and fertilizer received with the loan. Additionally, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light so, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of 3 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize

loans.name: Hesbon's Group

texts.en:
Hesbon is a group leader who is often described as a very reliable person. He represents a group of 15 farmers in Kakamega South District. He is married and has six children. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2014, Hesbon has noticed that he has been able to consistently feed his family.

Hesbon described his last harvest as good, but believes he can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. He is very excited to purchase two solar lights, along with fertilizer and maize, because he will be able to reduce his consumption of paraffin fuel and save money. With the profits from this season’s harvest, he plans to repair his home.

With this loan, Hesbon’s Group will be able to plant a total of 6.5 acres of land and purchase a total of 13 solar lights.

loans.use: to buy maize seeds, fertilizer, and solar lights.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen works hard to support her family. She is married and has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines.

Helen is borrowing PHP 1,800 through NWTF to buy a solar lamp.

She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to provide her children with bright light when they study at night.

Helen is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is saving money, helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to buy a solar lamp.

loans.name: Rose's Group

texts.en:
Rose is 62 years old, married, and has seven children. She is a group leader, representing 12 farmers in Kakamega South District, Kenya. 

Rose joined One Acre Fund in 2014. This decision was largely a result of her desire to get the best quality fertilizer and hybrid seeds. Although she described her last harvest as good, she believes she could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. 

Rose will purchase a solar light as part of her loan, which she is very excited about, as it will allow her to have light during dark hours for her children to study. Obtaining this loan means that Rose's Group will be able to receive a total of seven solar lights and enough farming supplies to plant a total of six acres.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizer, and solar lights.

loans.name: Karen Andreina

texts.es: Andreina es madre soltera  que vive en la casa de su tia, tiene 21 años de edad y su hija tiene 3 años de edad, ella  trabaja al jornal en la  agricultura y también se dedica a la crianza de pollos, el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de pollos para  incrementar su negocio, su aspiración es mejorar su negocio para tener más ganancias con la intención  de retomar sus estudios o seguir un curso de belleza que es lo que a ella siempre le ha gustado y sobre todo tener lo necesario para darle a su hija.
texts.en: Andreina is a single mother who lives with her aunt.  She is 21 and has a 3 year old daughter.  She works on a farm and also raises chickens and will use the money to buy chickens to grow her business.  She aspires for an improved business so she can continue her education or go through a beauty course, which is what she has always enjoyed.  Above all she wants to be able to provide for her daughter’s needs.

loans.use: to buy chickens.

loans.name: Samah

texts.en:
This is 48-year-old Samah. She is married and has four children; they are 17,14, 10 and 12 years old. She has one additional dependent, who lives with her because Samah takes care of her welfare and educates her.

In 2009, Samah established her provision/grocery shop business where she sells things such as soft drinks, peak milk, sardines and sugar. She began her business in order to take care of herself and increase her monthly earnings and profit margin. Working six days a week and 15 hours a day, she earns about SLL 985,000 every month from this business.

She would like a loan in the amount of SLL 3,000,000. Samah has already received and successfully repaid one loan, and now she requires a new loan in order to purchase more groceries such as sardines, sugar and milk. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately SLL 429,000.

In the future, Samah plans to buy two lots of land and help her husband to educate their children. She is very hard working. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries such as sardines, sugar and milk.

loans.name: Xiomara Marlene

texts.es:
Xiomara de 39 años de edad, se dedica a la cosmetología y al comercio de productos de belleza. Sus estudios culminaron hasta bachillerato, ella creció con sus abuelos, su familia esta con formada  por sus hijos ya que ella es madre soltera y le ha tocado sacar a su familia adelante. 

Xiomara se dedica a comercializar productos de belleza  y a prestar servicios de cosmetología posee varios años de dedicarse a esta actividad.    

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar una plancha, peines, spray, gelatinas, canchos para el cabello.  Más productos de belleza ya que viene la temporada alta donde hay graduaciones, fiestas, etc. Y desea tener surtida su sala de belleza ya que es la única en el lugar donde reside y desea incrementar sus ventas y que sus vecinos adquieran sus productos

Xiomara planea que con los ingresos que obtiene de la sala de belleza poder darles una buena educación a sus hijos además de ampliar los servicios de su negocio.
texts.en:
Xiomara, age 39, works in cosmetology and also sells beauty products. She completed her studies through high school. Xiomara grew up with her grandparents. Her family consists of her children since she is a single mother. She has had to help her family get ahead.

Xiomara sells beauty products and provides cosmetology services. She has several years of experience in this line of work. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy a flat iron, combs, sprays, gels, and hair clips. She will also purchase more beauty products for the upcoming busy season when there are graduations, festivals, and other occasions. Xiomara wants to have a well-stocked beauty salon since it is the only place where her business resides. She also wants to increase her sales and hopes that her neighbors will acquire her products.

With the income she earns from her beauty salon, Xiomara plans to provide a good education for her children. She also plans to expand the services offered by her business.

loans.use: to buy a flat iron, combs, sprays, gels, hair clips, and more beauty products that she can sell during her busy season.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to make repairs to her room by whitewashing the walls.

loans.name: Maira Del Carmen

texts.es:
Maira de 38 años de edad, es empleada y su nivel de estudio fue técnico a nivel superior, esta casada y es madre de 3 hijos de 6, 13 y 16 años de edad, los cuales están estudiando en el centro educativo de la comunidad, luego de un tiempo su esposo decidió alejarse del hogar dejando a su esposa y sus tres hijos solos, ahora Maira solo vive con sus hijos y son los que dependen de ella.

 Maira trabaja como impulsadora para una empresa desde hace 14 años, decidió trabajar en esta empresa por la necesidad de comprarle todo lo necesario a sus hijos y darle una mejor calidad de vida, para llegar a su trabajo Maira viaja en bus 7 kilómetros trabajando en el horario de 7:00 am a 5:00 pm todos los días.

El préstamo solicitado en la institución es para comprar lamina y tubos para ampliar el corredor de su casa ya que por el momento se moja cuando llueve mucho.

El sueño de Maira es construir una casa mas grande para que sus hijos crezcan sin ninguna restricción.
texts.en:
Maria is 38 year old and she has a higher technical education.  She is married and is the mother of three children, ages 6, 13, and 16.  They attend the local school.  After a while her husband decided to distance himself from her and the three children.  Now Maria lives with her children and the still depend on her.

Maria works as a booster for a company and has for 14 years.  She decided to work for this company out of a need to provide for her children and give them a better quality of life.  She takes the bus to work seven kilometers away and works from 7:00 am to 5:00 pm every day.

She is asking for this loan to buy metal and pipes to expand the gutters around her home because it gets wet when it rains a lot.

Maria’s dream is to build a larger home where her children can grow up with no restriction.

loans.use: to build gutters

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en: Lolita is 55 years old and a mother of eight. They live happily in a rural community and make their living through farming. Aside from this, she also helps her husband in making and selling soft brooms within their community. They aimed to continue and improve this business to earn a higher income. Due to insufficient capital, she would like to access financial assistance from KIVA lenders amounting to PHP11,000.00 to buy more tiger grass, rattan and plastic needed in making soft brooms that they sell in the local community. Having this financial assistance, Lolita believes that someday, she will make her business more profitable.

loans.use: to buy more tiger grass, rattan and plastic needed in making soft brooms

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a greater number of animals and fattening animal feed.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is 62 years old and married with five children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 19500 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks of item to sell like can goods, egg, milk, spices, etc.

Vilma has borrowed and paid 26 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 15 years and also earns an income from buying and selling rice.

Vilma aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of item to sell like can goods, egg, milk, spices, etc

loans.name: Norah's Group

texts.en:
Norah, pictured above, is a group leader and is representing her group, formed by 12 farmers in Kakamega South District, Kenya. She joined One Acre Fund for the first time in 2014 and decided to represent her group because she wanted to help more farmers. She is married and has 8 children.

With a portion of this loan, Norah will not only purchase maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season, but also a solar light. Receiving a solar light as part of her loan means that now she will be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. Norah plans to use the profits she gains this year to invest in a business.

In total Norah’s Group will receive a total of 3 solar lights. They will also use the inputs received from this loan to plant a total of 6.25 acres of land.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light as well as hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in her business so she can continue with her sales, which allow her to support her family.

loans.name: Jessel

texts.en:
Jessel is married and she works hard to support her family.

She has a frozen foods business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising livestock. Jessel is borrowing PHP 20000 through NWTF to buy more stocks of frozen foods to sell to customers.

Jessel has been sustaining her business activities through her past 4 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of frozen foods to sell.

loans.name: Roni's Group

texts.en:
Roni, pictured above, is 50 years old and is representing her group, formed by 14 farmers in Kakamega South District, Kenya. She joined One Acre Fund for the first time in 2014 and decided to be a group leader because she wanted to help more farmers. She has been married for years and has 8 children.

With a portion of this loan, Roni will not only purchase maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season, but also a solar light. Receiving a solar light means that now she will be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money, which will allow her to save for the future. Roni plans to use the profits she gains this year to send her children to school.

In total the Roni's Group will receive a total of 9 solar lights and will use the inputs received from this loan to plant a total of 6.75 acres of land.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light as well as hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize.

loans.name: Samuel De Jesús

texts.es:
Samuel de 28 años de edad, es jornalero y su nivel de estudio fue hasta el 2° año de bachillerato, esta casado y es padre de 2 hijos, uno de 4 años de edad y el segundo de tan solo 4 meses, Samuel vive con su esposa, sus dos hijos y su abuela paterna, son los que dependen de él.

Su esposa se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar y al cuido de sus hijos, mientras que Samuel trabaja como cobrador de una comercial desde hace 4 años, para llegar a su trabajo Samuel viaja en motocicleta 7 kilómetros, trabajando en el horario de 7:00 am a 5:00 pm de lunes a sábado.

El préstamo que esta solicitando en la institución, es para comprar de duralita y polines para cambiarle techo a su vivienda, ya que la que tiene esta en muy mal estado y se le mojan todos sus muebles cuando llueve.

Con el crédito lograra cambiar techo y así podrá dormir en tranquilidad ya que no se preocupara por saber que sus muebles se están mojando, Samuel sueña con tener un negocio muy grande de venta de electrodomésticos y ahorrar mucho para pagar su préstamo sin ningún inconveniente.
texts.en:
Samuel is 28 years old and is a laborer.  He has a 10th grade education, is married and has two children, ages 4 and 4 months.  Samuel lives with his wife and two children and paternal grandmother who all depend on him.

His wife works in the home and cares for the children, while Samuel has been working as a commercial collector for four years.  He travels seven kilometers by motorcycle and works from 7:00 am to 5:00 pm, Monday through Saturday. 

He will use the money from this loan to buy tiles and beams to replace the roof on his house because it’s in bad shape and his furniture gets wet when it rains.

This loan will allow him to repair the roof and he will be able to sleep peacefully, knowing that his furniture is not getting wet.  Samuel dreams of having a very large business selling appliances and save up to repay his loan.

loans.use: to replace his roof.

loans.name: Nelia

texts.en: Nelia is a responsible housewife who earns income to help support her husband. She is 32 years old and blessed with four children. To offset the high cost of commodities and school fees, she helps her husband by making and selling soft brooms within their community. She aims to make more soft brooms to sell but she has limited capital. For this reason, she would like a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy more rattan, tiger grass and plastics needed to make soft brooms. Through this financial assistance, Nelia will be able to make more soft brooms to sell in the local community.

loans.use: to buy more rattan, tiger grass and plastics needed in making soft brooms

loans.name: Lovelyn

texts.en:
Lovelyn is a 27-year-old, married woman and a mother of two children, from Concepcion, Iloilo. She has been engaged in a fishing business with her husband for more than ten years now. This is the source of their income.

Lovelyn is a hard-working woman and, aside from taking care of her children, she also helps her husband in their fishing business. 

Now, she is requesting a loan to pay for the repair of the fishing boat and to buy fishing materials, like fishing nets, lead weights, hooks, and other items. With this loan, Lovelyn and her husband will be able to improve their fishing business, thus giving them more fish to sell in the market.

Lovelyn wants to save money for reinvestment in the same business and to pay for the future schooling of their children.

loans.use: to pay for the repair of the fishing boat and to buy fishing materials, like fishing nets, lead weights, hooks, and other items.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
As a widowed mother of four children, Elvira works hard to support her family.

She has a feed retailing business in the Philippines and earns additional income from pig fattening. Elvira is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy more stock of feed to sell to customers.

Elvira has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy more stock of feed to sell.

loans.name: Wenima

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Wenima works hard to support her family.

She has a ready-to-wear clothing retail business in the Philippines and earns additional income from selling beauty products. Wenima is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy more clothes to sell.

Wenima has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Rosenda

texts.en:
As a married parent of one child, Rosenda works hard to support her family.

She has a pig-farming business in the Philippines and earns additional income from selling vegetables. She is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF to purchase additional feeds and vitamins to sell for her pig-farming business. She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Rosenda has been sustaining her business activities through her past 22 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva is married and works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines and earns additional income from selling frozen foods and raising pigs. Eva is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to buy more fish to sell in her food stall.

Eva has been sustaining her business activities through her past 21 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Martha Rosa

texts.es:
Martha una mujer con un feliz matrimonio en el cual tuvo 4 hijos 4 mujeres de 10, 19, y 13 años de edad y un varón de 10 años, junto con su esposa trabajan en el campo desempeñando diferentes funciones como agricultura y cría de pollos. 
Martha tiene a su cargo la cría de pollos y quiere seguir progresando y trabajar por un mejor bienestar para su familia.
Solicita un crédito el cual invertirá en la compra de pollos, los criara y los engordara, este crédito le permitirá tener animales suficientes para ser considerados como un proveedor potencial de los diferentes clientes que vienen a pedirle cantidad de animales. 
Su sueño es mejorar su ventas para mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Martha is a woman who is happily married.  She has four children, three daughters ages 10, 19 and 13, and one son who is 10 years old.  Her and her husband work together farming and raising chickens.  Martha is in charge of raising chickens and she wants to continue progressing and working to improve her family's wellbeing.  

She is seeking a loan to invest in raising chickens that she will raise and fatten up.  This loan will allow her to have enough animals to be considered a potential supplier to the different customers that looking for a large quantity of animals.  Her dream is to improve her sales so that she can improve her living conditions.

loans.use: purchase chickens.

loans.name: Jorge Eliecer

texts.es:
5 hijos son la felicidad de Jorge quien se dedica a la compra y venta de cerdos quien lleva realizando dicha profesión un largo tiempo y gracias a este puede brindarles estudio a sus hijos todos ellos menores de edad y que depende en la totalidad de Jorge.
Jorge quiere solicitar un crédito para comprar cerdos y algunos insumos para comenzar con producción agrícola pues necesita mucho dinero para llevar a su casa comida y tener aunque sea una moneda para darle a sus hijos y que gasten en el recreo. 
Con la ayuda de este crédito Jorge podrá tener una plantación y más cerdos para comercializar
texts.en: Jorge's five children are the source of his happiness.  He works buying and selling pigs.  He has worked in this profession for a long time, and thanks to this, he can provide his children, who are all minors and depend completely on him, with an education.  Jorge is seeking a loan to purchase pigs and some supplies to start farming because he needs to earn money to put food on the table and provide for his children financially.  With the help of this loan, Jorge will be able to plant crops and have more pigs to sell.

loans.use: purchase pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy and build a bathroom, septic tank, and closet at their home to improve access to water and  sanitation for her family.

loans.name: Tania Fiorella

texts.es:
Tania Fiorella tiene 27 años de edad, su estado civil es conviviente, vive en casa propia, en el distrito de Buenos Aires, provincia de Morropón, región de Piura, costa norte de Perú, ella es natural de la zona. La vida en el distrito es tranquila, sus pobladores se dedican a la agricultura y ganadería como sustento principal, siembra y cosecha de banano,maíz, fréjol caupí. Etc

Tania Fiorella se dedica a la crianza y venta de carne de cerdo, esta actividad la realiza desde hace más de 4 años, en su domicilio y caseríos vecinos, Tania Fiorella cuenta con clientela fija la cual le hace pedidos y entrega para la semana. Adicionalmente se dedica a la venta de ropa y artefactos. Destino del crédito será para la compra de una cantidad mayor de ropa y artefactos para poder ofrecerlos en la campaña navideña que se acerca. Lo que le permitirá en un corto plazo mejorar sus ingresos, aumentar sus ganancias y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Tania Fiorella is 27 years old and lives with her common-law husband in their home in the district of Buenos Aires in Morropón province, which is in the Piura region of Peru's northern coast. She is originally from this area. Life in this district is quiet, and most of its residents earn their living mainly farming and raising livestock. They grow plantains, corn, cowpeas, etc.

She works raising pigs and selling pork and has been in business for over four years. She works at home and in nearby communities. She has a stable customer base that orders from her and she delivers weekly. She also works selling clothing and other products.

Tania Fiorella will use this loan to buy larger quantities of clothing and other products to prepare for the coming Christmas season. This will allow her to improve her income in the short term, increase her profit, and in turn improve her and her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more clothing and other products for the Christmas season.

loans.name: Maria Liduvina

texts.es:
María Liduvina tiene 57 años de edad, es casada, vive con su esposo y su hijo, en casa propia, en una comunidad grande en la zona urbana de Cayaltí; goza con buenas referencias personales y laborales de parte de sus vecinos. Su comunidad está dedicada básicamente a la agricultura, ganadería y al comercio. Y esta ubicada en el distrito de Cayaltí, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú.

María Liduvina se dedica a la actividad de crianza y venta de animales como cerdos, pavos, patos y cuyes, desde hace más de 10 años de antigüedad en el negocio, el mismo que se ubica en su propio domicilio. Solicita préstamo para la compra de un número mayor de animales y alimento de engorde balanceado para los mismos. De esta manera hacer crecer su negocio. Lo que le permitirá en un corto plazo mejorar sus ingresos, aumentar sus ganancias y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Maria Liduvina is 57 years old, married, and lives with her husband and son in her own house in a large community in the urban zone of Cayalti, Chiclayo province, Lambayeque region of Peru's north coast.

Maria Liduvina raises and sells farm animals such as pigs, turkeys, ducks and guinea pigs. She has spent more than 10 years in the business, which she conducts at her own home.

Maria Liduvina is requesting a loan to buy a larger number of animals plus commercial feed to fatten them. In this manner, she hopes to expand her business. This will permit her to improve her income and, within a short time, to increase her earnings and, finally, improve her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: to purchase a larger number and variety of farm animals and appropriate commercial feed to fatten them for selling.

loans.name: Lea

texts.en:
As a married mother of seven children, Lea works hard to support her family.

She has a spices retailing business in the Philippines. Lea is borrowing PHP 24,000 through NWTF in order to buy more stocks of spices to sell.

Lea has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, which is to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of spices to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase pork and beef.

loans.name: Nena

texts.en: To meet the daily needs of her family, Nena helps her husband generate income by buying and reselling fruits and vegetables to people in her community. She hopes to make her business more profitable in order to earn a higher income. Her capital is not adequate to do this, so she would like to borrow PHP 7,000 to buy more fruits, vegetables and root crops to resell. Through hard work and determination, she believes that she will improve her business and make it more profitable.

loans.use: to buy more fruits, vegetables and root crops to resell

loans.name: Luz Yessenia

texts.es:
Luz Yessenia tiene 40 años de edad, es soltera, vive con su madre, en casa propia, en una comunidad grande en la zona urbana de Cayaltí y goza de buenas referencias personales y laborales de parte de sus vecinos. Su comunidad está dedicada básicamente a la agricultura, ganadería y al comercio. Y está ubicada en el distrito de Cayaltí, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú.

Luz Yessenia se dedica a la actividad de venta de productos de belleza(talcos, perfumes, etc), desde hace más de 3 años de antigüedad en el negocio, en su propio domicilio. Ella solicita préstamo para la compra de una cantidad mayor de productos de belleza para poder surtir y aumentar su stock, y así poder satisfacer las diversas necesidades y preferencias de su público consumidor. De esta manera hará crecer su negocio, además de captar nuevos clientes. Lo que le permitirá en un corto plazo mejorar sus ingresos, aumentar sus ganancias y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Luz Yessenia is 40-years old, single and lives with her mother in her own home. She lives in a community in the urban area of Cayaltí. She enjoys good personal and work references from her neighbors. Her community is primarily dedicated to agriculture, raising livestock and trade. It is located in the Cayaltí District of Chiclayo Province, Lambayeque Region and is on the northern coast of Perú.

Luz Yessenia makes her living selling beauty products (talcum powder, perfumes etc). She has been in the business for more than three years. She sells her products out of her home. Luz Yessenia is requesting the loan to purchase a greater quantity of beauty products to diversify and increase her stock. That way she will be able to satisfy the diverse needs and preferences of her consuming public. This is how she will grow her busienss and, in addition, gain new customers. All of this will allow her to improve her income in a short period of time, increase her profits and, therefore, improve her own quality of life as well as that of her family.

loans.use: to purchase a greater quantity of beauty products to diversify and increase her stock.

loans.name: Luis Fernando

texts.es:
Hay pasiones y gustos que no podemos controlar, hobbies como las motocicletas, un gran admirador de estos vehículos de 2 ruedas es Luis, un joven que con gran gusto y orgullo logro montar un taller donde vende forros para motos, repuesto, cascos y artículos todos relacionados con las motocicletas.
Es un joven de 21 años de edad con un sueño el cual es poder comprar una casa y abrir locales comerciales en toda la ciudad un sueño muy ambicioso que quiere lograr a toda costa.
Solicita un crédito que invertirá en la compra de repuestos,  forros para la motocicleta y vitrinas para exhibir más productos y así contagiar a sus clientes de esta cultura de las motocicletas que tiene tanta acogida en Medellín,
texts.en:
Motorcycles are not only a hobby for some people, but an undeniable passion. Luis is a fervent admirer of these two-wheel vehicles. This young man is happy and proud to have been able to set up a shop where he sells full body decal kits, spare parts, helmets, and all sorts of motorcycle accessories.

He is 21 years old and his dream is to be able to buy a house and open businesses all over the city. This is a very ambitious goal but he wants to achieve it at any cost.

Luis is requesting a loan to invest in purchasing spare parts, decal kits, and display cases to show more of his merchandise and engage his customers in Medellín's thriving biking culture.

loans.use: to buy motorcycle accessories and display cases for his products.

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en: Daisy is 56 years old, married and the mother of five children, one of whom is in school. She works hard to provide for her family by running a general store in the Philippines, and has requested a PHP 20,000 loan from NWTF to buy more groceries to sell. Daisy has taken our and repaid 20 prior loans from NWTF and has been running her general store for 12 years. She also earns income by selling ready-to-wear clothing and raising livestock. Her goals are to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Baktygul

texts.ru: Бактыгул, 41 год, замужем, мать 4 детей. Бактыгул занимается животноводством и полеводством, начав свой бизнес в 2009 году. Благодаря упорному труду, в хозяйстве Бактыгул на сегодняшний день имеется 1 корова, 5 овец, на земельном участке мерою 1,1 ГА она выращивает пшеницу. Ее ежемесячная прибыль составляет 15,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Бактыгул обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS), целью которого является покупка одной коровы для разведения. Доходы от кредита Бактыгул планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие своего бизнеса.
texts.en: Baktygul is 41 years old, married and a mother of 4 children. Baktygul has been involved in animal husbandry and farming since 2009. Thanks to her hard work, today Baktygul's business contains 1 cow and 5 sheep. She also grows wheat on 1.1 hectares of land. Her monthly profit amounts to 15,000 som (KGS). In order to further develop her business, Baktygul requested a loan in the amount of 50,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum" Bank to buy one cow for fattening up. Baktygul is planning to invest the earnings from the loan into further developing her business.

loans.use: to buy one cow for fattening up in order to grow her business

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en: Gemma is married, the mother of three children, and works hard to support her family. She runs a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income by running a general store. She is requesting a loan for PHP 13,000 from NWTF to buy gear and other equipment to use when fishing. Gemma has sustained her business with two prior loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, which is to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: José Isabel

texts.es:
José de 71 años de edad, se dedica a la agricultura y a la ganadería por la situación económica no pudo estudiar. Él creció con sus padres quienes le enseñaron esta actividad.  Su familia esta conformada  por su esposa quien le apoya con los oficios domésticos ya que sus hijos tienen su hogar aparte.

José se dedica  a la agricultura desde hace más de cuarenta años, oficio que aprendió de sus padres;  trabaja durante la mañana en el terreno; en la tarde ordeña las vacas y su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos.


El préstamo que está solicitando, es para comprar una novilla,  la cual le ayudara en los próximos meses a incrementar la producción de leche que ayudara al sustento del hogar.

José planea que con los ingresos que obtiene de las actividades productivas que realiza espera trabajar sin deudas pronto.
texts.en:
José is 71 years old. He works farming and raising livestock. He wasn't able to go to school due to his financial situation. He grew up with his parents, who taught him the business. He lives alone with his wife, since his children have already moved out and live on their own.

José has been farming for over forty years. He works the land in the mornings and milks the cows in the afternoons. His wife is a homemaker.

He will use the loan he is requesting to buy a heifer, which will help him increase his milk production in the coming months. This will help him support his household. José expects the income he earns from his business to allow him to work debt-free soon.

loans.use: to buy a heifer.

loans.name: Arsenia

texts.en: Arsenia is 57 years old, married and the mother of two children. She earns a living by farming vegetables in the Philippines, and has requested a loan for PHP 7,000 from NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies. Arsenia has been farming vegetables for 15 years and also earns additional income by raising livestock. She is working tirelessly to attain her dream, which is to build and expand her business and secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Hieu's Group

texts.en: Hieu is 35 years old and lives with her two children and husband, who works as a glass and aluminum artisan. For the past 12 years she has run a beauty salon from the front of her house in order to earn income to support her family. She also leads a five-person loan group made up of people who live in Ho Chi Minh City. In the photo, she is second from the right wearing orange-colored pants. Each of the other group members are requesting loans to fund income-generating activities. Hieu is requesting a loan to repair her shop. She hopes this will allow her to better meet the needs of her customers and attract additional ones. She also hopes that through her loan she will be able to increase her income and save money for any future difficulties that may face her family.

loans.use: to repair her shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy shingles to repair her roof.

loans.name: Gulgaaky

texts.ru: Гулгаакы 42 года, замужем, мать 3 детей. Гулгаакы, в качестве основного дохода уже 15 лет занимается животноводством и полеводством. На сегодняшний день у нее есть 2 коровы,24 овцы и 2 лошади, также земельный надел мерою 2,0 ГА, где Гулгаакы выращивает картофель и люцерну. Дети и супруг помогают по хозяйству. Гулгаакы  обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 10 овец для откорма и реализации. Доходы от кредита позволят Гулгаакы улучшить благосостояние семьи и в дальнейшем развивать ее бизнес.
texts.en: Gulgaaky is 42 years old, married and a mother of 3 children. To provide the primary source of income, Gulgaaky has been involved in animal husbandry and farming for 15 years. Today Gulgaaky's business contains 2 cows, 24 sheep, 2 horses, and also a land plot of 2.0 hectares, where Gulgaaky grows potatoes and alfalfa. Her children and husband help her with the business. Gulgaaky requested a loan in the amount of 50,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum" Bank to buy 10 sheep for fattening up and resale. The earnings from the loan will help Gulgaaky to improve her family's welfare and further develop her business.

loans.use: to buy 10 sheep for fattening up and resale

loans.name: Clarita

texts.en:
Clarita is 54 years old and married with seven children, one of whom is in school.

She earns a living by farming sugarcane in the Philippines. Clarita is borrowing PHP 8,000 through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Clarita has been farming sugarcane for 14 years and also earns additional income from pig fattening.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cement, sand, gravel, bricks, and rebar to build a perimeter wall around her house

loans.name: Hue

texts.en:
Hue is 51 years old and married with one son. Her husband is a driver. Hue supports her family by selling noodles in the local community. 

She would like to receive a loan to buy better food, such as meat, noodles and beverages, to sell from her stall. 

She hopes that through the loan, she can improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy better food, such as meat, noodles and beverages, to sell.

loans.name: Huong

texts.en:
Huong, 46, is a married woman living with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband is a driver. Huong supports her family by running a business buying and selling recycled materials. 

She is now requesting a loan to expand her business by buying a larger quantity of waste materials to recycle and resell. 

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a larger quantity of waste materials to recycle and resell.

loans.name: Zhanylai

texts.ru: Жанылай, 43 года, замужем, мать 5 детей. У Жанылай высшее образование, с 1994 года она стала заниматься сельским хозяйством. Сегодня в хозяйстве Жанылай есть 2 коровы, 7 овец, также на собственном земельном наделе мерою 1,50 Га занимается полеводством, выращивая клевер и картофель. Экологически чистая и вкуснейшая продукция пользуется большим спросом и приносит ежемесячную прибыль в сумме 13,000 сомов(KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Жанылай обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 15,000 сом (KGS) на покупку одного теленка. В будущем Жанылай планирует направлять доходы от кредита на развитие ее деятельности.
texts.en: Zhanylai is 43 years old, married, and the mother of five children.  She has a higher education and has been working in agriculture since 1994.  She currently owns two cows and seven sheep.  In addition, she is also involved in crop farming, growing clover and potatoes on her own plot of land measuring 1.5 hectare.   Her organic and delicious crops are in high demand and bring her a monthly income of 13,000 som (KGS).  In order to further develop her farming business, Zhanylai has turned to Bai Tushum for a loan of 15,000 som (KGS).  She will use this loan to purchase one calf.  In the future, she is planning to reinvest her earnings from this loan into further growing her business.

loans.use: to buy one calf for fattening up and resale.

loans.name: Yessica Yamileth

texts.es:
Yessica de 31 años de edad, está acompañada y tiene 3 hijos, de 11, 7 y 4 años de edad solo 2 estudian. Ella no estudio debido a que sus padres desde pequeña la pusieron a trabajar, su pareja es agricultor, solo él y sus hijos viven con ella.

Yessica es comerciante, tiene un negocio en el que vende pupusas, papas fritas y licuados, ya tiene varios años trabajando de esta manera, el negocio lo tiene en su casa y cuando hay feria o alguna festividad, se traslada para vender. De esta manera ayuda a su pareja con los gastos de la familia.

El préstamo será utilizado para comprar, harina de maíz. Quesillo, chicharrón, repollo, papas, frutas, bebidas y demás para tener una reserva para cuando empiecen las festividades de noviembre. Yessica sueña con tener un negocio siempre estable para que a sus hijos no les falte nada.
texts.en:
Yessica is 31 years old and lives with her common-law husband. They have three children, who are ages eleven, seven, and four. She didn't go to school because she was put to work at a very young age. Her husband is a farmer and she lives with him and their children.

Yessica has a business where she sells pupusas, french fries, and blended drinks. Her business is located in her home, and on market days and holidays she also works as a street vendor. She has been working this way for several years, and this allows her to help her husband with household expenses.

She will use this loan to buy corn flour, cheese, pork rinds, cabbage, potatoes, fruit, drinks, and other products so that she is well-stocked for the November holidays. Yessica wants her business to always be stable so that her children can have everything they need.

loans.use: to buy corn flour, cheese, pork rinds, cabbage, potatoes, fruit, drinks, and other products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cement, sand, gravel, bricks, metal sheeting, and iron to build a kitchen at her house.

loans.name: Dung

texts.en:
Dung, a 45-year-old single woman, lives in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City with her family. She has run a business selling noodles and breads for people in her community for 10 years. 

Dung is requesting a loan to buy  better quality food to meet her customers' needs. She also hopes her business will ensure that she and her family can overcome any difficulties in their future.

loans.use: to buy better quality food to meet her customers' needs

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.es:
Magdalena de 39 años de edad, posee un cafetín desde hace tres años y comercializa bebidas, golosinas y elaboración de comida típica (yuca, enchiladas, elotes, etc.) su estudios culminaron hasta noveno grado, ella creció con sus padres, su familia esta conformada  por su esposo quien le apoya trabajando como albañil.

Magdalena se dedica a atender su cafetín todo el día en el parque del municipio donde ofrece los diferentes productos que elabora.   

El préstamo que está solicitando, es para comprar bebidas, golosinas, yuca, aceite, maíz, condimentos, elotes, etc. 

Magdalena planea que con los ingresos que obtiene  del cafetín y con ayuda de su esposo  piensa ampliar su negocio para darle un mejor futuro a su familia.
texts.en:
Magdalena is 39 years old and opened a stand three years ago where she sells sweets, drinks, and traditional food that she makes like cassava, enchiladas, corn on the cob, etc. She has a ninth grade education and she grew up with her parents. She is married and her husband is a construction worker.

Magdalena works at her stand all day in the local park. That is where she offers the different products that she prepares. 

The loan she is requesting is to buy drinks, sweets, cassava, oil, corn, spices, etc. Magdalena expects that the income she makes from her stand, along with her husband's help, will allow her to expand her business and give her family a better future.

loans.use: to buy drinks, sweets, cassava, oil, corn, spices, corn on the cob, etc.

loans.name: Mahsuda

texts.ru: Махсуда, 50 лет, замужем, мать 5 детей. Образование- среднее, уже много лет она занимается животноводством и полеводством. Благодаря упорному труду Махсуды, на сегодняшний день она имеет хорошее развитое хозяйство. В наличии есть 1,14 ГА поливной земли, где Махсуда выращивает кукурузу и пшеницу под реализацию. Также есть 7 коров и 13 овец. Ее ежемесячный доход составляет около 20,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Махсуда обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец. Доходы от кредита она планирует вложить в дальнейшее расширение ее бизнеса, что позволит улучшить благосостояние семьи и открыть продуктовый ларек возле дома.
texts.en: Mahsuda is 50 years old, married, and the mother of five children. She has the equivalent of a high school education and has been involved in animal husbandry and agriculture for many years already.  Thanks to her very hard work, her farming business is now well developed.  She currently owns 1.14 hectare of irrigated land on which she grows corn and wheat for resale.  In addition, she has seven cows and 13 sheep.  She makes a monthly income of about 20,000 som (KGS).  In order to further develop her business, she has turned to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC for a loan of 150,000 som (KGS).  She will use her loan to buy sheep.  She is planning to reinvest the earnings from her loan into further growing her business, which will enable her to improve her family's welfare and to open a small food shop next to her house.

loans.use: to purchase additional sheep so that she can increase her profits and open a food shop near her house.

loans.name: Flor

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Flor works hard to support her family. She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns income from pig fattening. 

Flor, who has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. is borrowing PHP 10000 to buy more ingredients for her food business. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to expand her enterprise.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business

loans.name: Thao

texts.en:
Thao, 37, is single and lives in Ho Chi Minh City. Thao started running a beauty shop four years ago. She started this business to cover her expenses and to generate income to raise her children. 

She is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying more hairdressing tools and shampoos to stock her shop. She hopes that this will enable her to attract more customers and that she will be able to increase the turnover of her business. 

She hopes that through the loan, she will be able to expand her business activities and have money to reinvest in her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more hairdressing tools and shampoos to stock her shop.

loans.name: Lien

texts.en:
Lien is a 36-year-old woman. She lives with her son and husband in Ho Chi Minh City. For six years, she has run a general store that serves people in her community.

Lien would like a loan to purchase better-quality food and household items to sell to her customers. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her customers and attract additional customers. 

She also hopes that through her loan, she will be able to increase her income and save money for any future difficulties facing her family.

loans.use: to purchase better-quality food and household items to sell at her store.

loans.name: Hieu

texts.en:
Hieu, 49 and a divorced woman, lives in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City with her son.

Hieu has run a business of selling noodles for people in her community for four years. She would like to get a loan to buy new furniture for her food stall in order to better satisfy her customers. She also hopes her business will ensure that she and her family can overcome any difficult in their future.

loans.use: to buy new furniture for her stall.

loans.name: Diana Carolina

texts.es:
