El Grupo De Crédito Nuevo Amanecer se reúne en el sitio Bajo de Montecristi en la provincia de Manabí, es un pequeño lugar rodeado de mucha vegetación, sus habitantes se dedican a diferentes ocupaciones, como comerciantes, y empleados de fábricas.
En este lugar vive la señora Diana, tiene 27 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de 12 y 4  años, el mayor de ellos estudia en colegio y la menor en escuela. Su esposo es chofer.
Doña Diana es una mujer muy luchadora que le gusta valerse por sí misma para salir adelante y con sus ingresos ayudarle a su marido con los gastos del hogar, ella se dedica al comercio, vende ropa de todo tipo, su forma de  ventas es puerta a puerta y también vende en su  casa hasta donde llegan sus clientes cuando necesitan de alguna prenda, ella  deja a crédito a sus clientes  y cobra todas las semanas. Tiene más 5 años que se dedica a esta actividad con la que empezó con el primer cerdito que recibió del grupo. 
Este crédito es para comprar pantalones, camisas, blusas entre otras prendas. Lleva 5 años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque con  los créditos ella financia su negocio. Sus sueños son darle lo mejor  a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The Nuevo Amanecer (New Dawn) communal bank meets in Bajo de Montecristi, in the Manabí province. It is a small place surrounded by lush vegetation. Its inhabitants follow a variety of occupations such as merchants and factory workers.

Diana, aged 27, lives in this area. She is married and has two children, ages 12 and 4. The eldest goes to high school and the youngest to elementary school. Her husband is a driver.

Diana is a real fighter, who likes to support herself to get ahead and use her income to help her husband to cover the household expenses.

She makes a living working as a merchant. She sells different types of clothing either by going door-to-door or by selling the garments at her home, where her customers go whenever they need to buy some clothing. She sells her merchandise on credit and collects the payments every week. For five years, she has been running this business, which she started with the first loan she got from the communal bank.

She will use this loan to buy pants, shirts, and blouses, among other garments. 

She has been with the communal bank for five years, and she likes it because she finances her business with the loans. Her dream is to give the best to her children.

loans.use: to buy pants, shirts, and blouses, among other garments.

loans.name: Kanaiym

texts.ru: Канайым, 58 лет, замужем, мать 4 детей. У Канайым среднее образование, много лет она занимается животноводством и полеводством. Сумев развить свой бизнес и обретя постоянных покупателей, на сегодняшний день, благодаря ее упорству и целеустремленности в хозяйстве Канайым имеется 9 коров, дополнительно занимается полеводством, на собственной земле, мерою 1,0 ГА она выращивает кукурузу и пшеницу. Канайым хочет и дальше приумножить поголовье скота и развить ее полеводческую деятельность. В связи с этим она обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом, в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS), на полученный кредит она приобретет скот и соберет урожай кукурузы. На доходы от кредита Канайым хочет увеличить поголовье скота и в скором будущем женить младшего сына.
texts.en:
Kanaiym is 58, married, and a mother of four children.  She has the equivalent of a high school education, and has grown crops and raised livestock for several years, successfully growing her business and gaining a number of regular buyers over time.  Thanks to her persistence and goal-oriented nature, she currently has nine cows on her farm, as well as a 1.0-hectare plot of land for growing corn and wheat.  

Kanaiym wants to add more animals to her farm and develop her crop-growing business.  As such, she's seeking a loan of 150,000 som from Bai Tushum Bank to buy more livestock and gather her corn harvest, and plans to use her extra income due to the loan to further increase her livestock headcount as well as see her son married in the near future.

loans.use: buy additional livestock for fattening and resale as well as harvest corn

loans.name: Nasimkan

texts.ru: Насимкан успешно выплатила свой кредит, использовав его по назначению. Она очень благодарна Фонду Кива и всем, кто помог ей в финансировании. На сегодняшний день в хозяйстве Насимкан есть 1 корова и 6 овец. На земельном участке мерою 1,92 Га она выращивает пшеницу и горох. На ежедневной основе Насимкан продает молоко местным жителям. В целях развития своего бизнеса, Насимкан обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коров для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Насимкан будет вкладывать в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины.
texts.en: Nasimkan successfully repaid her loan after using it as she had intended.  She is very thankful to Kiva and to everyone who helped her get this financing.  She currently owns one cow and six sheep, and also grows wheat and peas on 1.92 hectare of land.  She sells milk to the local residents on a daily basis.  In order to further grow her business, she has turned to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC for a loan of 100,000 som (KGS).  She will use this loan to buy cows for breeding.  She will reinvest the earnings from her loan into further increasing her number of farm animals.

loans.use: to buy additional cows in order to increase her livestock headcount.

loans.name: Yanti

texts.en:
Yanti, is a 34-year-old woman married to Andre, a 35-year-old man. They are blessed with two children: Indry, who is 5 months, and Ariny, who is 8 and in third grade of Elementary School.
 
Yanti owns a business selling fruits, various candies, fried corn, soft drinks, other snacks. She displays all of her products on a table as she does not have a stall for them. She has been involved in this business since 2012, using capital from her husband.

To generate more income, Yanti intends to add more stock to her business; she plans to spend the loan on snacks, candies, fruit, and cakes to sell. She hopes the income from this business will help her to finance her children's school fees and their living expenses as well. Therefore she is requesting a loan from TLM amounting to IDR 3,000,000.

loans.use: to purchase snacks, candies, fruit, and cakes for her business

loans.name: Kanata Group

texts.es:
Laura es una mujer de 30 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene un hijo de cuatro años y una hija de 3 años, y su negocio es la venta de carbón.
Ella es emprendedora, responsable, constante, buena madre y trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la avenida ‘Aroma’ que es una importante arteria de la ciudad de Cochabamba, con un paisaje que varía según se acerque o se aleje de la zona de la Terminal de Omnibus, tiene una extensa parte de zona roja y esto puede observarse viendo el tipo de hoteles que habitan esta zona, Luego cerca del centro histórico es una zona de venta ambulante, grandes mercados, mucha comida, etc.
Laura es de tez morena, estatura mediana, cabello castaño teñido largo, su lengua materna es el Quechua y habla español según sus clientes (a la izquierda con blusa negra). Su vida la realiza con su pareja que se dedica al mismo negocio y con sus hijos que aún no están en edad escolar, viven en una casa alquilada de ladrillo y cuentan con agua y electricidad. Su deseo de superación la llevó a conformar una banca de personas con negocios como; puesto de venta de comida, venta de licores, venta de chompas, tejido de ropa de bebe, venta de papas fritas, venta de ropa deportiva, tienda de barrio y carnicería, para solicitar  un préstamo y continuar con sus actividades de mejor manera. Su negocio es la venta de carbón vegetal. El uso del carbón es medicinal y también para cocinar, pues tiene varias aplicaciones. Esta es la primera secuencia de préstamos que realiza en la institución en nueve años que lleva con esta actividad. Su sueño es tener una casa propia grande. Ella desea ampliar su negocio realizando la compra de carbón por mayor y una parrilla para la venta de pescado a la parrilla, sus hijos pronto entrarán a la escuela y ella vé necesario generar más utilidades para los gastos que se le avecinan.
Es por esos motivos que Laura solicita un préstamo para la compra de carbón por mayor y una parrilla para vender pescado y con los beneficios mandar a sus hijos a la escuela.
texts.en:
Laura is 30 years old, and she lives with her life partner.  She has a four year old son and a three year old daughter.  Her business is selling charcoal.

She is enterprising, responsible, steadfast, a good mother, and hard-working.  She conducts her business on the ‘Aroma’ avenue, which is an important artery of the city of Cochabamba.  The city’s scenery varies according to whether you are getting close to or leaving the Omnibus Terminal.  There is an extensive part of the area which is ‘zona roja’ [area with illicit drug traffickers].  You can see this by the type of hotels that exist in this area.  Then, close to the historical center there is an area for itinerant sales, large markets, and a lot of food, etc.

Laura has a dark complexion, is medium height, and has long brown hair.  Her mother tongue is Quechua, and she speaks Spanish if her customers do.  (She is on the left with a black shirt).

She lives her live with her life partner, who is in the same business, and her children, who are not yet school age.  They live in a rented brick house that has water and electricity.

Her wish to improve herself took her to form a communal bank of people with businesses like a stand to sell food, selling liquor, selling sweaters, knitting baby clothes, selling French fries, selling sportswear, a neighborhood store, and a butcher shop.  They formed the bank in order to request a loan to continue with their business activities in a better way.

Her business is selling charcoal.  The use of charcoal is medicinal, and it is used for cooking.  It has various uses.  This is the first loan cycle that she has had with the institution.  She has had this business activity for nine years.

Her dream is to have her own large house.  She wishes to expand her business by purchasing charcoal wholesale and a grill to sell grilled fish.  Her children will soon start school, and she sees the need to generate more profits for the expenses that are coming.

It is for these reasons the Laura is requesting a loan to buy charcoal wholesale and a grill in order to sell fish.  She will use the profits to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy charcoal wholesale and a grill in order to sell fish.

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
A USD 600 loan is offered to Ana to improve her business. She is married and she has three children. 

Ana has a kiosk where many people come to buy every day. She will buy some additional supplies, such as  noodles, water, Coca-Cola, and Sprite. 

She has been involving herself in business activities since 2003. She feels so comfortable running her business because she can earn money every day. Running a business has made Ana independent because she can be responsible for herself and also help her family. 

She hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: to buy noodles, water, Coca-Cola, and Sprite.

loans.name: Bibisayfura

texts.en:
Bibisayfura is 43-year-old married woman from Dushanbe city. Her husband works as a welder. They have five children. All the children are older than 18 years. 

Ten years ago, Bibisayfura learned from her relative, a seamstress, how to sew and cut. At that time, it was necessary for her to start her own business in order to provide the family with an income source. Now her daughter helps Bibisayfura with the orders. 

Bibisayfura intends to develop her sewing business. With the loan amount, she wants to purchase an additional sewing machine to take more orders and increase the profitability of her activity. To do this she needs your financial help.

loans.use: to purchase a new sewing machine.

loans.name: José Tobias

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Nuevo Amanecer se reúne en el sitio Bajo de Montecristi en la provincia de Manabí, es un pequeño lugar rodeado de mucha vegetación, sus habitantes se dedican a diferentes ocupaciones, como comerciantes, y empleados de fábricas.
En este lugar vive don José, tiene 32 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de 10 y 4 años de edad, ambos estudian en escuela. Su mujer trabaja en una fábrica local.
El señor José es hombre muy trabajador que hace lo posible para que a su familia no les falte lo necesario para vivir, el  tiene  un taller de pintura, les da el acabado necesario a todo tipo de muebles que elaboran en la localidad, realiza sus trabajos por contratos que le realizan los dueños de ebanisterías de la zona,  sus clientes le prefieren por la calidad de sus trabajos y también por el cumplimiento, esto le ha hecho ganar mucha clientela lo cual les sirve para ganar más y salir adelante, lleva más de 10 años en esta actividad con la que se gana la vida.
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar pinturas y pinceles para realizar su trabajo. Este es su tercer ciclo en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los  créditos son rápidos. Sus sueños son tener su propio local ya que alquila donde trabaja.
texts.en:
The communal bank Nuevo Amanecer meets in Bajo de Montecristi, in Manabí province. It is a small area surrounded by lots of vegetation. Its residents work at the local factories or run small businesses. 

That is where José lives. He is 32 years old and is in a common-law marriage. He has two children from this relationship, who are ages ten and four. Both kids go to school. His wife works at one of the local factories.

José is a very hard worker and does everything he can for his family to have everything they need. He has a paint shop where he finishes all sorts of locally manufactured furniture. He has contracts with the owners of many local carpentry shops, which is how he gets most of his jobs. His customers prefer him for the quality of his work and also his professional service, which has allowed him to gain a large customer base that enables him to make more money and get ahead. He has been earning a living with this business for over ten years.

He will use this loan to buy paint and paint brushes for work. This is his third cycle with his communal bank, which he enjoys because the loans are quick. He would like to one day own his own shop, since he is currently renting his workspace.

loans.use: to buy paint and paint brushes.

loans.name: Divine Grace

texts.en:
Divine Grace is 19 years old and is the second of two children in the family. Her Mother, Apolinar, supports the family through her sari-sari store business in the Philippines.

Divine Grace is studying for a Bachelor of Science in secondary education and is currently in the third year of this four-year course.

Divine Grace is borrowing PHP 4,500 to pay for tuition fees for the second semester of the school year 2014-2015.

When she graduates, Divine Grace plans to become a professional teacher.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees.

loans.name: Robiya

texts.en:
Robiya is a divorced woman who seen many difficulties in life. She is 61 years old and lives with her five children in the capital of Dushanbe city. Robiya alone raised her children. Ten years ago, in order to earn income for the family, she began a baking business. Robiya is the manager of this business. Her children and two employees work in the bakery. Robiya's bakery always has a demand for lepeshka (bread), as they always offer it to customers fresh and hot. To continue the work she needs to buy flour. Due to insufficient funds, she applied for a loan. 
This loan is very important for her family to continue their business.

loans.use: To purchase flour for baking tajik lepeshka (bread)

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is 59 years old and married with three children.

She is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Gloria requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Gloria has been raising pigs for 27 years now, and has borrowed 18 times in the past from NWTF and more recently, from Kiva, to sustain her business.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Cleophas

texts.en:
Cleophas is a 52-year-old, married man with six children, living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He is a farmer and, at the same time, he rears cattle in order to boost his income. He faces the challenge of limited capital, but he has hopes of educating all his children to higher levels of learning. 

Cleophas needs a loan to improve his banana plantation by mulching and paying workers.

loans.use: to improve his banana plantation by mulching and paying workers.

loans.name: Felestus

texts.en: Felestus is a 37-year-old mother of six children living in Kasese Uganda. Felestus has sold second-hand clothes since 2000 to earn a living. She has a dream of expanding her business and educating her children. She is faced with challenges of competition, changes in weather that affect her business since she operates from an open place, and lack of enough capital. She is hard working and in need of a loan to buy second-hand clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy second-hand clothes for selling.

loans.name: Ngobi

texts.en:
Ngobi, 60, is a married father of with one child living in Bundibugyo-Uganda. At his age he works very hard at his business of cocoa buying and selling but he also has his personal cocoa garden that supplements the cocoa that he buys. He started the business to raise money to sustain his family.
He wants the loan to buy cocoa for resale.

loans.use: to buy cocoa for resale

loans.name: Fabiola Ines

texts.es:
Fabiola es la propietaria de una pequeña tienda de productos de la canasta familiar, en el sector de tierra alta una zona muy golpeada por la pobreza pero en medio de tanto problema social existen personas como Fabiola que quieren progresar y sacar a sus familias adelante con los recursos que tienen a la mano. 
Fabiola quiere solicitar un crédito para la compra de víveres, productos de aseo y granos, para comprarlos en cantidad y que le salgan más baratos.
El sueño de Fabiola es sacar a sus 3 hijos a estudiar que luchen por cambiar su presente.
texts.en:
Fabiola has a small store where she sells basic consumer goods.  It is in an area of high ground that is struck by poverty.  However, in the middle of so many social problems people like Fabiola exist.  They want to progress and get their families ahead using the resources that they have on hand.

Fabiola wants to request a loan to buy supplies, hygiene products, and grains.  She will buy them in bulk, as they are cheaper that way.

Fabiola’s dream is to give her three children an education and that they struggle to change their current situation.

loans.use: to buy supplies to stock her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a number of goats to increase his activity.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a number of goats to enlarge his business.

loans.name: Magreth

texts.en:
Magreth is in her mid 30s, married and a mother of four children who are at school. For six years now, she has run several businesses: a second-hand clothes, charcoal sales, fresh milk sales and drinking waters sales. She works from 7 a.m. to 8 p.m. daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit. 

This will be Magreth's third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to increase on her business and has paid them all back successfully. She is doing fine with the loans.  She used the profit to pay for school fees and covered household expenses.  She will use this loan to buy products for all her businesses. She dreams of building a house for renting.

Magreth will make sure that she pays back her loan successfully.

loans.use: to buy products for all her businesses.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
María tiene 42 años de edad, de estado civil soltera, tiene 2 hijos, vive en casa propia en el distrito de La Matanza. La vida en el distrito se desarrolla tranquilamente, en lo que respecta al negocio u a otra actividad que se desarrollan sus pobladores se dedican a la agricultura y ganadería y crianza de animales. Su comunidad está ubicada en la provincia de Morropón, región de Piura, costa norte de Perú.

La actividad que realiza María es el comercio de limón, La actividad la realiza desde hace más de 3 años, en el distrito La Matanza. El destino del crédito será para invertir en su negocio (compra de limón). El mercado presenta buenas perspectivas debido a que el producto es muy comercial en la zona y de manera semanal. María piensa trabajar otorgando buen producto a sus clientes e incrementando sus ventas. Lo que le permitirá en un corto plazo mejorar sus ingresos, aumentar sus ganancias y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
María, age 42, is single and has two children.  She lives in her own house in the Matanza district.  Life in the district is peaceful.  In regards to business, the inhabitants devote themselves to agriculture, livestock, and raising animals.  Her community is located in the Morropón province in the Piura region on the northern coast of Peru.

María sells limes.  She has been doing this for over three years in the La Matanza district.  She will use the loan to invest in her business (to buy limes).  The market presents good perspectives because the product is very commercial in the area, and people buy it weekly.

María plans on working by selling good products to her customers and increasing her sales.  This will allow her to improve her revenue in the short term, increase her profits, and, therefore, improve her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: to buy limes.

loans.name: Barros

texts.pt: O Senhor Barros é solteiro vive sozinho na casa dos pais.  Ele é docente e estudante, lecciona nas escolas do ensino básico, com o presente empréstimo quer adquirir um computador portátil. Tem  sonho de melhorar a carreira e formar uma familia. Tem como maior desafio terminar o ensino superior.
texts.en: Barros is single and lives with his parents. He's a teacher and a student. He teaches elementary school. With the current loan he wishes to purchase a laptop computer. His dream is to get ahead in his career and start a family. His biggest challenge is finishing college.

loans.use: to purchase a laptop computer.

loans.name: Manuel

texts.pt:
Manuel de 45 anos de idade casado tem 2 filhos com idades escolar. Manuel e motorista a mais de 5 anos o seu horario de trabalho e das 7am as 19:00h com algumas horas de descanso e tambem folga 4 dias, A esposa e criadora de aves  possui um aviario no quintal da sua residencia.
 Com o valor de emprestimo vai comprar cimento, areia, pedra para concluir obras de vedacao de um murro na sua residencia e ampliar o seu aviario
O seu sonho e fazer crescer o seu negocio e tornar se o maior fornrcedor de frangos.
 O seu maior desafio e de concluir a sua obra para melhorar os rendimentos da sua familia.
texts.en: Manuel is 45 years old and is married with 2 school-aged children. Manuel has been a driver for more than 5 years, working from 7am to 7pm with a few hours' break and 4 days off as well. His wife raises chickens and has a chicken coop on their home farm. With this loan, Manuel will buy cement, sand and stone to finish building a fence wall around their home as well as expanding their coop. His dream is to grow his business and become the largest supplier of chickens. His greatest challenge is finishing his building work so that he can improve his family's income.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand and stone to finish his work building a fence wall around his home.

loans.name: Karule

texts.en:
Karule is a 39-year-old married father of six children living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. He has a stationery shop as his major business that helps him survive. He started this business to help him support his family and he is very hard working. He is faced with a challenge of seasonality, especially in holidays when schools have closed and his sales are low and prices fluctuate. He hopes to expand his business.
Karule wants the loan to buy more stationery to sell.

loans.use: to buy more stationery products to sell.

loans.name: Eleoteria

texts.en:
Eleoteria is 38 years old and married with two children who are both in school.

She earns a living by farming vegetables in the Philippines. Eleoteria is borrowing 7,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies. Eleoteria has been farming vegetables for 10 years and also earns additional income from her general store and raising livestock businesses.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is 51 years old and married with five children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. She is borrowing 9,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Gloria has been raising pigs for two years and also earns additional income from a general store. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Tomas Antonio

texts.es:
Tomas es un productor avícola, se dedica a la cría de aves en el sector de tierra alta, una actividad muy común y muy competitiva del sector a tan alto grado que quien ofrezca el mejor precio tienen los clientes obligando a los demás productores a bajar sus precios. 
Tomas es padre de 4 hijos y a pesar de que todos ellos son mayores de edad él depende en su totalidad de su negocio para poder comer un bocado de comida o pagar unos servicios públicos como agua, luz etc.
Solicita un crédito para compra de herramientas y adecuar sus estaderos de pollos  de igual manera comprar insumos como alimento de engorde.
La ayuda de este crédito le dará un gran impulso para su negocio pues tendrá mejores estaderos para que sus animales no mueran por las condiciones climáticas y cuido para que engorden  rápidamente.
texts.en:
Tomas is a poultry farmer. He makes a living raising poultry in the Tierra Alta area. It is a very common and very competitive business in the area to such a high degree that they who offer the best prices have all the customers, obliging the rest of the producers to lower their prices.

Tomas is the father of 4 children and in spite of all of them being adults he depends completely on his business in order to eat a bite of food or to pay for public utilities like water, electricity, etc.

He requests a loan to buy tools and to modify his chicken coops as well as to buy inputs like feed for fattening. The help from this loan will give his business a great boost since he will have better coops so that his animals do not die from weather or conditions of care and so that they grow quickly.

loans.use: to buy tools and to modify a chicken coop.

loans.name: Colinas Del Exito Group

texts.es: Colina del Éxito es un grupo solidario integrado por tres microempresarias laboriosas, coordinado por la señora Ana de 30 años de edad, casada, su negocio es una pulpería en su hogar desde hace 6 años. El crédito lo solicita para invertir en productos tales como queso, gaseosa, pan, jugos, sardinas, granos básicos, aceite, etc. La segunda socia es la señora Natalia, de 21 años de edad, quien ofrece ropa usada y cosméticos desde hace dos años y medio, y Kenia quien tiene la edad de 21 años, propietario de una pequeña tienda de ropa nueva en su domicilio desde hace dos años.
texts.en:
Colina del Éxito is a solidarity group comprised of three hard-working small business owners coordinated by Ana. Ana is 30 years old, married, and for six years she has run a small grocery store out of her home. She is asking for the loan to buy products like cheese, fizzy drinks, bread, juice, sardines, bulk grains, oil and more.

The second member is Natalia, who is 21 years old and has sold used clothes and cosmetics for two and a half years.

The third member is Kenia, who is 21 years old and has been the owner of a small clothing store in her home for two years.

loans.use: to buy basic goods, such as cheese, fizzy drinks, bread, juice, sardines, bulk grains, oil and more.

loans.name: Hauwa

texts.en:
Hauwa is a maize farmer from Makera, Nigeria.

A loan from Kiva helps Hauwa to purchase fertilizer for her crops and also to obtain a training course in agronomy and business. This will enable her to reap up to 30 bags/hectare of maize - double the national average of 14 bags/hectare. 

Also, before joining Babban Gona, she had to sell her maize at low prices soon after harvest in order to pay for urgent expenses, such as food and school fees. With the Kiva loan and Babban Gona’s support, she can now store her maize at harvest and sell it later at prices up to 40% higher. 

This allows her to generate earnings of up to $1,000/hectare, more than four times Nigerian farmers' annual income. Hauwa intends to use the extra income to expand her farmland, and hopes to become the most profitable farmer in her community.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and store her harvest to store it all for greater profits

loans.name: Glecer

texts.en:
Glecer is 37 years old and has four children. She is married and three of her children are in school.

Glecer is in the agricultural business, farming vegetables in the Philippines. She requested a loan of 7,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Glecer has been farming vegetables for 15 years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Salisu

texts.en:
Salisu is a maize farmer from Nigeria. He is the father of 1 child.

A loan from Kiva helps Salisu to purchase fertilizer for his crops and also to obtain a training course in agronomy and business. This will enable him to reap up to 30 bags/hectare of maize - double the national average of 14 bags/hectare. 

Also, before joining Babban Gona, he had to sell his maize at low prices soon after harvest in order to pay for urgent expenses, such as food and school fees. With the Kiva loan and Babban Gona’s support, he can now store his maize at harvest and sell it later at prices up to 40% higher. 

This allows him to generate earnings of up to $1,000/hectare, more than four times Nigerian farmers' annual income. When asked, Salisu spoke of his ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, eventually hoping to move to the city with his family.

loans.use: To purchase agricultural inputs and store his harvest to sell it later for greater profits

loans.name: Kasanga Thiyikulhaye Group

texts.en:
Goret is a forty-year-old female living in Kasese, Uganda. She is married with nine children, four of whom attend school. 

Goret runs a retail shop where she has worked for five years. She also practices farming for additional income. Goret has a dream of educating her children in spite of limited capital. 

Goret is a hardworking woman who wants the money to buy sugar, salt, millet flour, cassava flour, and other merchandise for selling. Goret is appreciating the support they are given.

loans.use: to buy sugar, salt, millet flour, cassava flour, and other merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Edith

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Edith works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening. Edith is borrowing 15,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy fishing gear and other equipment for her fishing business.

Edith has been sustaining her business activities through her past 3 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en: Godfrey is a 30-year-old married man with three children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He is in the lucrative motorcycle transport business commonly known as boda boda and at the same time makes bricks. He faces challenges of bad roads and competition. Besides that, he has hopes of educating all his children to higher levels of learning. Godfrey needs a loan to buy building materials like iron sheets, timber and doors.

loans.use: to buy building materials like iron sheets, timber and doors.

loans.name: Tu

texts.en: Tu would like to take a further loan to buy soybeans and sugar to make soybean milk for selling from her shop. Her previous loan enabled her to increase her sales and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attract new customers and increase sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy soybeans and sugar to make and sell soy milk.

loans.name: Ly

texts.en:
Ly is requesting a new loan to buy a range of new products, such as food and beverages, to restock her general store. This purchase will help her to better meet the needs of her customers. 

Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business and offer her customers a greater variety of products. She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her store and increase sales and will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy beverages and food to stock her store.

loans.name: Maria Eugenia Del Socorro

texts.es:
María una tierna, trabajadora, luchadora e inalcanzable mujer de 49 años que divide su vida en tres actividades, ser madre, esposa y una venta de mercancía, específicamente venta de cazado para dama y hombre casual, una actividad que inicio como alternativa para conseguir dinero extra para su hogar y sentirse útil y nunca esperar nada de nadie tener siempre con que comprar lo que quiere y ayudar a sus hijos que ya son mayores de edad.
Solicita un auxilio crediticio para la compra de surtido en calzado y si le alcanza comprara insumos para vender alimentos Buscando aumentar sus ingresos. 
Su sueño es un día abrir un local y dejar de vender ambulantemente.
texts.en:
María is a loving, hard-working, determined and incomparable 49-year-old woman who splits her time between being a mother, a wife and running a stall where she sells women's shoes and casual men's shoes specifically. She started the business as an alternative way to earn extra money for her home, to feel useful and never wait for anything from anybody else. A way to always have money to buy what she wants, and to help her children who are now grown up. 

She is asking for a loan to buy shoe stock and, if there is money left over, to buy supplies to sell food. She is looking to increase her income. Her dream is to one day open a store and stop selling as a street vendor.

loans.use: to buy shoes to continue with her business and, if there is extra money left over, to buy supplies to sell food.

loans.name: Talatu

texts.en:
Talatu is a maize farmer from Gwani, in th Kaduna state of Nigeria.

Before becoming a Babban Gona member, Talatu had to sell her maize at low prices soon after harvest, to cater for her immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Talatu can now store her maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

Talatu, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to expand her farmland, and hopes to become the most profitable farmer in her community.

loans.use: To meet urgent expenses (food, clothes) and store her harvest to sell it later for greater profits

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell to the customers in the fish market.

loans.name: Yunusa

texts.en:
Yunusa is a maize farmer from Hana Aki, Nigeria.

A loan from Kiva helps Yunusa to purchase fertilizer for his crops and also to obtain a training course in agronomy and business. This will enable him to reap up to 30 bags/hectare of maize - double the national average of 14 bags/hectare. 

Also, before joining Babban Gona, he had to sell his maize at low prices soon after harvest in order to pay for urgent expenses, such as food and school fees. With the Kiva loan and Babban Gona’s support, he can now store his maize at harvest and sell it later at prices up to 40% higher. 

This allows him to generate earnings of up to $1,000/hectare, more than four times Nigerian farmers' annual income. Yunusa, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to expand his farmland, and hopes to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: To purchase agricultural inputs and store his harvest to sell it later at higher prices

loans.name: Yusuf

texts.en:
Yusuf is a maize farmer from from Kwankwani, Nigeria.

A loan from Kiva helps Yusuf to purchase fertilizer for his crops and also to obtain a training course in agronomy and business. This will enable him to reap up to 30 bags/hectare of maize - double the national average of 14 bags/hectare. 

Also, before joining Babban Gona, he had to sell his maize at low prices soon after harvest in order to pay for urgent expenses, such as food and school fees. With the Kiva loan and Babban Gona’s support, he can now store his maize at harvest and sell it later at prices up to 40% higher. 

This allows him to generate earnings of up to $1,000/hectare, more than four times Nigerian farmers' annual income. Yusuf, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to expand his farmland, and hopes to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: To purchase agricultural inputs and store his harvest to sell it later at higher prices

loans.name: Ema

texts.en:
Ema is a maize farmer from Kyasge, Nigeria. 

Before joining Babban Gona, Ema had to sell his maize at low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs. 

With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Ema can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

Ema, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to expand his farmland, and hopes to ensure other members of his community are lifted out of poverty.

loans.use: To meet urgent expenses (food, clothes) and store his harvest to sell it later at higher prices

loans.name: Elvis

texts.en:
Elvis is 28 years old. He is married, and together with his wife they have been blessed with two children who are seven and two years old. His wife provides additional income for her family.

Elvis is an agroforester, a business he has done for the last six years, earning a monthly income of KES 22,000. Elvis has requested his third loan with VisionFund Kenya of KES 11,250, which he will use to purchase polythene tubes, fertilizers, a wheelbarrow, and seeds for his new tree plantations. He successfully repaid his previous loans.

With the anticipated profits, Elvis will be able to buy a piece of land. His hopes and dreams for the future are to have a stable source of income and hence diversify to large-scale farming.

loans.use: to purchase polythene tubes, fertilizers, and seeds

loans.name: Katweyimusye Group Kyaforongo

texts.en:
Restetuta is a 44-year-old married Ugandan woman living in Kagadi. She has been selling produce and farming for 10 years. She hopes to grow her business and reduce the cost of living. 

Restetuta intends to use a loan to buy rice and ground nuts to sell. She is a member of Katweimusye Group Kyaforongo, in which each member guarantees the others to get a loan since they don’t pledge securities.

The extra person in the photo is also a group member who has savings in the group, has guaranteed them but has not taken the loan.

loans.use: to buy rice and ground nuts to sell.

loans.name: Ngoc

texts.en:
Ngoc would like to take another loan to buy a larger quantity of aluminum products to sell at her store. 

Her previous loan enabled her to increase her sales and earn a higher income to support her family. 

Ngoc hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attracting new customers, and increasing sales. She also hopes that, through the loan, she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a larger quantity of aluminum products to sell at her store.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
This is Mary. She was born in Ugenya, Kenya. She started developing interest in farming when was young and she has liked farming, planting trees, taking care of animals among other things.

In 2012, she leased a plot of land along a lake, and she started her horticulture farming. Her farming has helped her a great deal to support her mother and three of her siblings' children that are orphaned.

She wants to expand her business by leasing more land to be able increase her earning and irrigate her farm. She wants in addition to diversify her farming into poultry by buying eggs hatching them and rearing the birds. With a Kiva loan she intends to begin poultry farming.

loans.use: to start a poultry farming business

loans.name: John

texts.en:
This is John, a young entrepreneur farmer from Kenya. 

He is currently practicing horticulture and dairy farming. He looked for employment but he couldn't find anything and thus decided to be self-employed as a farmer. 

With farming, he has been able to support his family and manage his upkeep. He dreams of becoming the best farmer in his locality and being an example to the other youth. With a Kiva loan he will be able to buy one more cow.

loans.use: to pay for a cow

loans.name: Inusa Toma

texts.en:
Inusa Toma is a maize farmer from Kuradawa village, in Nigeria's Kaduna state.

Before becoming a Babban Gona member, Inusa Toma had to sell his maize at low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Inusa Toma can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

Inusa Toma, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to expand his farmland, and hopes to ensure his children are educated and have professional jobs.

loans.use: To meet urgent expenses (food, clothes), and store his harvest to sell it later at higher prices

loans.name: Musyoki

texts.en:
This is a business lady who has been selling vegetables in her area for more than ten years. 

She dreams of owning a big stall from which she can sell her produce more comfortably. With her earnings she is able to take care of her family and take her children to school. 

With a Kiva loan, she will be able to add more stock to her business and keep her supply constant.

loans.use: To purchase more stock for her food stall

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is married and blessed with five children. He comes from a poor background and his parents could not afford to educate him, for which he was forced to drop out of school after primary education. He immediately embarked on farming to make a living. He is involved in farming of tomatoes and rearing of goats. 

David is encouraged by profits from his farming activities and is now saving money to buy a parcel of land. Using the proceeds from his farm, he is confident to offer his children good education up to college level to compensate for what he did not get.

With a loan from Kiva, David intends to improve his farming activity to change fortunes for his family.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs and dairy goats

loans.name: Kevin

texts.en:
Kevin is a married man. He has one child. He describes himself as honest and determined. 

He operates a taxi business where he transports customers using his taxi. He has been involved in this business for 4 years. His business is located in a busy area. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of enough capital.

Kevin will use the KES 20,000 loan to open a second business selling fish and meat by buying stock. His business goal is to own a tour company within 5 years. 

He hopes that in the future, he will educate his children. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance bank.

loans.use: to open a business selling fish and meat.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a married man. He has two children, ages two years and four years. 

Ali operates a retail business where he sells clothes. He has been involved in this business for five years. He will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy more stocks of clothes. 

He hopes that, in the future, he will be able to import goods to sell. This is Ali's second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. His previous loan was successfully repaid.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of clothes.

loans.name: Belgica Jesús

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Nuevo Amanecer se reúne en el sitio Bajo de Montecristi en la provincia de Manabí, es un pequeño lugar rodeado de mucha vegetación, sus habitantes se dedican a diferentes ocupaciones, como comerciantes, y empelados de fabricas.
En este lugar vive la señora Bélgica, tiene 45 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de 20 y 14  de edad, el mayor estudia en universidad y el menor en colegio. Su esposo trabaja en una fábrica en Manta.
Doña Bélgica es una mujer que le encanta trabajar y con esto  ayudarle a su marido, ella se dedica al comercio, vende  sabanas, sobrecamas, cortinas y productos de catalogo de Avon (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas), Trabaja tres a cuatro  días a la semana en sus recorridos y también vende en su casa hasta donde llegan sus clientes más conocidos, ella deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada ocho días. Tiene 2 años que se dedica a esta actividad con la cual se gana lo suyo por el bien de su familia.
Este crédito es justamente para comprar sabanas, sobrecamas y  cosméticos. Está en el Grupo De Crédito desde hace tres ciclos  y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan con los créditos. Sus sueños es darles la mejor educación  a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The Nuevo Amanecer (New Dawn) communal bank meets in Bajo de Montecristi, in the Manabí province. It is a small placed surrounded by lush vegetation. Its inhabitants follow a variety of occupations such as merchants and factory workers.

Bélgica, aged 45, lives in this area. She is married and has two children, ages 20 and 14. The eldest goes to university and the youngest to high school. Her husband works at a factory in Manta.

Bélgica is a woman who loves working and helping her husband out with her own income. She makes a living working as a merchant. She sells sheets, bedspreads, drapes, and products from the Avon catalogue (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes, and women's accessories). She works her route three or four days a week, and she also sells her products at her home, where her most reliable customers come. She offers her products on credit and collects the payments every eight days. For two years, she has been running this business, with which she earns her own money for the well-being of her family.

She will use this loan to buy sheets, bedspreads, and cosmetics. 

She has been a member of the communal bank for the past three loan cycles, and she likes it because of the support the loans provide. 

Her dream is to give her children the best education.

loans.use: to buy sheets, bedspreads, and cosmetics.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a 25 year old single man living in Kagadi, Uganda. He has been a medical clinical officer for 2 years now, ever since he was inspired by the nature of the service. He is a committed and hard-working person who desires to build a strong estate. 

Joseph is asking for a loan to buy construction materials like bricks to build his house.

loans.use: to buy construction materials like bricks to build his house.

loans.name: Peace Group

texts.en:
Peace is a group of two ladies and one man. They all live in Accra-Teshie, Ghana. They are asking for a loan of GHS 3,400 from ID-Ghana to sell curtains, bed sheet, skirts, ladies top, sugar cane, gari (cassava flour) and grocery. 

Henry is a 40-year-old married man with children. He has been selling curtains and beds sheets for six years. He supports his wife in taking care of the children by moving door-to-door to sell his goods. He wants to improve his business, and most of what he earns goes to family expenses. Therefore, he will take GHS 1,000 from the total loan from ID-Ghana in order to buy more goods. He will save part of his profit and also invest back part after he finishes repayment of the loan.

loans.use: To buy curtains and bedsheets to sell to customers

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
As a father to 2 children, the great desire to see them both grow up to be professionals is what fills Robert with enthusiasm and inspiration. Robert is 32 years old and works tirelessly to raise animals. Through these humble tasks, he aspires to offer both of his children a university education.

Robert has a small piece of land that he makes use of to earn a living. For over 10 years, his income has come from selling milk, vegetables and maize and other personal businesses. 

Robert's schedule as a farmer is always tight. Therefore, it is important to him that the means of transportation for his produce to the market is fast and easily available. This way, he can transport his produce to the market in time and still have the opportunity to transport other farmers' produce at a small fee. 
That is why Robert is kindly seeking a loan to buy a motorbike.

Robert is very determined to succeed and very disciplined with finances. He plans that through accumulated profits, he will be able to provide a secure future for his family.

loans.use: to buy another motorbike

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Hello lenders, meet Margaret. She is a smallholder farmer based in the Thika area of Kenya where the earth is fertile and red. Margaret is happily married, and she and her husband have been blessed with four lovely children. The couple has made an honest living practising mixed-farming for 14 good years. Margaret's primary sources of income are milk, eggs, and some personal business she engages in to make extra cash. 

Over a long period of time, Margaret has slowly, but surely, developed a passionate interest in poultry farming. The biggest challenge she faces, however, is a lack of capital to buy additional poultry birds. Therefore, she is seeking a loan from Kiva lenders, via Juhudi Kilimo, which she will use to purchase high-quality breeds of poultry that are resistant to diseases and lay more eggs. 

Having additional poultry will bring a significant increase in egg production and, consequently, more income. She can also derive other products from poultry such as meat, which is a plus to the overall income generated. 

Her plan is to improve her family's living conditions. Your loan will bring joy to this family because she is going to make use of it in the most constructive and impactful way.

loans.use: To buy high-quality breeds of poultry

loans.name: David

texts.en:
This is David. He is a small-scale horticulture farmer in Kiambu Kenya. He is a father of two girls and three boys and is a guardian to his orphaned grandson who is now in secondary education. David started cultivating cabbages and kales on a 0.75 acre plot in 1992. To date, he has  expanded his farming to a farm of 1.5 acres. He has been able to provide for his children and grandson using proceeds from his farm and has educated them to high school level.

He has grown his farming activity and now employs 5 workers on his farm. His major challenges in the horticulture business is outbreak of diseases and inadequate finances to enable him meet demand from his customers.

With a loan from Kiva, David will grow his farming activities, employ more laborers and meet demand from his customers. This will enable him provide for his dependents, especially his grandson, and improve his family's living standards.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs for his horticulture farm

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en: Gladys is a 57-year-old married woman. She describes herself as a very hardworking woman. She sells smoked fish, and she has been involved in this business for twenty years. Her sales are made by moving door-to-door, and her primary customers are the general public. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of capital. She will use the 1,800 GHS loan to buy more fish and smoke it for sale, and she will use the anticipated profits to expand the business. Her business goal is to have a big business within five years.

loans.use: to buy more fish and smoke it to sell to customers.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is 41 years. She is married and together with her spouse, she has been blessed with three children of 22, 19 and 16 years old. Her spouse is employed but with minimum income.

Catherine sells second-hand clothes, a business she has done for the last five years, earning a monthly income of KES. 9,000.She has requested her first loan with VisionFund Kenya of KES 10,000 which she will use to pay school fees for her children.

With the anticipated profits from her business, Catherine will be able to expand her business further by getting more second-hand clothes as well as repaying her loan. Her hopes and dreams for the future are to raise her standard of living and become a wholesaler and supplier of both used and new clothes.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia offers bananas and charcoal for sale for ten years. She is 50 years of age, a widow blessed with two children. Virginia would like to improve her vending activity; that’s the reason why she’s requesting a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy 300 sacks of charcoal and 2,000 kilograms of bananas to sell. 

Virginia hopes that her loan will enable her to improve her sales and income. In this way, she could sustain her family's basic needs and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase 300 sacks of charcoal and 2,000 kilograms of banana to sell

loans.name: Thuy

texts.en: Thuy would like to take a further loan to buy good quality food to sell from her stall. Thuy's previous loan enabled her to increase her sales and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attract new customers and increase sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase good quality food for her stall

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
Liza is 28 years old, married and has three children. One of her children is in school.

Liza is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Liza requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Liza has been raising pigs for seven years, and she has borrowed 10 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Liza would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a quality dairy cow.

loans.name: Tinh

texts.en: Tinh is requesting a new loan to buy materials to make handbags for selling from his shop. Tinh's previous loan enabled him to expand his business and earn a higher income to support his family. He hopes that another loan will assist him in increasing the size of his business, attract new customers and increase his sales. He also hopes that through the loan he can increase his income and improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase materials to make handbags for selling from his shop.

loans.name: Thuy's Group

texts.en: Thuy is 46 years old and lives with her children. For the past 3 years, Thuy has been running a food stall from the front of her house to earn an income to support her family. She is the Group Leader of a 5-member loan group who all live in Ho Chi Minh City. In the picture, she is the second from the left wearing a black blouse. Each of the other group members are requesting loans to fund income-generating activities. Thuy is requesting a loan to purchase a better quality and greater variety of food and ingredients to make better meals for her customers. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her customers and attract additional ones. She also hopes that through her loan she will be able to increase her income and save money for any future difficulties facing her family.

loans.use: To buy food and ingredients to make meals for selling.

loans.name: Sule Danju

texts.en:
Sule Danju is a maize farmer from Hayin Mallam Bawa, in Nigeria's Kaduna state. 

Before becoming a Babban Gona member, Sule Danju had to sell his maize at low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Sule Danju can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

Sule Danju, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to expand his farmland, and hopes to ensure other members of his community are lifted out of poverty.

loans.use: To meet urgent expenses (food, clothes...), and store his harvest to sell it later for greater profits

loans.name: Anarela

texts.en:
Anarela is taking out a loan of $ 800.00 to improve her business. She is married, and she has one child. She is running a second-hand clothing business that helps her to generate income for her family. She will use the loan to buy pants. She opened her second-hand clothing business in 2006 with her own working capital of $300.00.  

She is a hard-working woman, and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: To buy pants

loans.name: Dolores

texts.en:
Along with her husband’s help, Dolores and her sari sari, or general store, have been in business for the past twenty years. She also raises hogs and farms rice.

Dolores is applying for a 30,000 PHP loan through ASKI to buy additional grocery items such as soft drinks, canned goods, cooking oil and eggs to sell. She hopes that her store and other endeavors continue to thrive so she will be able to sustain her family and get ahead in life.

loans.use: to buy additional stock for her sari sari.

loans.name: Sandra

texts.en:
Sandra is a 31-year-old married woman and a mother of five children from Concepcion, Iloilo. For the past 8 years, Sandra and her husband have been engaged in a fishing business. This is the source of their income. 
 
Sandra is a hard working and dedicated person. She wants to give her best for her children's welfare. As of now, she needs a loan for the improvement of their fishing business. She is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, hooks and other items. This loan will enable her and her husband to augment their catch thus giving them more fish to sell in the market. 

In the future, Sandra hopes to make their business more sustainable and productive. Moreover, she wants to save money for her children's schooling.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, hooks and other items

loans.name: Melde

texts.en:
Melde is 49 years old and married.

Melde is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Melde requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Melde has been raising pigs for three years now, and has borrowed 6 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Melde would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Dung

texts.en:
Dung, 45, is married and has one child. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband is a driver for hire.

Dung has been running a food stall in front of her house for eleven years. She is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying more quality food and ingredients to better satisfy her customers.

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions..

loans.use: To buy more quality food and ingredients to better satisfy her customers

loans.name: Trang

texts.en:
Trang is a 33-year-old married woman. She lives with her two children and husband in Ho Chi Minh City. For ten years she and her husband have operated a soft-drinks stall in front of her house.

Trang would like a loan to repair her kitchen, install plumbing and connect to the main water supply. Trang hopes that through her loan she will be able to offer a better service to her customers, increase her income and save money for any future difficulties facing her family.

loans.use: to repair her kitchen, pay for plumbing and connect to the main water supply

loans.name: Thuy

texts.en:
Thuy is 48 years old and married with two children. She lives with her family in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband is a driver for hire. She has been running a general store to earn a living. 

She started her business nine years ago. She intends to take a loan to gradually expand her business by buying a variety of basic products (such as food and beverages) to sell from her store. 

She hopes that her business runs smoothly and will help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a variety of different basic products (such as food and beverages) to sell from her store

loans.name: Yen's Group

texts.en:
Yen is 55 years old and lives with her three children and husband. Her husband works as an electrician. For the past 4 years, Yen has been running a general store and internet shop from the front of her house to earn an income to support her family. Yen is the Group Leader of a 6-member loan group who all live in Ho Chi Minh City. In the picture, she is the third from the right wearing glasses. Each of the other group members are requesting loans to fund income-generating activities.

Yen is requesting a loan to upgrade the computers of her shop. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her customers and attract additional ones. She also hopes that through her loan she will be able to increase her income and save money for any future difficulties facing her family.

loans.use: to upgrade computers for her shop

loans.name: Hoang

texts.en:
Hoang is a 31-year-old married man. He lives with his three daughters and wife in Ho Chi Minh City. He and his wife earn money selling drinking water. For 5 years, they have run this business to sell drinking water to people in their community.

Hoang would like a loan to purchase a greater quantity of drinking water to sell to his customers. He hopes this will enable him to better meet the needs of his customers and attract additional customers. 

He also hopes that through his loan he will be able to increase his income and save money for any future difficulties facing his family.

loans.use: to purchase a greater quantity of drinking water to sell

loans.name: Sen

texts.en: Sen, 41, lives in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City with her family, including two children and her husband. Sen and her husband earn money through their business producing slippers. Sen is sometimes unable to provide the volume of slippers required by her customers. Consequently, she would like to get a loan to buy a larger stock of material to make slippers and increase her production to meet her customers' needs. She also hopes her business will ensure that her family members, and especially her children, will have a better education and a better future.

loans.use: to buy a larger stock of material to make slippers and increase her production to meet her customers' needs

loans.name: Rabi

texts.en:
Rabi is a maize farmer from Kwankwani, Nigeria.

Before becoming a Babban Gona member, Rabi had to sell her maize at low prices soon after harvest, to cater for her immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Rabi can now store her maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

Rabi, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to expand her farmland, and hopes to ensure other members of her community are lifted out of poverty.

loans.use: To meet urgent expenses (food, clothes...), and store her harvest to sell it later for greater profits

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim is a maize farmer from the Janfalan, in Nigeria's Kaduna state. 

Before becoming a Babban Gona member, Ibrahim had to sell his maize at low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Ibrahim can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

Ibrahim, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to expand his farmland, and hopes to make more money for himself and his family.

loans.use: To meet urgent expenses (food, clothes...), and store his harvest to sell it later for greater profits

loans.name: Mauricio

texts.es:
Mauricio es un joven de 20 años de edad que monto un taller de reparación de motocicletas y que quieren solicitar un crédito el cual invertirá en la compra de una pistola automática y un comprensor, artículos indispensables para él y que por falta de capital le ha tocado alquilarlos para poder prestar el servicio. 
Vale la pena apoyar a este joven que prefiere trabajar a estar en grupos ilegales o en casa sin ser productivo, un joven con mucha creatividad, aspiraciones y sueños como comprar vivienda y dará su juventud al trabajo para cumplir sus metas.
texts.en: Mauricio is a 20 year old young man who set up a motorcycle repair shop. He wants to apply for a loan to buy a nail gun and a compressor, indispensable items for him. Because of a lack of capital he has had to rent these in order to do his job. It is worth helping out this young man who prefers to work instead of being in illegal groups or at home without being productive. He is a young man with a lot of creativity, hopes and dreams: one of these being to buy a house. He will devote his youth to work so he can reach his goals.

loans.use: to buy a nail gun and a compressor.

loans.name: Al-Yasa'a

texts.en:
Al-yasa'a is a maize farmer from Liman, Nigeria.

Before becoming a Babban Gona member, Al-yasa'a had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Al-yasa'a can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

Al-yasa'a, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to expand his farmland, and hopes to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: To meet urgent expenses (food, clothes...), and store his harvest to sell it later for greater profits.

loans.name: Mitaaba Group

texts.fr:
Mitaaba est un groupe de 2 femmes qui font toutes les deux la restauration. Abiba à 7 ans d’espérance dans la restauration. Elle est mariée et mère de 7 ans dont un continue l'école. Avec ce prêt, cette brave dame va payer de la boisson et  s'approvisionner les denrées non périssables comme le riz, les spaghetti, de l'huile, etc...
Abiba propose différents menus à sa clientèle donc ce prêt lui permettra de diversifier plus. En plus de la restauration, elle fait le commerce des pagnes donc les remboursements se feront sans aucune difficulté. Abiba a 3 employés qui l'aide dans son activité qu'elle rémunère par mois. Avec le bénéfice elle pourra aide son époux à faire face aux dépenses de la maison et continuer son activité.
texts.en:
The Mitaaba group is composed of two women who both work in the restaurant business. 

Abiba has seven years experience in the restaurant business. She is married and a mother of seven children, who all go to school.

With this loan, this brave woman is going to buy drinks and procure nonperishable food products like rice, spaghetti, oil, etc. Abiba offers different menus to her clients, and this loan will allow her to diversify even more. 

In addition to her restaurant, she also sells pagnes. This extra work ensures that repayments on her loan will not be difficult.

Abiba has three employees who help her with her business, who she pays each month.

With her earnings, she will be able to help her husband with their family's household expenses and continue her business.

loans.use: to buy drinks and nonperishable food for her restaurant

loans.name: Cherine

texts.en:
Cherine is a 25-year-old single lady who is trying desperately to continue her university studies despite her family's low financial resources.

Today, Cherine is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to pay her university's tuition fees. This loan is very important to her so she will be able to take the first step towards a better future. Cherine hopes to finish her university degree and open her own clothes shop to help her family in covering their needs and expenses.

loans.use: to pay her university's tuition fees

loans.name: Trust Group

texts.en:
Martha is in her early forties and divorced. She has two children, one of whom is grown while the other is still in school. She has been running a general store for six years now. She works from 6:30 a.m. to 9:00 p.m. daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.

Martha took out and successfully repaid a prior loan through Tujijenge Tanzania, which she used to buy more stock for her store. She used her profits to pay school fees and household expenses.

She is now applying for a second loan, this one for 2,900,000 TZS. She will share this loan with her group named Trust, which consist of four members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan. She will use her portion to invest in her store.

Martha’s dream is to own a car.

loans.use: to invest in her store.

loans.name: Renilda

texts.en:
Renilda is 45 years old and has four children.  Renilda is married and three of her children are in school.

Renilda is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Renilda requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Renilda has been raising pigs for seven years now, and has borrowed 8 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Renilda would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 49 years old and married with four children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.  

Jocelyn has a business selling purified drinking water in the Philippines. Jocelyn requested a PHP 14,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more stocks of drinking water to sell.

Jocelyn has been in this business for two years. In the future, Jocelyn would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of drinking water to sell.

loans.name: Marjorie

texts.en:
Marjorie is 38 years old and married with four children who are all in school.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Marjorie is borrowing PHP 40,000 through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Marjorie has been raising pigs for five years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Marjorie

texts.en:
Marjorie is 43 years old and married with six children.

Marjorie works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Marjorie has been in this business for twelve years and has previously received funds through Kiva.

Marjorie aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Kim

texts.en:
Kim is requesting a new loan to buy a range of new products, such as food and beverages, to restock her general store. This purchase will help her to better meet the needs of her customers. 

Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business and offer her customers a greater variety of products. She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her store and increase sales, and will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a range of new products, such as food and beverages, to restock her general store.

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Merlita works hard to support her family.

She has a business selling personal products in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from food vending. Merlita is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF in order to buy more items such as perfume, shampoo, body lotion and other beauty products.

Merlita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 30 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money in order to support the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy more items such as perfume, shampoo, body lotion and other beauty products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy wood.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy salt, milk, cigarettes, soy sauce etc.

loans.name: Maher

texts.en:
Maher is a 24-year-old young man who lives with his family in the capital city of Sana'a, Yemen. He works hard to provide a good life for his family. He has been working in the business of phone accessories for 2 years. In the beginning, he started with the telecommunication center. Little by little, he expanded his business to a phone accessories store. He has many ideas for his business that he’s been implementing step by step. He is a very dignified, confident man, and his customers give him good references. Lately, he has been thinking about providing his store with a bigger variety of products in order to attract more customers and fulfill demand. This idea was the impetus to request a loan of 100,000 YER from AMB to buy a variety of products such as phone accessories to be able to meet all of the demands of his customers. 

Maher looks forward to opening a saving account in AMB.

loans.use: to buy a variety of products such as phone accessories to be able to meet all of the demands of his customers.

loans.name: Christopher

texts.en: Christopher is a 53-year-old hard-working man with 6 children living in Fort Portal Uganda. He is a farmer, and at the same time he owns a retail shop. He faces the challenges of limited capital. In spite of this, he dreams of expanding his business to new areas. Christopher needs a loan to buy stocks of general merchandise items such as sugar, soap and cooking items to sell.

loans.use: to buy stocks of general merchandise items such as sugar, soap and cooking items to sell.

loans.name: Rabih

texts.en:
Rabih is a 23-year-old single young man who started working nearly a year ago in a restaurant to cover his university's fees in addition to his expenses and the needs of his family who are suffering from their low financial situation.

Today, due to the increasing living costs, Rabih's salary is not enough any more to cover all of his needs; thus, he is acquiring an educational loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to pay his university's tuition fees. He hopes to finish his studies and open his own computer shop to improve his family's living conditions and increase his income.

loans.use: to pay his university's tuition fees

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy milk and ghee for selling.

loans.name: Norah

texts.en:
Norah is sixty, not married and has two children. She lives and works hard in Kagadi, Uganda.

Norah has sold produce since 2000 and also manages rentals on her property to generate income. She is applying for a 1,000,000 UGX loan through HOFOKAM to buy additional maize and rice to sell.

Despite difficulties with clients who fail to pay rent on time, Norah would like to build more income-generating rentals on her property.

loans.use: to buy additional maize and rice to sell.

loans.name: Swaumu

texts.en: Swaumu is 23 years old and lives with her uncle in the Morogoro District in Tanzania. Swaumu is a Camfed Learner Guide helping students recognize their potential and encouraging them to do well in school by teaching them the value of education. Swaumu has a cosmetics stall near a bus stand in Morogoro. She doesn't currently have a shop, so she walks around the bus stand to sell her products. She is requesting a Kiva loan to enable her to rent a space for her shop and increase the amount of products she sells. She plans to use the profits obtained from the loan to buy a piece of land and to help her parents buy food.

loans.use: to rent a space for her shop and increase the amount of products she sells

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes is 21 years old, a single mother of one. She lives with her aunt in the Kilosa District in Tanzania. She is a Camfed Learner Guide who teaches students in a secondary school life skills to boost their aptitude for learning. Apart from this, Agnes has a cosmetics shop. She chose this line of business to meet the demands of young girls and women in the community. She is requesting a loan from Kiva to increase the variety of products in her shop. She plans to use the profits from her business to send her child to school and to help support her family.

loans.use: to increase the variety of products in her shop

loans.name: Stumai

texts.en: Stumai is 23 years old from the Morogoro District in Tanzania and lives with her mother and younger sisters. She volunteers as a Camfed Learner Guide at a local secondary school to help teach a life skills program to students to increase their aptitude for learning. In addition to this, Stumai has a grocery shop. Her business is unique in her community because there is little competition, which helps her earn a good profit. Stumai is requesting a loan from Kiva to purchase her products in bulk. The profits she will earn will be used to support her siblings by paying their school fees.

loans.use: to purchase her products in bulk

loans.name: Imaranjara Tusisimuke Group

texts.en: Muhamadi, a member of Imaranjara Tusisimuke group where each member guarantees each other, is a farmer growing food crops such as cabbages, maize, and sweet potatoes. He also owns rentals which have boosted his income. Muhamadi faces the challenges of bad weather and the general price fluctuations of food crops. However, he has hopes of building a permanent home as the best gift for his family. He has asked for a loan to buy fertilizers to improve his garden.
