loans.use: to buy fertilizers to improve his garden

loans.name: Misaki

texts.en: Misaki is a Ugandan man, married, age 43. He lives in Kagadi where he sells produce and has practiced farming since 2006 to earn a living. He hopes to grow his business despite the high price fluctuations affecting his business and expected output. Since he is hard working, Misaki is requesting a loan to buy maize for selling.

loans.use: to buy maize for selling.

loans.name: Annet

texts.en:
Annet is a twenty-six-year-old female married with three children living in Kasese, Uganda. Annet is a shoe seller, a business that has helped her look after the family and herself. Annet has great hopes of growing her business and becoming rich. Limited capital and competition are her challenges. 
Annet intends to use the loan to buy shoes for selling.

loans.use: to buy shoes for selling ahead of the Christmas season.

loans.name: Edivine

texts.en: Edivine is a 48-year-old married Ugandan woman living in Kagadi with 7 children who all attend school. She has been keeping poultry, pigs and cattle and operating a hatchery since 2006 for better economic status. She hopes to grow her business and make a bigger farm despite price fluctuations and electricity shortages. Edivine intends to use the loan to buy feed and vaccines for her animals.

loans.use: to buy feed and vaccines for her animals.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes is a 39-year-old married hard-working woman living in Kagadi, Uganda. She has been operating a retail shop since 2006 and she has been farming as her economic activities. She hopes to educate her children. In spite of price fluctuations that lead to income instabilities, Agnes is determined to educate her children at higher learning institutions. She is asking for a loan to pay school fees for her daughter.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her daughter.

loans.name: Erias

texts.en: Erias, who sells produce, is a hard-working married man living in Kagadi, Uganda. He desires to grow his business for increased earnings despite the challenges of bad weather limiting accessibility to the market center. Erias is asking for a loan to buy maize for selling.

loans.use: to buy maize for selling

loans.name: Jesús

texts.es:
Jesús de 63 años de edad, se dedica a la agricultura y a la ganadería por la situación económica no pudo estudiar, él creció con sus padres quienes le enseñaron estas actividades. Su familia esta formada  por su esposa quien le apoya con los oficios domésticos ya que sus hijos tienen su propio hogar. 

Jesús se levanta a las 4:00 a.m. para ir a trabajar durante la mañana en el terreno que alquila y durante el resto del día trabaja en otros terrenos y cuidando animales.

El préstamo que está solicitando, es para pagar mozos, carretero, desgranadora  para poder sacar su cosecha y poder venderla  para el sustento de su familia. 

Jesús planea en un futuro  con ayuda de otro crédito, poder comprar una yunta de bueyes y una carreta para poder en próximas cosechas ganar un ingreso adicional.
texts.en:
Jesús, 63, earns a living in agriculture and ranching.  He grew up with his parents, who taught him that work.  He wasn't able to attend school because of his financial situation.  His family is made up of his wife, who supports him by taking care of the household, because his children have their own homes.

Jesus gets up at 4 a.m. to go to work in the morning on the land he leases.  For the rest of the day he works on other people's land and takes care of animals.

The loan he's requesting is to pay for workers, a cart driver, and a threshing machine to harvest his crop and be able to sell it to support his family.

Jesús plans to get another loan in the future to help him buy a pair of oxen and a cart so he can earn additional income in future harvests.

loans.use: to pay for workers, a cart driver, and a threshing machine to harvest and sell his crop to support his family

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase additional goats to raise; some of which she will sell to get money that will help her provide her family with their needs.

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa is a 40-year-old married woman and a mother of six children from the town of Concepcion, Iloilo. 

For more than ten years, Marissa and her husband have been engaged in the fishing business. This is their main source of income. Marissa is standing next to crab nets, which will be used for crab fishing.

Marissa would like to access a loan to pay for the repair of their fishing boat and fishing materials such as fishing nets and lead weights. This loan will help Marissa and her husband in improving their catch thus giving them more fish and crabs to sell in the market.

Marissa's future plan includes expansion of their business and to send her children to school.

loans.use: to pay for the repair of the fishing boat and fishing materials such as fishing nets and lead weights

loans.name: Gustavo Adolfo

texts.es:
Gustavo es un hombre innovador de buenas ideas y con proyecciones de vida, se dedica a la producción de alimentos como son embutidos mas conocidos como salchichas, chorizos, etc. 
Presenta una gran dificultad para operar y es que no tiene la maquinaria para realizar el trabajo a su gusto y debe alquilar la maquinaria por lo que sus días y sus tiempos de producción son muy medidos, en base a esta dificultad quiere solicitar un crédito que invertirá en una maquina embutidora y materia prima para fabricar sus productos.
La principal ventaja es que tendrá disponible el equipo para trabajar y atender un pedido inesperado y se ahorra el dinero que pagaba por el alquiler de la máquina.
texts.en:
Gustavo is an innovator with good ideas and a life plan.  His work is making foods such as hot dogs and sausages that are stuffed in casings. 

His one problem is that he doesn't have the machinery to perform the work to his satisfaction so he has to rent the equipment. Because of this his days and his production times are curtailed. This is why he wants to request a loan which he will invest in a stuffing machine and the raw materials he needs to make his products. The big advantage of this is that he will have the equipment available at all times so that he can take care of unexpected orders and save the money he had been paying to rent the machine.

loans.use: to buy sausage stuffing machinery because he had been renting the equipment previously.

loans.name: Wilson Adolfo

texts.es:
Wilson un hombre criado en la zona rural de Antioquia que tomo la decisión un día de comenzar un negocio de cultivo y comercialización de flores, lo adopto por necesidad económica ante la falta de oportunidades para empelarse. 
Wilson se enfocó tanto en la parte de cultivo de las plantas que olvido las demás áreas un error común de una persona que está montando y consolidando su negocio. 
Su mayor dificultad la presenta en la sala de empaque y es pro está razón que solicita un crédito el cual invertirá en adecuaciones y reparación para esta importante sala por donde pasan todas las flores.
Con la ayuda del crédito podrá cubrir la mayor falencia en su empresa y seguir trabajando por un mejor futuro para el su esposa y su hijo
texts.en: Wilson grew up in the rural area of Antioquia. He made the decision one day to start a business growing and selling flowers. He did this facing a lack of employment opportunities. Wilson focused so much on the  part of growing plants so that he ignored the other parts of the process, a common error of somebody who is starting and consolidating his business. His main difficulty is with his packing room and it is for this reason that he is requesting a loan. He will invest it in  the adapting and repairing this important room where all the flower pass through. With the help of the loan he can correct this shortcoming in his business and continue working for a better future for his wife and son.

loans.use: to invest in the adaption of a packing room for flowers.

loans.name: Roger Jacinto

texts.es:
Roger un joven de 27 años de edad y padre de 3 hijos de 6, 2, años  y un bebe de 6 meses de edad, quiere solicitar un crédito para iniciar su negocio de venta de víveres en una casa que le regalo el gobierno por una situación que prefiere no mencionar para no inspirar lastima. 
Con el monto solicitado iniciara su negocio y comprara estanterías y víveres, con este negocio espera tener capital suficiente para darle una alimentación a sus 3 hijos que aun están muy pequeños y requieren cuidados especiales. 
Su sueño es sacar a su familia adelante, poder darle la oportunidad a sus hijos de estudiar y siempre ir pro más.
texts.en:
Roger, a young, 27 year old man, is the father of three children, who are 6, 2 and 6 months old. He wants to request a loan to start a business selling groceries in a house that the government gave him under circumstances that he prefers not to mention in order not to inspire pity.

With the sum solicited, he will start his business and purchase shelving and supplies. With this business he hopes to have sufficient capital to feed his three children, who are still very young and require special care.

His dream is to help his family get ahead, to give his children the opportunity for an education and to always go for more.

loans.use: to start his business, a general store, in a new life opportunity that the government has given him.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is 26 years old, married, and she has two children. Her husband is a teacher. 

Delia opened her Mini shop in 2000 with her own working capital of $700. She earns a good income from her business. She is a very hardworking woman, and doing business has become her regular activity for the past 14 years.

Delia is now applying for a loan of $800 USD to improve her business. Delia will use her loan to buy items such as shirts, trousers, shorts, and church clothes. 

Delia wants to make her business bigger and improve her living conditions in the future. She is happy with this loan because it will help her to improve her living conditions in the future.

loans.use: To buy shirts, trousers, shorts, and church clothes

loans.name: Mesalim

texts.en:
Mesalim is a married mother of two children, both of whom have completed school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are household consumables.

For over twenty years, Mesalim has operated an open-air food selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. 

With a loan of 15,000 KES Mesalim wants to purchase a stock of cooking oil, rice, and maize flour for her business. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of cooking oil, rice, and maize flour for her business.

loans.name: Amparo Del Socorro

texts.es:
Amparo es una campesina del sector del Carmen del vivoral dedicada a la cría de ganado y se especializa en la producción de leche, busca poder ser una productora de una marca reconocida y para lograrlo debe producir cierta cantidad de leche diaria por tal razón solicita un crédito que invertirá en la compra de dos vacas e insumos para sus cuidados como lo son cuidos y vacunas. 
Este crédito le permitirá tener los animales suficientes para cumplir la cuota y tener un cliente que le compre diariamente y aumentar su calidad de vida.
texts.en: Amparo is a peasant from the town of Carmen del Vivoral, who works in animal husbandry and specializes in milk production. She wants to be a producer of a known brand, and in order to do so she has to produce a certain amount of milk daily. For this she is requesting a loan to buy two cows and the inputs to take care of them, such as their vaccinations. This loan will allow her to have enough animals to fulfill her quota, and to have a customer who will buy from her daily, and in this way improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy two cows to improve her production.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is a 26-year-old, hardworking lady with two children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. She is a retailer, and at the same time, does farming in order to boost her income. She has hopes of expanding her business to new areas. 

Agnes needs a loan to buy general merchandise, such as mineral water and cooking oil, to sell.

loans.use: to buy general merchandise, such as mineral water and cooking oil, to sell.

loans.name: Sofia

texts.es:
Sofía es una trabajadora mujer de 61 años de edad, honesta y amable que vive sola y depende de su negocio de confecciones para el cual tomo clases, capacitándose y así cumplir con los requerimientos de sus clientes pues le trabaja a terceros. 
Sofía es una mujer humilde, que vive en estado de pobreza y necesita un impulso para comenzar una línea de ropa propia y buscar mejores ingresos para su hogar pues al estar sola no tiene alguien en quien apoyarse. 
Solicita un crédito para la compra de tela  e insumos de confección y aspira a que estos le puedan dar un aumento de clientes, competitividad en el difícil mercado de la confección y sostenibilidad ya que teme perder su estilo de vida pues la confección es el único trabajo que sabe realizar.
texts.en:
Sofía is a 61-year-old woman, who is hard-working, honest, and kind. 

She lives alone and supports herself through her clothing manufacturing business. She learned the trade by taking classes and undergoing training so that she could meet her customers' requirements. She provides services for third parties.

Sofía is a humble woman, who lives in poverty and needs help to start her own line of clothing and generate a better income for her home. Since she lives alone, she doesn't have anybody to support her. 

She is afraid of losing her lifestyle, and since making clothes is the only trade she knows, she is requesting a loan to buy fabric and sewing supplies. She hopes that this investment will help her to increase her customer base, become more competitive in the tough clothing manufacturing market, and  be able to continue to support herself.

loans.use: to buy fabric and sewing supplies.

loans.name: Anthonia

texts.en:
Anthonia is a 22-year old single mother who lives with her parents and three siblings in the Kilombero District of Tanzania. As a way of supporting the youth in her community, she volunteers as a Camfed Learner Guide in a local school, teaching students life skills to improve their aptitude for learning. 

Apart from this, Anthonia has a pig business and aspires to be economically independent. From the profits her business makes, Anthonia supports vulnerable children in her community with school supplies, as well as paying household expenses and school fees for her siblings. 

Anthonia is requesting a Kiva loan to purchase more pigs and to build a bigger hut for them.

loans.use: to purchase more pigs and to build a bigger hut for them.

loans.name: Shabnam

texts.en:
Shabnam is a clever woman. She was born in 1986. Shabnam is divorced and brings up a child who is 2 years old. Shabnam, after graduating school, did not have the opportunity to apply to the university. Now, she is the only feed keeper of her child, and she tries to find a suitable job to earn a living. She lives with her parents, and her parents help her to provide her child with all the necessary things. 

Shabnam two years ago applied to the National University of Tajikistan. She learns law. Shabnam hopes that she finds a highly paid job after graduating university. She is asking for a loan of 1,500 USD to pay for tuition. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to pay for tuition

loans.name: Angeles

texts.en:
Angeles is 54 years old and has five children. Angeles is married, and two children are in school.

She is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. Angeles requested a 6,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to buy additional fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Angeles has been farming rice for five years now, and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Angeles would like to save enough to buy more farmland.

loans.use: to buy additional fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Paskali

texts.en:
Paskali used the previous loan to  pay school fees for his children. He is a retailer, and at the same time, he sells produce in order to boost his income. He faces challenges of customers who delay to pay. However, he has hopes of expanding his business to new areas and educating his children to university.

Paskali needs a loan to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children

loans.name: Tatu

texts.en:
Tatu is 22 years old and lives with her siblings in the Kilosa District of Tanzania. She volunteers at a secondary school in her village as a way of giving back to her community. She teaches students life skills to improve their learning performance. 

Apart from this, she is also a young businesswoman who sells women’s clothing, specifically dresses. She uses the profits she earns to pay her siblings’ school fees and take care of her family, who depend on her. 

Tatu is requesting a Kiva loan to increase the stock items in her shop to better serve her customers. With the profits she makes, she hopes to hire someone to help her manage the shop in her absence.

loans.use: to increase the stock and variety within her shop to better serve her customers.

loans.name: Ceferina

texts.en:
Ceferina works hard to support her family. Ceferina is married and has a fish-vending business in the Philippines.

She requested a 9,500 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to buy additional fish to sell.

Ceferina has been in this business for 11 years now.

In the future, Ceferina would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional fish to sell

loans.name: Celedonia

texts.en:
Celedonia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buying and selling of frozen foods business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 6,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to purchase additional frozen foods to sell for her frozen foods business.

Celedonia has been in this business for two years. Celedonia earns additional income from raising pigs.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional frozen foods to sell

loans.name: Francisco Luis

texts.es:
Francisco es un hombre que siempre ha tenido fanatismo por los motores y todo lo relacionado con carros y desde el año 1992 constituyo su negocio de taller de mecánica guiado por esta pasión. 
Es padre de un hijo de 23 años y su mayor orgullo es verlo estudiando en la universidad tiene un empleado con el que labora todos los días y vive solo pues se separó de su esposa.
Buscando mejorar su negocio, aumentar sus ventas Francisco le gustaría pedir un préstamo que invertirá en la compra de repuestos ya que ha tenido que decir no a los clientes por no tenerlos a la mano y quiere solucionar este problema.
texts.en:
Francisco is a man who has always been a fanatic about motors and everything related to cars, and since 1992 he has built his mechanic shop business guided by this passion.
He is a father of a 23-year-old son and his greatest pride is to see him studying in the university.  He has one employee with whom he works every day and he lives alone since he separated from his wife.
Looking to improve his business and increase his sales, Francisco would like to request a loan which he will invest in the purchase of spare parts since he has had to say "No" to his customers because he didn't have them on hand and he wants to solve this problem.

loans.use: to buy spare parts.

loans.name: Reyna Lily

texts.es:
Reyna es una mujer muy emprendedora y con muchas ganas de salir adelante, se graduó como secretaria de un instituto y actualmente ejerce su carrera en una gran empresa. Tiene dos hijos maravillosos por quienes lo da todo, siempre actuando con honestidad y correctamente para poder ser un ejemplo para ellos porque quiere verlos convertidos en excelentes profesionales más adelante y que crezcan como personas de bien.
En sus tiempos libres le gusta ayudar a su mamá en el puesto de comida que tiene como una manera de retribuir todo el apoyo que ella le dio con sus hijos cuando estudiaba y trabajaba.
Reyna está muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado podrá cubrir algunos gastos de su hogar que hay en su casa como pago de algunos servicios y apoyar a su mamá en algunas cosa de su negocio. Más adelante Reyna espera poder crecer profesionalmente y poder ocupar un mejor puesto en su área.
texts.en:
Reyna is very enterprising and has a great desire to get ahead.  She graduated as a secretary and currently works for a large company.  She has two wonderful children for whom she gives her all, and for whom she always behaves honestly and correctly so she can serve as an example to them.  She wants to see them become excellent professionals in the future, so that they can become persons of means.

She likes to help her mother at her food stall in her spare time as payback for all the support she gave her with her children when she was studying and working.

Reyna is very grateful to the Kiva lenders because their support has allowed her to cover some of the household expenses, such payment for some utilities and supporting her mother with some business expenses.  In the future, Reyna hopes to be able to grow professionally and have a stall of her own in the area.

loans.use: to cover some household expenses.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to make home improvements.

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
Elma is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a hallow block making business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 7500 through NWTF to buy additional materials such as cement, sand and gravel and to pay for laborers' salaries for her hallow block making business.

Elma has been in this business for 1 year. Elma also earns income from farming rice.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of repairing and renovating her family home in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional materials such as cement, sand and gravel and to pay for laborers' salaries

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to stock her store.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en: Charles used the previous loan to buy more firewood and timber to sell. He sells firewood and at same time sells charcoal stoves. He faces the challenges of low capital. Despite that, he hopes to buy a cutting machine, have a good retirement and educate his children to higher levels of learning. Charles needs a loan to buy firewood for selling.

loans.use: to buy firewood for selling

loans.name: Carmen Helena

texts.es:
Carmen es una mujer soltera de 47 años de edad in hijos que depende únicamente de sus ventas de mercancía, básicamente ropa para poder suplir sus necesidades básicas como alimento, vestimenta, transporte y servicios públicos. 
Es una mujer muy apegada a la familia y colabora en lo que más puede para ayudar a los suyos. 
Quiere solicitar un crédito para la compra de ropa de niño, niña, hombre y dama para comercializar entre sus compradores, se ve en la necesidad de solicitar el crédito pues atraviesa por un difícil momento donde una ayuda monetaria seria gran impulso para su negocio ya que no tiene alguien en quien refugiarse.
texts.en:
Carmen is a single woman of 47 without children. She depends solely on her sales of merchandise, basically clothing, in order to be able to supply her basic needs such as food, clothing, transportation, and public services.

She is a woman who is very devoted to her family and assists as much as she can in order to help them.

She wants to apply for a loan for the purchase of clothing for boys, girls, men, and women to sell to her customers. She needs to apply for the loan since she is going through a difficult time when some financial help would be a great boost for her business, since she doesn't have anyone to whom she can turn.

loans.use: to buy men's, women's, boy's, and girl's clothes to sell

loans.name: Víctor Manuel

texts.es:
Víctor de 65 años de edad, es tractorista y estudio hasta el 6° grado, por sus escasos recursos económicos no pudo continuar sus estudios y se dedico mejor a trababajar para ayudar a su familia en los gastos de la casa.

Esta casado y es padre de 2 hijos de 38 y 39 años edad, uno ya tiene su propio hogar. Víctor vive con su esposa y uno de sus hijos.  Su esposa se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar mientras que Víctor se dedica a la agricultura junto con su hijo, desde hace 15 años, trabajo que lo aprendió de su padre quien siempre se dedico a esto y también por la necesidad en que tenia para darle todo lo necesario a sus hijos, para llegar a su trabajo Víctor y su hijo caminan 2 kilómetros trabajando en el horario de 5:00 am a 11:00 am.

El préstamo solicitado en CREDICAMPO, es para comprar veneno y semilla para la siembra de 7500 metros cuadrados de maíz con regadillo, con esto lograra en un tiempo tener un mejor ingreso y podrá darle a su familia una mejor alimentación y una mejor calidad de vida. Víctor sueña con que sus hijos tengan una vida fructífera bajo la cobertura de Dios, mejorar su vivienda y que su cultivo sea un éxito.
texts.en:
Victor is 65 years old.  He is a farmer and has a sixth grade education due to a lack of financial resources.  He was not able to continue his education, so he decided to work so he could help his family with the household expenses. 

He is married and is the father of two children, ages 38 and 39.  One lives on his own.  Victor lives with his wife and one of his sons.  His wife cares for the home and Victor farms with his son.  He has been doing this for 15 years, having learned this from his father who did this out of necessity so he could support his family.  Victor and his son walk 2 kilometers to get to work and work from 5:00 am to 11:00 am.

He is asking for this loan through CREDICAMPO to buy insecticide and seeds to plant 7,500 square meters of corn with irrigation.  He expects to obtain a better income with this and be able to provide his family with more food and a better quality of life.  Victor dreams for his children to have a fruitful life under God’s cover.  He also hopes to make improvements to his home and for his crops to be successful.

loans.use: to buy seeds.

loans.name: Afida

texts.en: Afida is 29 years old and lives in the Kilolo District of Tanzania. She is married and has three children. As a way of giving back to her community, Afida volunteers at a nearby secondary school teaching students life skills to become better students. Apart from this, she sells food in her own restaurant. Afida uses the little profit she makes to pay household expenses and her children’s school fees. She is requesting a Kiva loan to purchase restaurant utensils and to employ one person. She wishes to build a family home and to continue to provide for her children with the profits her business will make after receiving the loan.

loans.use: to purchase restaurant utensils and to employ one person

loans.name: Maria Tomasa

texts.es: Maria Tomasa se ha dedicado la la venta de consumo diario y a la crianza de marranos por más de ocho años, por medio de este negocio ha logrado ayudar a sus hijos a darles estudio ya que se separo de su esposo cuando sus hijos eran pequeñitos. Y por medio de su negocio tiene la oportunidad de obtener ingresos para salir adelante, ella ha sido bien responsable en sus pagos y solicita el crédito para comprar lechones(marranos) para engordar  y luego venderlos. Agradece a Fape y Kiva x el apoyo que le están brindando y se compromete a seguir pagando puntualmente.
texts.en: Maria Tomasa has sold products for everyday consumption and raised pigs for more than eight years. Through this business she has managed to help her children and to give them schooling, since she separated from her husband when her children were little. And through this business she has the opportunity to obtain income to get ahead. She has been very responsible in her payments, and she is applying for a loan to purchase piglets to fatten and then sell. She is grateful to FAPE and Kiva for the support that they are offering her and promises to continue paying punctually.

loans.use: to buy pigs to fatten.

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia is 56 years old and is a widow with eight children.

Letecia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional stock of groceries to sell.

Letecia has borrowed and repaid 6 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for four years and also earns an income from tailoring.

Letecia aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Jeison Andres

texts.es: Jeison es un hombre de 28 años de edad dedicado a la cría y levante de cerdos una actividad heredada de familia y que está en su tiempo alto de demanda, por tal razón quiere solicitar un crédito para la compra de 2 cerdos de cría y lechones buscando tener un negocio que pueda cubrir la demanda de la temporada de diciembre que se avecina.
texts.en: Jeison is a man of 28 who breeds and raises pigs, a business that he inherited from his family and that is in its season of high demand. For this reason, he wants to request a loan for the purchase of two breeding sows and piglets, seeking to have a business that can cover the demand of the December season that is drawing nearer.

loans.use: to buy two breeding sows and piglets.

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is a 33-year-old hardworking man living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He distills waragi for sale and at the same time is engaged in farming. (Waragi is a generic term in Uganda for domestic distilled beverages.) He faces challenges of price fluctuation of bananas which he uses to distill alcohol. However, he hopes to expand his business into new areas. John needs a loan to hire a kisubi plantation for distilling a local brew, waragi, to sell.

loans.use: to hire a banana plantation for distilling local brew(Waragi) to sell.

loans.name: Jona

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Jona works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell of fruits business in the Philippines and earns additional income from farming vegetable. Jona is borrowing PHP 9,000 through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fruit to sell. 

Jona has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fruit to sell

loans.name: Magelyn

texts.en:
Magelyn is 45 years old and married with eight children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Magelyn is borrowing PHP 6,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Magelyn has been raising pigs for seven years and earns additional income from her general store and buying and selling vegetables.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is 50 years old and married with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Lolita has a general store business in the Philippines. Lolita requested a 13,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF in order to purchase more items like canned goods, noodles, sugar and other groceries.

Lolita has been in this business for two years. In the future, Lolita would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items like canned goods, noodles, sugar and other groceries.

loans.name: Oliver

texts.en: Oliver is a 33-year-old married lady living in Fort Portal, Uganda. She is a farmer and at the same time runs a saloon. She faces the challenges of weather changes, like heavy rains that badly hinder her coffee from drying on time and causes the coffee to spoil. However, she hopes to expand her business to new areas in order to boost her income. Oliver needs a loan to buy coffee to sell.

loans.use: to buy coffee to sell.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en: Paul is a hardworking man living in Fort Portal Uganda. He has a secretarial business and at the same time is a farmer. He faces challenges of limited capital and stiff competition. However, he hopes to diversify his businesses to include a supermarket, a bakery, and others. Paul needs a loan to buy a photocopying machine for his business.

loans.use: to buy a photocopying machine for his business.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en: Betty used the previous loan to buy utensils to use for outside catering. She is still in the restaurant business, and faces the challenges of limited space from where she operates her business. However, she hopes to have a good retirement. Betty needs a loan to buy restaurant utensils and a refrigerator to increase customer satisfaction and meet their demand for cold drinks.

loans.use: to buy restaurant utensils and a refrigerator.

loans.name: Shirley

texts.en:
Shirley is 52 years old and married with seven children, one of whom is in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Shirley runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

She has been in this business for six years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap, noodles and other groceries. 

In the future, Shirley would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Ninfa

texts.en:
Ninfa is 47 years old and married with one child. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 5,500 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like soap, milk, sugar, eggs, shampoo, etc.

Ninfa has borrowed and repaid one loan from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from farming rice.

She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like soap, milk, sugar, eggs, shampoo, etc.

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.en:
As a parent of seven children, Ofelia works hard to support her family.

She has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines and earns additional income from farming vegetables. Ofelia is borrowing PHP 7,000 through NWTF to buy fruits and vegetables to sell in her food stall. 

Ofelia has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough to buy more farmland.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables to sell in her food stall

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is a divorced mother of six children, one of whom attends school and the other five are are adults. They live in their own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

For three years, she has operated a food stall business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of price fluctuation in her business. Emma dreams of establishing a hotel in the future. 

With the KES 15,000, she wants to purchase three bundles of wheat flour, cooking fat and sugar. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase three bundles of wheat flour, cooking fat and sugar.

loans.name: Abdullah

texts.en:
Abdullah is a 29-year-old married man with four children living with them in his own house in Haja city, Yemen. He studied until Elementary education but he couldn't complete his studies. He is the sole breadwinner of the family but his income is not fixed. The house where Abdullah and his family lives is very old and needs renovation. It threatens to fall down at any moment. Abdullah doesn't have enough money to make the necessary renovation for the house. As a result, he applied for a loan of 98,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase construction materials such as cement, bricks and iron steel to renovate the house.

Abdullah hopes to make his house safer and in a better condition.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials such as cement, bricks and iron steel to renovate the house.

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.en:
As a married mother of five children, Ofelia works hard to support her family.

She has a clothing sales business in the Philippines and earns additional income from food vending. Ofelia is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF in order to buy more stock of clothes to offer for sale.

Ofelia  has been sustaining her business activities through her past 21 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy additional clothing inventory to offer for sale.

loans.name: Deo

texts.en: Deo used the previous loan to buy rice, sugar, sodas, water and maize flour to sell. He is still in retail. He faces the challenges of customers who need to be served at cheaper prices and customers who default. However, he hopes to build a very good house. Deo has asked for another loan in order to buy sodas, sugar, rice, cassava flour and millet flour to sell.

loans.use: to buy sodas, sugar, rice, cassava flour and millet flour to sell.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en: Joyce is a 27-year-old married lady with two children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. She is a tailor and designer. She has been running this business 12 hours a week for the last six years. She hopes to expand her business to new areas in order to boost her income. Joyce needs a loan to buy materials  for sewing and making good designs for her customers who are demanding them.

loans.use: to buy materials for sewing and making good designs for her customers who are demanding them.

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
Mahmoud is a 46-year-old Palestinian man and a married father of three children who lives in a Palestinian refugee camp. He started eight years ago working as a goods distributor to cover the needs and expenses of his family.

Today, Mahmoud is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to increase his business merchandise with more requested products to satisfy his customers needs and attract new ones.

This loan will help Mahmoud increase his income and improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy requested products

loans.name: Nonita

texts.en:
A 54-year-old married woman from Iloilo, Philippines,  Nonita makes a living through her fishing business. This mother of six works hard to support her husband in their fishing venture. For 30 years, fishing has been their main source of income.

Nonita would like to improve their fishing business but lacks the financial resources to do so. For this reason, she is requesting a loan to buy a new fishing boat, nets, lead weights and other items. This loan will help them improve their fishing business.

In the future, Nonita hopes to make their business more profitable and stable.

loans.use: to buy a new fishing boat, nets, lead weights and other items

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
As a married parent of nine children, Elizabeth works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming rice. Elizabeth is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to sell for her fish vending business.

Elizabeth has been sustaining her business activities through her past 4 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell.

loans.name: Vergelia

texts.en:
Vergelia is 69 years old and married with eight children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.  

Vergelia has a charcoal retailing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more stocks of charcoal to sell.

Vergelia has been in this business for eight years. In the future, Vergelia would like to save enough money to expand her business and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is 31 years old. He is single and has no children. He is a livestock farmer and has been in the business for the last 5 years, earning a monthly income of 3,000 KES.

Francis has requested his first loan with VisionFund Kenya for 20,000 KES, which he will use to buy sheep and goats for rearing and reselling. With the anticipated profits, Francis will be able to purchase more livestock for reselling.

His hopes and dreams for the future are to improve his and his family's economic status.

loans.use: to buy sheep and goats for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a quality breed of dairy cow

loans.name: George

texts.en: George used the previous loan to buy maize to sell. He is a married man with three children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He sells matooke and maize and at the same time sells timber in order boost his income. He faces challenges of unpredicted weather changes. Despite that, he hopes to educate all his children to higher levels of learning. George needs a loan to buy bananas and maize to sell.

loans.use: to buy bananas and maize to sell.

loans.name: Zahira

texts.en:
Zahira is a 51-year-old married mother of seven children who has worked in handicrafts for the last eight years to help her husband in covering the increasing needs and expenses of their children.

Today, Zahira is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to help her son buy a concrete mixer, which will increase his income and improve his living conditions. Zahira's children are her priority. She always trys hard to provide them with a better future and improve their lives.

loans.use: to buy a concrete mixer for her son

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy books, pens, dictionaries, reams of paper etc. for reselling.

loans.name: Subhon

texts.en: Subhon is 20 years old. He lives in the north part of Tajikistan with his parents and sister. They live in the country together in a house that was built by his father. Subhon is not married. He studies in his second course at Tajikistan State University Politic and Business. He studies the economic system. His parents are farmers. They grow vegetables and crops. Subhon is asking for a loan of 650 USD to pay for tuition. His parents do not have the opportunity to pay for university tuition and Kiva lenders are the only ones who can support him.

loans.use: To pay for tuition

loans.name: Farzona

texts.en: Farzona was born in 1995. She is not married and lives with her parents in the capital of Tajikistan. Farzona’s father is a teacher and her mother is a housewife. Farzona is a second year student at Tajikistan National University. She studies law and is a successful student. Farzona actively takes part in university activities and she plans to be a lawyer in the future. Farzona is asking for a loan to pay for her university tuition. She awaits your help and is thankful.

loans.use: To pay for tuition

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph used his previous loan to buy more maize to sell. He has been operating a bar and produce business since 2000 to date and is challenged by price fluctuations and bad roads that affect his service delivery. He desires to grow his business and for this reason he is asking for credit to buy alcohol for his business.

loans.use: to buy alcohol for his business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more supplies of timber.

loans.name: Dali

texts.en:
Dali, who is 32 years old and married, lives in Gori city. She has an eight-member family and their whole monthly income is only 400 GEL.  Dali works hard as a nurse at the local hospital and generates 300 GEL. Her mother is a sales lady at a used-clothing shop and gets 100 GEL monthly. According to the above-mentioned situation, the family finds it hard to cover even basic needs and have financial stability.
 
Dali requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for her trading business startup but without any success. Her loan request was rejected each time, because the creditors did not find the existing family income to be sufficient to approve the loan. According to Credo's estimations, the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. Dali requested a loan from Credo to start a trading business. Her loan request was approved in the framework of a new joint initiative by Kiva and Credo. The startup loan program envisages provisions for business startups and re-startup credits with soft conditions for the country's poor, who, regarded as "high risk borrowers" because of their low income, do not have access to credit products. With the received credit, Dali will purchase a stock of clothing and home products at the worldwide market, located in the capital and will sell at increased prices among her employees. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva startup loan, will significantly increase the family's income. Their income will double, and the family members will be able to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: To start a trading business with clothing and home products and generate additional income

loans.name: Kate

texts.en: Kate is a 40-year-old married lady living in Fort Portal, Uganda. She is a tailor and at the same time earns salary. She hopes of expanding her business to new areas in order to boost her profits. Kate needs a loan to buy uniform material for sewing to supply them to schools.

loans.use: to buy uniform material for sewing and supplying them to schools.

loans.name: Amalia

texts.es: Amalia es una mujer separada que esta a cargo de 3 hijos Ella vive en La Paz, ha vuelto a la casa de sus padres pero ella y su familia viven con relativa comodidad Amalia es una profesora de primaria, eso significa que su sueldo es escaso, Amalia quiere un credito para pagar la matricula universitaria y material de estudios para su hija menor que esta estudiando odontología (una carrera costosa debido a los materiales que hay que ir comprando para cada semestre, aunque no tanto como la carrera de arquitectura)Amalia es la unica fuente de ingresos en su hogar y sobre su ex marido, se cita las palabras de la clienta: "Mejor ni hablar" Por lo que Amalia espera que la puedan ayudar, ella goza de buena salud y quiere mucho a sus hijos
texts.en:
Amalia is a woman that is separated, and is responsible for 3 children. She lives in La Paz, and has returned to her parents home, but she and her family live in relative comfort. Amalia is a primary school teacher, which means her salary is low. Amalia is requesting a loan to pay for the university registration and study material for her youngest daughter, who is studying dentistry. This is an expensive degree due to the materials that one must buy each semester, but it is not as much as an architecture degree.

Amalia is the only source of income in her home, and regarding her ex husband, in her words, "It's better not to talk about it." For this reason, Amalia hopes that you can help her. She enjoys good health, and loves her children very much.

loans.use: to pay for the university registration and study material for her youngest daughter, who is studying dentistry.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase goats to raise in order to increase his business.

loans.name: Uljon

texts.en: Uljon is a young and hardworking woman. She was born in 1992. Uljon is divorced and lives with her parents, sister, and two brothers. She has learned sewing of national women's clothes. Now, she is going to start her own business with sewing. She will service as a sewer to local people. Uljon took part in a course ‘To Get Ahead’ from a women's organization and got a certificate. She will provide sewing services to her clients in her house. She is asking for a loan of 4,000 Somoni to buy an embroidery machine for organizing the new business. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To buy an embroidery machine for organizing a new business

loans.name: Janepher

texts.en:
Janepher, 35-years-old, is a single mother of four living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. She deals in secondhand clothes where she gets money to look after her children. All of her children are in school, and she is working very hard to see that they get their basic needs met. She started the business eight years ago and hopes to build a permanent house and pay fees for her children.

She wants the loan to buy more secondhand clothes to sell.

loans.use: To buy secondhand clothes to sell.

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en: Jackson is a 35-year-old married man with four children living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. He has a retail shop that sells general merchandise. He also has a cocoa garden to complement the income he gets from the shop. He is a very hardworking man who has managed to maintain his business. He faces the challenge of limited capital. He hopes to educate his children. He wants a loan to buy sugar, rice, soft drinks and other general merchandise for sale.

loans.use: to buy sugar, rice, soft drinks and other general merchandise for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: increase her working capital and buy a large quantity of flour for resale, to earn more.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius is a hardworking married man living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He deals in selling produce and at the same time rides a motorcycle, which also yields him additional income. He faces the challenge of weather changes which hinders transport, as roads become impassable. Besides that he hopes to have a big produce store to supply to many customers. 

Julius has asked for a loan to buy posho (food made of maize flour) to sell.

loans.use: to buy posho to sell.

loans.name: Odile

texts.fr: ODILE est âgée de 68 ans, veuve et mère de trois enfants à sa seule charge ;elle est commerçante de pagnes et s’approvisionne trois fois par mois au grand marché de Lomé, mais vit à Adidogomé, puis à un niveau primaire et se soigne par automédication. ODILE désire un microcrédit pour appuyer son commerce, acheter de nouvelles variétés de pagnes pour satisfaire sa clientèle et assurer le bien-être de sa famille.
texts.en:
Odile is a 68-year-old widow and the mother of three children under her care. She is a merchant of pagnes (colorful West-African fabric) and resupplies three times a month at the main market in Lomé.

She lives in Adidogomé, has primary-level education and uses self-medication to heal herself.

Odile would like to obtain micro-credit to support her business, so she can buy new varieties of pagnes to satisfy her customers and ensure her family's well-being.

loans.use: buy three lengths of pagne (colorful West-African fabric)

loans.name: Pedro Alberto

texts.es: Pedro de 57 años de edad desde hace 20 años se dedica a la crianza de ganado de engorde en la zona donde reside, tiene muy buena clientela ya que ha sabido ganarse la confianza de sus clientes, vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus cuatro hijos, el ha decidido invertir en el cuidado de sus ganados, por eso ha solicitado un crédito para poder comprar vitaminas y la compra de mas ganado de engorde que le permita crecer en el negocio y asi tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Pedro, 57, has been raising cattle in the area where he lives for 20 years.  He has many customers because he has known how to gain their confidence.  He lives in his own house with his wife and four children.  Pedro has decided to invest in his livestock and therefore is requesting a loan to buy vitamins and more cattle to expand the business and improve income.

loans.use: To buy vitamins and more cattle.

loans.name: Pyalo

texts.fr: Agée de 42 ans, PYALO est mariée et mère de trois enfants. Elle vend des ignames et s’approvisionne  deux fois par mois au marché de Notsé, mais loge à Adidogomé, ayant un niveau primaire, se soigne par automédication et le foyer ne dispose pas de moyen de déplacement. PYALO sollicite un prêt pour étendre son commerce et gagner plus de bénéfices afin de réaliser ses rêves et surtout plus s’occuper de ses enfants.
texts.en:
42-year-old Pyalo is married with three children. She sells yams and resupplies twice a month at the market in Notsé, but lives in Adidogomé.

She has primary-level education, treats herself through self-medication, and the home has no means of transportation.

Pyalo is seeking a loan to expand her business and earn more profits, so she can achieve her dreams and above all take care of her children.

loans.use: buy 15 gourds of yams

loans.name: Fahed

texts.en:
Fahed is a 40-year-old married father of three children. He has worked as a truck driver for 17 years and is trying hard to cover his family's needs and expenses.

Due to the increasing living costs, Fahed's income is not enough anymore. Thus, he is acquiring an educational loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to pay his children's school tuition fees for this is his priority.

Fahed hopes to open his own car rental shop to increase his income and improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to pay his children's school tuition fees

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy groceries to sell.

loans.name: Asha A.

texts.en: Asha is 20 years old and lives with her parents and family in the Kilosa District of Tanzania. Asha is a tailor. She currently runs her business from her family’s front porch because she cannot afford to rent office space. Asha supports her family through her business. Apart from being a tailor, she volunteers at a local secondary school as a Camfed Learner Guide teaching students life skills to increase their aptitude for learning. Asha is requesting a loan from Kiva to rent space and purchase more sewing materials for her business. As a result of receiving the loan, she hopes to improve her family’s standard of living.

loans.use: to rent space and purchase more sewing materials for her business

loans.name: Amivi Essé

texts.fr: Commerçante de divers produits alimentaires, AMIVI est mariée et mère de trois enfants, et est âgée de 27 ans. Elle vit à Adidogomé et s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au Ghana et des fois au marché d’Adidogomé ; elle a un niveau d’étude primaire, se soigne par automédication. AMIVI souhaiterait un microcrédit pour augmenter son approvisionnement afin de mieux gagner et aussi aider son mari dans les dépenses de leur foyer.
texts.en:
A merchant of various food products, Amivi is a 27-year-old married mother of three children. She lives in Adidogomé and resupplies twice a month in Ghana and sometimes at the Adidogomé market.

She has primary-level education, and treats herself through self-medication.

Amivi would like micro-credit financing to increase her stock supplies, so she can earn more and also assist her husband with household expenditures.

loans.use: buy three bags of wheat flour, three bags of sugar and 38 bowls of tapioca.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en: Hello, Kiva lenders! Meet Gladys, a 38-year-old youthful, very hardworking, honest, and ever smiling mother of four children. She lives with her husband in a remote village in Kapsowar, in the Rift valley region of Kenya. Gladys passionately loves farming. She has been farming for the past five years and has always managed to provide for her family. Feeding the large family she has requires a lot of hard work and determination. Her other sources of income are crops and some personal business that she does in order to provide food for her large family. In farming, she enjoys the returns she gets but is challenged to maintain a good standard of living. Gladys has identified free space on her farm and wants to fully utilize this space by keeping a good quality dairy cow. Dairy farming in Kenya is a very profitable venture and the price of milk in the recent past has been going up, so Gladys, being a visionary and entrepreneurial woman, wants to take full advantage of this. She has chosen the breed of cow that she will keep, and she learned that she will not only get milk from the cow but also manure and this will boost the fertility of her farm. Selling the milk will never be a problem because there is a ready market and she will also sell to big dairy processing firms. Gladys said she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan because they offer agriculture-based loans and their interest rate is low and on a reducing basis. She underwent training through Juhudi Kilimo and from the training, she learned that saving is a continuous process in many micro-finance institutions. Gladys hopes that through the accumulated profit she will be able to start adding value to her milk by starting services such as packaging and the production of other dairy products. This loan will change her life and will secure the future of her school-going children. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Carlos Alfonso

texts.es: Carlos de 30 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañera de vida, el trabaja como empleado en una empresa privada, con lo que gana en su trabajo logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el quiere mejorar su vivienda construyendo un cuarto en el lugar que muestra la fotografía pero no tiene de suficiente capital por esa razón solicita un crédito para la compra de ladrillos, arena, cemento, hierro, laminas y pago de mano de obra y asi poder vivir mas seguros y cómodos.
texts.en: Carlos, 30, lives in his own house with his life partner.  He works for a private company and uses his income to cover some of the household expenses.  Carlos wants to renovate his house and build a room in the place shown in the photo.  But since he does not have sufficient capital he is requesting a loan to buy bricks, sand, cement, iron, metal sheeting and pay labor costs so he can live in a safer, more comfortable environment.

loans.use: To buy bricks, sand, cement, iron, and metal sheeting, and pay labor costs.

loans.name: Boymurod

texts.en: Boymurod was born in 1972. He is a very hardworking and industrious man. He is the widowed father of two children. He lives together with his children. His son is a student and his daughter is a schoolgirl. Boymurod experienced a lot of difficulties after the death of his wife. He is raising his children alone and it is very difficult for him. He tries for the well-being of his children. Boymurod is a farmer. He has been growing crops for eight years. He is asking for a loan to pay for his son’s education at the university. Boymurod awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To pay for the tuition of his son

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard is a 34-year-old married man and a father of three children from Concepcion, Iloilo. He is a fisherman and has been in the fishing business for more than 13 years now. This is the source of his income. 

Richard is now asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, hooks and other items. This loan will help him improve his catch, giving him more fish to sell in the market. 

In the future, Richard hopes to expand his fishing venture so that it will generate more income to sustain their needs, especially for the schooling of his children.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, hooks and other items

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Mariées majoritairement dans des ménages polygamiques, les six membres du groupe Benkadi ont en moyenne 46 ans et 6 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Kalaban-coro l’un des quartiers de Bamako et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu à Kalaban-coro. Les membres du groupe font tous le petit commerce des poissons. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 4ème cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Bassitan (femme arrêtée à l’extrême gauche sur la photo) est une vendeuse des poissons. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 5 corbeilles de poisson frais en gros au quartier du fleuve à Bamako. La revente se fait en détails à Kalaban-coro et en ambulant à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. Madame Bassitan compte avoir avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 200 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et satisfaire les petits besoins du foyer.
texts.en:
Married for the most part in polygamous households, the six members of the Benkadi group are on average 46 years old with six children. They all live in Kalaban Coro - one of Bamako's neighborhoods - and became acquainted through neighborhood ties and their income-generating activities in Kalaban-Coro.

All the group members are fishmongers. In order to increase their stock-in-trade, the group decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso and are on their fourth group loan cycle.

Mrs. Bassitan (the woman standing on the far left in the photo) is a fishmonger. She intends to use her loan to buy 5 baskets of fresh fish wholesale in Bamako's river district. Retail sales are conducted in Kalaban-Coro as an itinerant vendor, to a clientele composed mainly of women.

Mrs. Bassitan expects to achieve with this loan average monthly profits of 200,000 CFA francs, to be reinvested in the business and used to meet small household needs.

loans.use: buy fresh fish

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en: Harriet, a 47-year-old woman, is married with six children and living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. She has a retail shop in Bundibugyo and she is a very hard working woman. She has stayed in this business for a long time and has managed it well. She is however limited by capital and seasonal factors. She hopes to have all her children educated. She wants a loan to buy merchandise such as bread, sugar and cooking oil among other items to sell.

loans.use: To buy merchandise such as bread, sugar and cooking oil among other things to sell.

loans.name: Safina

texts.en:
Safina is a 54-year-old woman living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. Her major business is cocoa buying and selling in addition to her cocoa garden. She is a very hardworking woman who stays with her six grandchildren and looks after them very well. She hopes to build a permanent house and have her grandchildren study.

She wants a loan to buy more cocoa to sell.

loans.use: to buy more cocoa to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase menswear to start trading

loans.name: Wajiha

texts.en:
Wajiha is a 40-year-old married mother of two children who has 27 years of experience in tailoring. She started working two years ago in a tailoring shop to cover the needs and expenses of her beloved family.

Today, Wajiha is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to buy a tailoring machine, which will help her in providing her customers with quicker and better service as she will be able to attract new ones. This loan will help Wajiha increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a tailoring machine

loans.name: Gulchehra

texts.en: Gulchehra is widowed. She is very kind woman. Gulchehra began her own business deal a month ago. She started her business by buying and selling women's clothes. Gulchehra sells clothes in a local market where she has a store. She studied the course ‘To Get Ahead’ from a women's organization and got a certificate. With the profit from her business, Gulchehra is going to apply to the university and get a higher education. She is asking for a loan of 15,000 Somoni to buy women's clothes to increase her working capital for her new business. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To buy women's clothes to increase her working capital for her new business

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora is a 47-year-old married woman and a mother of five children from Concepcion, Iloilo. She makes a living through fishing. She helps her husband in their fishing venture. This has been their source of income for the past 27 years now. 

Leonora is asking for a loan to buy a new fishing boat. This will help her and her husband improve their daily catch. They sell their catch to the nearest market in their place.

In the future, Leonora hopes to expand their business so that it will generate more revenue for their sustenance.

loans.use: to buy a new fishing boat

loans.name: Farah

texts.en:
Farah is a 40-year-old married mother of three children. She started tailoring from her house three years ago to help her husband cover the expenses of their family.

Today, Farah is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner, Al Majmoua, to expand her business by buying necessary tailoring supplies, which will help her to satisfy her customers' needs with better service. She wants to pay her children's school tuition fees.

Farah hopes to expand her business more in the future and open her own tailoring shop to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy necessary tailoring supplies

loans.name: Yurik

texts.en:
Yurik is 64 years old and he lives with his wife in Kapan city in the Syunik region. Yurik has no higher education and for many years, he worked at his city’s factory as a worker. For several years, he worked at the petrol station and now he works as a driver at the seismic station. Yurik, in his village where he was born, has a plot of land where many years ago he planted a nice orchard. He gathers a tasty and nice harvest of apples, peaches, cherries and nuts from his orchard, the greatest part of which he sells to resellers. Yurik is married and he has two daughters and a son; all of them are married and they live separately from their parents. Yurik’s wife works as a nurse at the local polyclinics. As Yurik describes, he works without holidays and all during the day he drives his car. Before, he says, he never felt any hardness and fatigue while driving. He mentions that his eyes are strained during driving, which causes him great difficulties while driving and his family members are greatly worried, since the danger of having a car accident is really great in such a situation.
  
Yurik is asking for a loan of 300.000 Armenian drams in order to have urgent surgery on his eyes that the doctor recommended to him, since it is the only way of solving his eye problem.

loans.use: to have urgent surgery on his eyes that the doctor recommended to him

loans.name: Anahit

texts.en:
Anahit is 40 years old and she lives with her husband and three children in Stepanavan city in the Lori region. Anahit graduated from Vanadzor State Pedagogical Institute and for 20 years, she has worked at the school as a teacher of Armenian Language and Literature. She mentions the 20 years of her pedagogical experience with great pride and says that she does not imagine what other profession she would choose if not a pedagogue again. 
Anahit’s husband is also a pedagogue and a director of the city sport school. Their elder daughter is a student; their smallest daughter and son are still school-aged. 

Anahit hopes to receive this Kiva loan in order to buy a computer and pedagogical literature for her professional work. In this way, she can make her lessons and courses more interesting for her pupils.

loans.use: to buy a computer and pedagogical literature for her professional work

loans.name: Anush

texts.en:
Anush is 29 years old and lives in Kapan in the Syunik region with her mother (who is unemployed) and brother (who works as a taxi driver). Anush has a higher education and is a specialist of nonferrous and ferrous metals metallurgy. She is not married and is greatly busy in her work. She worked at a private company as an accountant; now she works at a huge private company as a sales manager and is also a senior specialist of the client services department. Thanks to her hardworking character, Anush is greatly respected and appreciated by her colleagues. 

Anush now has her own car that she managed to buy thanks to her savings of several years. She says she drives with great care and attention and she likes her car very much. She asks for this loan in order to install a gas cylinder in her car. She says her car uses a lot of petrol, which is very expensive and is a great waste of money for her.

loans.use: in order to install a gas cylinder in her car

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is a rural farmer in Kapsowar, Kenya, an area known for having bad land terrain and lack of proper infrastructure. She is blessed with four children, and has been practicing mixed farming for the past 15 years. On her farm, she grows maize, and raises a dairy cow and poultry. She sells milk, eggs and maize. To meet her expenses and provide the best for her family, she often engages in small personal businesses to make extra money. But farming gives her a great sense of satisfaction despite meager earnings, "I enjoy it most when I see customers come back for my products because it shows me that I am meeting their needs!" Her biggest challenge is drought. The long dry season can lead to crop failures and poor yields. To a farmer means business losses and lack of food for the family. Because of this challenge, Elizabeth formed a group and joined Juhudi Kilimo, a micro finance organization that supports small rural farmers. She acquired a dairy cow that she later named Mrembo (Swahili for beautiful).  The cpw produces milk daily, which Elizabeth sells to a co-operative. "The money from milk comes regularly and is not very affected by sudden changes in weather if you have stored feed," said Elizabeth. The money Elizabeth got from selling the milk was adequate to repay the loan. Today, Elizabeth is seeking a new loan to buy another dairy cow and is planning to become a full-fledged dairy farmer. Her future plan is to construct a zero-grazing unit. That way, she can use the grazing field to plant fodder and prepare silage. With this loan, Elizabeth is going to grow into a very successful dairy farmer. All she wants is for her family to enjoy the abundance of life, good health and livelihood. Elizabeth patiently waits for your kindness.

loans.use: To buy a quality breed of dairy cow

loans.name: Yanina

texts.es: Yanina vive en casa de su padres en un acabado de ladrillo y piso de cemento en La Paz. El oficio que desempeña es la  edicion de afiches, invitaciones y otros. Yanina necesita el crédito para la compra de papel, placas y otros materiales para elaborar invitaciones de tipo calendario (es decir, con fecha y de tamaño superior a la media)Yanina es soltera pero tiene dos hijos, aún más importante, la clienta goza de buena salud y es responsable
texts.en: Yanina lives in La Paz in her parents' house, which is made of bricks and has a cement floor. Yanina makes a living producing posters, invitations and other products. Yanina needs this loan in order to buy paper, plaques and other materials for making calendar invitations (i.e. with the date and larger than average paper). Yanina is single but has two children. Yanina is in good health and is responsible.

loans.use: to buy paper, plaques and other materials for making invitations.

loans.name: Faustina

texts.es: Faustina vive en concubinato y tiene tres hijos. Ella vive en la ciudad de La Paz en una casa de ladrillo y cemento que es de propiedad de su familia. Faustina es artesana y bordadora, ella necesita un credito para comprar nuevamente materiales de bordado y de artesanía. Ahora que Faustina es independiente, necesita trabajar con mayor convicción, por eso necesita su ayuda, asimismo su pareja sigue siendo chofer de transporte publico y esta colaborando con los gastos familiares
texts.en: Faustina lives with her partner and has three children. She lives in the city of La Paz in a house built with bricks and cement, and which is owned by her family. Faustina does embroidery work and makes handicrafts. She needs this loan in order to buy handicraft and embroidery materials again. Now that Faustina is independent she needs to work harder and so she needs your help. Faustino's partner continues to work as a public transport driver and is helping to pay household costs.

loans.use: to buy handicraft and embroidery materials again.

loans.name: Sevara

texts.en: Sevara is a first-year university student. She is 18 years old. Sevara studies at Khujand State University. She studies at the faculty of Russian Literature. Sevara graduated from school with excellent marks and now studies at the university successfully. She is trying to learn the Russian language perfectly and plans to be a specialist in the future. Sevara is not married and lives with her parents in the northern part of Tajikistan. She is asking for a loan to pay her tuition. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To pay her tuition

loans.name: Dúo Pachali Group

texts.es: Dúo Pachali, está representado por Lubia Masise casada y tiene 2 hijos, su esposo se dedica a la jardinería, doña lubia se dedica a la venta de lencería y ropa de niños, ella es una vendedora ambulante y su área de trabajo son los lugares  vecinos como chixoles, el manzanillo. Pachali y san Lucas, con el crédito  piensa invertir en productos en nuevos diseños de ropa ya que no cuenta con el recurso económico, ella dice que la demanda de sus productos ha aumentado ya que es la única persona que ofrece ese tipo de productos, su compañera es  doña Lilian Amarilis de 27 años de edad.
texts.en: The "Pachali" Duo is represented by Lubia Marise. She is married and has two children; her husband is a gardener. Lubia makes a living selling lingerie and children's clothes. She works as a street seller in the neighbouring areas, such as Chixoles, El Manzanillo, Pachali and San Lucas. Lubia plans to use this loan to invest in clothes of new designs as she does not have the money to buy them herself. Lubia says that demand for her products has increased as she is the only person selling these types of products. Lilian Amarilis, the other member of the duo, is 27 years old.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
This nice 32-yeaer-old lady lives in the city of Dilijan  with her husband, two sons, and parents-in-law. Margarita has a higher  education and works at the secondary institution as a teacher. She and her husband work very hard to sustain their family's needs. They hardly manage to meet the needs of their small children by the end of the month when it is time for their salary.  

Margarita says that her father-in-law  helps them financially and it is really great since if there wasn't his help they could not saved some money.  They hope to use that savings and the loan to repair their bathroom.
 
Margarita will be very happy and thankful if Kiva lenders will be so kind to help her with the loan of 400.000 AMD which together with their savings can cover all the expenses connected with the necessary repair work.

loans.use: to repair their bathroom.

loans.name: Khosiyat

texts.en:
Khosiyat is a current client of IMON with a good credit story. Khosiyat is a highly educated person with an economy degree. Khosiyat has worked in a state organization as a deputy  director for 5 years. Khosiyat is a very clever and hardworking woman. She does her job well. Her husband is a doctor. They want an education for their children.  Her daughter is a student of the fifth course. 

She is asking for a loan of 1,500 USD to pay her daughter's tuition. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to pay her daughter's tuition.

loans.name: Ruben

texts.en:
Ruben is 26 years old and  lives with his mother and brother in the village Geghamavan of Gegharkunik region. Ruben is a student and he studies at the Yerevan State Economical University.  Ruben and his brother work very hard to meet the needs of his family and to take care of their lovely mother, a housewife. 

Ruben also  farms with his brother. He has 3 cows, 3 calves, a piglet, 20 sheep, 20 beehives and 30 chickens. Thanks to his mother, his farm products are  sold. The products include milk, macun (national dairy-product), cheese, honey, meat and eggs. He grows potatoes of perfect quality because the Gegharkunik region provides the best climate conditions for this vegetable.  Ruben is happy in his nice village with his sweet family, which very soon may become bigger and happier, since he has plans to be married. 

Ruben asks for 360.000 AND  to organize autumn planting.

loans.use: to organize autumn planting.

loans.name: Mwanasiti

texts.en:
Mwanasiti is a divorced mother with four kids, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Mwanasiti operates a stall selling vegetables. She sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. With a loan of 10,000 KES, she wants to purchase vegetables, tomatoes, and onions for her business. She faces the challenge of high cost of transportation to her place of operation. She dreams of establishing and expanding a motorcycle transport business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables, tomatoes, and onions for her business

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa de 33 años de edad, estudio hasta tercer grado, ya que la escuela le quedaba muy lejos,  también por la condiciones de vida de su familia que no eran muy buenas.  Está acompañada su compañero de vida trabaja en la mecánica, tiene dos hijas.
Rosa posee un negocio de venta de repuestos y aceites para vehículos, se ha dedicado a esta actividad desde hace dos años, lo aprendió de su compañero de vida.  El negocio está en su casa.

El préstamo que está solicitando, es para comprar aceites y lubricantes, los cuales demandan sus clientes con lo que generara mayores ingresos y así tener un mejor estilo de vida.

 Sus sueños son que sus hijas puedan tener una profesión a futuro, que estudien y aprovechen la oportunidad que ella no pudo tener, también sueña con tener su casa propia ya que donde viven no es propio si no alquilado.
texts.en:
Rosa is 33 years old. She studied until the third grade, because her school was very far and because her family's living conditions were not very good. Rosa has two daughters, and her life partner works as a mechanic. 

Rosa owns a business selling spare parts and oil for vehicles. She has dedicated herself to this business for two years and learned it from her partner. The business is in her home.

Rosa is requesting this loan to purchase oils and lubricants, which her clients have been requesting. With these items, she will generate better revenues and thus improve her way of life.

Rosa's dreams are that her daughters become professionals in the future, and that they study and take advantage of the opportunity that Rosa herself did not have. She also dreams of having her own home, since their current home is rented and doesn't belong to them.

loans.use: to purchase oils and lubricants, which her customers have been requesting, and which will generate better revenues so that she can improve her way of life.

loans.name: Varduhi

texts.en:
Varduhi is 37 years old and lives with her small family in Stepanavan in the Lori region. She is married and has a nice 2-year-old daughter. She has a higher pedagogical education and has been working for eight years at a school as a teacher of Armenian Language and Literature.
