She also sells milk to generate an extra amount of income. 

Maroof needs to improve her business to bear her household expenses. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and availed a murabaha loan of PKR 35,000 to purchase more animals to expand her business and income level.

loans.use: to purchase more animals to expand her business and income level.

loans.name: Turdukan

texts.ru: Турдукан, 74 года, вдова, есть взрослый сын. Более 30 лет назад Турдукан стала занимается сельским хозяйством- животноводством и полеводством. Сейчас ей помогает сын. В хозяйстве есть 4 дойные коровы, 4 нетели, 2 бычка, 1 лошадь и 20 овец. Также на участке мерою 2,70 Га Турдукан выращивает картофель, пшеницу, ячмень и эспарцет. Образование у Турдукан среднее, она очень трудолюбивая и ответственная. Молоко и сельскохозяйственная продукция пользуются большим спросом. Однако средств на достойную жизнь не хватает, а ей так хочется помогать сыну и иметь возможность купить ему отдельный дом. Поэтому Турдукан обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом, в сумме 130,000 сом (KGS) на покупку бычков. После откорма, она сможет реализовать их по привлекательной цене, улучшив материальное положение и накопив средства на покупку дома для сына.
texts.en: Turdukan is 74 years old, a widow and has an adult son. Turdukan became involved in agriculture -  animal husbandry and farming - over 30 years ago. Her son now helps her. Her business contains 4 dairy cows, 4 heifers, 2 bulls, 1 horse and 20 sheep. Turdukan also grows potatoes, wheat, barley and sainfoin on 2.70 hectares of land. Turdukan has a secondary education. She is very hardworking and responsible. Milk and agricultural products are in high demand; however, she does not have enough money for a decent life and really wants to help her son, and have an ability to buy him his own house. This is why Turdukan requested a loan in the amount of 130,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum" Bank to buy bulls. After fattening them up, she will be able to sell them at an attractive price, thus, improving her financial situation and saving money to buy a house for her son.

loans.use: to buy bulls for fattening and resale in order to grow her income

loans.name: Nazia

texts.en:
Nazia is a 41-year-old married woman and the mother of four children. For about seven years, she is been in work of hand embroidery. She makes beautiful patterns for the people of her community. Her designs are in high demand, and she has managed to consolidate a clientele that allows her to contribute to the expenses of her home. 

To help her to continue her operations, she has taken a murabaha loan of 25,000 PKR to buy reels of threads in different colors along with packs of beads, sequins and stones for its embellishment. In this way, she would be able to cater more customers consistently. She hopes to increase her income by targeting more customers. 

Nazia dreams for her children's bright future and desires to increase her business.

loans.use: to buy reels of threads in different colors along with packs of beads, sequins and stones for its embellishment.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Hello lenders! Meet Lydia, 34 years of age and a very hardworking and self-driven farmer, who is based in Kaptumo, a remote village in Nandi Hills. This region has harsh weather patterns, and poultry farming is the only profitable business venture that thrives. 

Lydia is happily married and blessed with four children. For the past 10 years she has been involved in mixed farming, and her primary source of income has been selling milk and crop farming. She passionately loves poultry farming. When asked what is most enjoyable about farming, her reply was “selling eggs.” Her biggest challenge is the lack of funds to increase her poultry farming. She is seeking a loan to buy additional poultry. Poultry farming is the only business that thrives in the Nandi Hills area, so she wants to take full advantage of the poultry business. 

Lydia is a member of Arise and Shine, and through the group they have received training on financial management and saving. Through the loan she will sell eggs to the local market and to her neighbors, hence improving her living conditions, and getting out of the poverty situation she is in currently. Profits from the loan will be used to repay the loan and to increase her business.

loans.use: to pay for additional poultry.

loans.name: Halime

texts.en:
Halime is married with two children. Her son is married, and her daughter is studying at university. For many years she has been cooking at home and serving her food to small businesses, but due to family and social pressure she stopped her business. She is an entrepreneur who has been held back. Her family does not support her; on the contrary, they have been an obstacle.  Economically she is in need and would like to have a loan from Maya to buy food to cook and to continue her business.  


Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff 
Halime Hanım,2 çocuklu,oğlunu evlendirmiş.  Kızı ünversitede okuyor.  Yıllardır evden yemek yapıp,esnafa servis ediyor.  Aslında dükkanda açmış.  Ancak,aile baskısı,çevre baskısı dükkanı kapamış.  Girişimci bir kadın ama engel olunuyor.  Aile destek vermiyor.  Aksine engel olmaya çalışıyor.  Ekonomik  olarak sıkıntıya düşmüş.  İşine devam edemez hale gelmiş.  Maya’dan aldığı kredi ile yemek yapmak için malzeme alacak.

loans.use: to buy food to cook.

loans.name: Phal

texts.en:
Phal is 50 years of age. Her great skill in hand embroidery and experience of eight years in this field has given her a very good reputation in her community. Over time, the demand for her hand embroidery has grown, and she uses the income generated to pay for the expenses of her family. 

Phal has now requested a murabaha loan of 20,000 PKR with which she wants to purchase more spools of thread, measuring tape, embroidery scissors, frames and tracing paper. She hopes that her skill will help in providing for her family’s health expenses.

loans.use: to purchase more spools of threads, measuring tape, embroidery scissors, frames and tracing paper.

loans.name: Tareq

texts.en:
Tareq is a 25-year-old single man who opened a grocery shop a year ago to help in covering the needs and expenses of his family.

Today, Tareq is acquiring a YOUTH loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to expand his business through buying a new stand of cleaning products which will help him in attracting more customers and satisfying their needs.

He hopes to expand his business more in the future to increase his income and improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a new stand of cleaning products

loans.name: Zhakesha

texts.ru: Жакеша, 31 год, замужем, детей нет, но в ближайшее время планируют. У нее среднее образование, в качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи Жакеша занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав 11 лет назад с суммы 8,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду, Жакеша на сегодняшний день имеет 2 коровы, 2 бычка. Также у нее есть 1,04 ГА собственной земельной доли, на которой она выращивает пшеницу, ячмень и эспарцет. Также на ежедневной основе она реализует молоко. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Жакеша обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 80,000 сом (KGS) на покупку бычков для откорма и реализации.  Доходы от кредита Жакеша планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие своего бизнеса, чтобы иметь возможность купить машину для своей семьи.
texts.en: Zhakesha is 31 years old, married, does not yet have children, but is expecting in the near future. She has a secondary education, and to provide the primary source of income for her family, Zhakesha is involved in animal husbandry and farming, having started this business 11 years ago with 8,000 som (KGS). Thanks to her hard work, today Zhakesha's business contains 2 cows and 2 bulls. She also has a 1.04 hectare land plot, where she grows wheat, barley and sainfoin. She also sells milk on a daily basis. In order to further develop her business, Zhakesha requested a loan in the amount of 80,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum" Bank to buy bulls for fattening up and resale. Zhakesha is planning to invest the earnings from the loan into further growing her business in order to have an ability to buy a car for her family.

loans.use: to buy bulls for fattening up and resale

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is married and has four children, three of whom attend school. She operates a business selling used clothes at the market on a retail basis seven days a week, which she has been doing for 11 years. She earns additional income from selling soft drinks. Her major business challenges include seasonality and transportation. 

Betty requested a loan from MCDT-SACCO for 2,000,000 UGX, which she will use to buy a bale of used clothes. She hopes to own a fully stocked shop selling different types of used clothes and shoes. She decided to join MCDT-SACCO because of good customer care. She lives in rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees.

loans.use: to purchase a bale of used clothes

loans.name: Myskal

texts.ru: Мыскал 56 лет, замужем, все дети Мыскал взрослые и самостоятельные. Муж активно помогает по хозяйству. Мыскал имеет средне-специальное образование, по характеру она очень спокойная и позитивная женщина. В качестве основного источника дохода для семьи, она занимается животноводством и полеводством. Начатое со стартовой суммы в 5,000 сом (KGS) в далеком 1977 году, сегодня хозяйство приносит около 15,000 сом (KGS) в месяц. На данный момент в хозяйстве Мыскал имеется 2 коровы, 1 лошадь, 15 овец. На земельном участке мерою 1,30 Га она выращивает ячмень. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, она обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коров для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита она планирует направлять на дальнейшее развитие ее бизнеса, чтобы накопить средства на строительство сарая для скота.
texts.en: Myskal is 56 years old, married, and all of her children are grown and independent. Her husband actively helps her with the business. Myskal has a secondary-specialized education. She is a very calm and positive woman. To provide the primary source of income for her family, she is involved in animal husbandry and farming. This business started with 5,000 som (KGS) in a distant 1977, now yields about 15,000 som (KGS) per month. At the present time, Myskal's business contains 2 cows, 1 horse and 15 sheep. She also grows barley on 1.30 hectares of land. In order to further develop her business, Myskal requested a loan in the amount of 50,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum" Bank to buy cows to increase her livestock headcount. She is planning to direct the earnings from the loan toward a continued business growth in order to save money to build a barn for livestock.

loans.use: to buy cows in order to increase her livestock headcount

loans.name: Selly

texts.en:
Hello, wonderful lenders! Meet Selly, a 52-year-old, energetic, self-driven and hard-working small-scale farmer who is based in Kaptumo, a remote village in the Nandi Hills area of Kenya. She is a proud mother of four good-looking children and through hard work she has single-handedly raised her  children whom she refers to as “my pride.” She has been actively  involved in mixed farming for the past 15 years and has never looked back. Her primary income sources have been egg-selling and crop-selling. 

Selly also engages in small personal business or, as she likes to put it, “side hustle” to make ends meet. Selly passionately loves poultry farming and wakes up early every morning to feed her poultry and collect eggs. Demand for eggs and poultry meat has been overwhelming and she has been unable to satisfy the demand. So, she is seeking a loan to buy additional poultry. 

When asked what is the biggest challenge she faces, Selly replied, “being unable to access funds.” Women have a bigger challenge accessing financial solutions, but Selly feels relieved that there are partners such as Kiva lenders who assist aspiring women to achieve their goals. Through your loan she will be able to buy good breeds of poultry that have high productivity and high resistance to diseases. Increased productivity will immediately translate to more income and improved living standards. Her crops will benefit from poultry manure, which has a high amount of nitrogen as compared to any other livestock manure. Selly will save more money by not having to buy fertilizer. The extra income will be used to repay the loan and secure the future of her children since she is the only breadwinner.

loans.use: To pay for poultry

loans.name: José Rubén

texts.es:
José de 37 años de edad, no estudio ningún grado académico, su esposa se dedica a trabajar en la compra  y venta de pescado,  sus hijos están estudiando en la escuela de la comunidad.
José desde que estaba muy pequeño se ha dedicado a trabajar como pescador artesanal, ya que su padre y hermanos sean dedicado a esta misma actividad, actualmente posee su propia lancha con la que va a pescar por las noches se va a la una de la mañana para salir como a las 5 de la mañana, ya que también trabaja como corralero en una granja donde tiene que ordeñar una buena cantidad de animales bovinos, esto lo hace todos los días y los días, cuando no trabaja como corralero se dedica a trabajar como albañil ya que también esta actividad se la enseño su padre.
El préstamo que está solicitando, es para comprar cemento, bloque, arena, hierro para terminar de arreglar la vivienda, ya que esta contruyendo otra habitación, ya que a aumentado el número de personas en su familia y quiere que estén mas cómodos en la casa.
José espera lograr construir una cocina, ya que la que tiene solo es de lámina como techo y sacar adelante a sus hijos dándoles el estudio para que se puedan superar y logren mejores trabajos cuando crezcan .
texts.en:
José is 37 years old. He never went to school. His wife makes a living through the purchase and sale of fish and his two children are students at the local school. Since he was very little and like his father and brothers, José has made a living as a fisherman. Now he has his own boat which he uses to fish at night, between one 1:00 and 5:00 in the morning. He also works as ranch hand at a farm where he has to milk a lot of cattle. He does this every day and even when he is not, he works as a bricklayer, another job that his father showed him how to do.

The loan that he is asking for is to purchase cement, cement blocks, sand and iron to finish improving his home, as he is currently building another room. He is building this room because the size of his family has increased and he wants them to be more comfortable at home. José hopes to be able to build a kitchen as his current one only has a tin roof. He also hopes to help his children progress, providing them with schooling so that they can pass their exams and obtain better jobs when they are older.

loans.use: to purchase cement, cement blocks, sand and iron to finish improving his home, as he is currently building another room.

loans.name: Gul  Nargis

texts.en:
Gul Nargis is 27 years old and a married woman. She is the mother of one child, who is also shown in the photo. The man shown in the photo is Gul Nargis’s husband. He runs a shop selling spare parts to meet the family's expenses. He offers various spare parts for different vehicles. 

For the improvement of her husband’s business, Gul Nargis availed a murabaha loan of 30,000 PKR. In this way, her husband was able to purchase more spare parts of good quality to increase his sales and profits alongside.

loans.use: to purchase more spare parts of good quality to increase sales and profits.

loans.name: Ismae'el

texts.en:
Ismae'el is 38 years old and lives with his wife and four children in Gaza. He has worked as a tailor since ten years. The family lives a simple life, helping each other hand by hand to ensure the good life conditions and avoid asking help from anyone.

After the last war at Gaza, the family conditions worsened, especially since Ismae'el and his family were forced to leave their house and live at the UN schools at Gaza. Now he requests this loan to start over in his life with his small family. He wants to install electricity, water, windows and doors. Ismae'el is very grateful to everyone who helps him.

loans.use: to install electricity, water, windows and doors.

loans.name: Saleh

texts.en:
Saleh is a 51-year-old married man and a father of four children. He lives with his family in a rented house in the city of Mokala, Yemen. He has a secondary education, but he couldn't complete his studies. Saleh is the sole breadwinner of the family, and his income is not enough to cover the necessary needs of his family. 

One of Saleh's children is a student in a university. The house where Saleh and his family live is very far from the university where their son studies. The transportation to reach the university costs him a lot of money. Saleh decided to purchase a motorcycle for his son to use as transportation from his house to the university and back home again. Saleh doesn't have enough money to purchase it at this time. As a result, he applied for a loan of 200,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase a motorcycle for his son to use as transportation.
 
Saleh looks forward to purchasing a car to use as transportation for himself and his family.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle for his son to use as transportation.

loans.name: Sawsan

texts.en: Sawsan is a 40-year-old divorced woman who works in security to meet the needs and expenses of her family for she is their sole earner. Today, Sawsan is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to renovate her house and make it a healthier and better place for her beloved kids. She hopes to get a promotion in her work to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to renovate her house

loans.name: Tinisa

texts.en:
Tinisa is 30 years old and lives in  Mundri in the Western Equatorial state region of South Sudan. She is married and has one child. For the past three years, Tinisa has been working hard to manage her produce stand, selling lemons, tomatoes, onions, and oil. 

Tinisa  requested a loan which she will use to increase her business.

loans.use: To buy more food items for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase poultry

loans.name: Goretti

texts.en:
Goretti is married with six children, three of whom go to school. She also has additional family members. 

Goretti is a tailor. She operates her business from home on a retail basis. She has been in this business for eight years. She has applied for a loan of 1,200,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy rolls of materials to make clothes. 

Goretti also generates income from selling piped water from home. She sells on a retail basis seven days a week. Her major business challenges include seasonality and transportation. She aspires to build rental houses to diversify her income. 

She decided to join MCDT SACCO because of good customer care. She lives in her own house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and food.

loans.use: To buy rolls of materials for making clothes

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is married with three children, two of whom go to school. She also has additional family members. She sells charcoal at the market on a retail and wholesale basis, and has been in this business for seven years. She also generates additional income from poultry farming.  

She has applied for a loan of 1,600,000 UGX from MCDT-SACCO to buy bags of charcoal.  She sells on retail basis seven days a week. Her major business challenges include seasonality and transportation. She is aspiring to buy a plot of land and also expanding her sales in her charcoal business. She decided to join MCDT-SACCO because of timely loans. She lives in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees.

loans.use: to buy bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Gidion

texts.en:
It's a normal thing to have a chicken farm in Kenya, but to start an actual business out of it is something else entirely. Gidion is a smallholder mixed-farmer based in Kaptumo village. He has been practicing mixed farming for the last five years.

To earn a decent living, he makes income selling milk, eggs and engaging in numerous small personal businesses or “side hustles” as he likes to call them. Only recently, he started seeing how he could be making big money off poultry farming. Raising hens to Gideon is something close to a hobby. He wants to sell eggs, but figures the quantity he produces won't make economic sense. He needs to purchase more poultry. However, his biggest challenge today is limited funds to expand.

Gidion is seeking a loan from Kiva lenders via Juhudi Kilimo to purchase poultry.  Future proceeds from the commercialization of his poultry farm are already committed to pay for his siblings’ education and his children to come. In the long run, he is confident his efforts will translate into his family having a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy poultry.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is married with four children, all of whom go to school. She has additional family members as well. She operates a beauty salon at the market on retail basis and has been in this business for 11 years. 

Joyce has applied for a loan of 1,500,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy hair relaxers, treatments, oils, braids and weaves. She sells on retail basis seven days a week. Her major business challenges include power shortages which interrupt their businesses. She aspires to buy a plot of land to start farming. 

She decided to join MCDT SACCO because of good customer care. She lives in her own house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees.

loans.use: To buy braids, weaves, treatments, relaxers and oils

loans.name: Anastasia

texts.en:
Anastasia is a 31 year old woman who adds additional income to support her family.  She is married to Nicholus and they are blessed with two children.  Anastasia has been operating a retail shop for a period of two years earning herself an income of KES. 6,000 at the end of every month.

Anastasia was introduced to VisionFund Kenya by a Credit Officer and is now servicing her first loan of KES.10,000.  She intends to use this amount to buy sugar, rice, detergents, wheat flour and maize flour to sell to her customers on a daily basis.

Anastasia plans to use the anticipated income to pay school fees for her children and hopes to become a successful businesswoman.

loans.use: To buy sugar, rice, detergents, wheat flour and maize flour.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a smallholder farmer who lives in Kapsumai in the North Rift region of Kenya. She relies on maize farming and dairy sales to look after her family of four children. After three years in farming, she has developed a deep, passionate interest in dairy farming. She named her cow Chelege (local vernacular for blemish).

Rose is seeking a loan to purchase another dairy cow. The new cow will double the volume of milk production on the farm. This will elevate Rose's livelihood and the quality of life led by her children. 

She stated that the increased income will go to loan repayment and her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow
